properties.title: GoldenPass Express
properties.lead_text: The GoldenPass Express redefines the travel experience between Interlaken and Montreux.
properties.description:
The journey on the GoldenPass Express is like a foray through Switzerland. The trip starts in picturesque Interlaken and continues via Gstaad, Château-d’OEx and Montboven to Montreux, the journey’s final stop.

The new Prestige Class is the centrepiece of the new train. The exclusive travel class offers discerning travellers everything they expect from an unforgettable train journey: plenty of privacy, maximum comfort in a small compartment, and an exceptional culinary offering.

Due to limited seating capacity, reservations for Prestige Class are mandatory - and strongly recommended for 1st and 2nd class travel.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Glacier 3000
properties.lead_text: Journey to a unique glacier world for adventure, architecture and sights.
properties.description:
The ascent by cableway to this unique Swiss glacier world will unveil not just an Alpine scenery to write home about. Additionally, the summit station designed by architect Mario Botta is an architectural highlight. Inside, enjoy a "Botta Brunch" or skip the restaurant and gear up for a hike or for downhill skiing instead. 

At Glacier 3000, a stunning panorama of no fewer than two dozen snow-capped giants above 4,000 m a.s.l. reveals itself: Eiger, Mönch, Jungfrau, Matterhorn, Grand Combin and even Mont Blanc in the distance.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Lake Geneva Cruises
properties.lead_text: How about cruising on Central Europe’s largest inland lake? On Lake Geneva, this is a possibility!
properties.description:
The Belle Epoque boats have been navigating Lake Geneva for 140 years, offering fantastic cruises between France and Switzerland. The views from the boat extend from harbours and castles (Chillon, Morges, Rolle, Yvoire, among others) over vineyards to the snow-covered summits of the Swiss and Savoyan Alps.

Pick either the Swiss or the French side of the lake to embark and disembark. The boat landings are starting points for many exploration activities including city tours of Geneva, Lausanne, Montreux, or Vevey.

properties.title: Absinthe Museum
properties.lead_text: Get an insight into the eventful history of the “green fairy” and its secrets.
properties.description:
The Absinthe Museum is located on the premises of the former district court, the very place where illegal absinth distillers were once brought to justice. This liquor has been produced in the Canton of Neuchâtel since the 18th century, but only since 2005 has it been legal to produce. 

You can find out all about the “green fairy” at the three-storey museum, which includes antique objects from the Belle Epoque, poetry, and the importance of absinthe to the local economy and around the world. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Zweisimmen
properties.lead_text: The quaint village of Zweisimmen is a departure point for high-altitude hikes.
properties.description:
The quaint village of Zweisimmen lies at the confluence of the Grosse and Kleine Simme rivers. It forms the gateway to the world-famous Gstaad-Saanenland region and is a departure point for high-altitude hikes throughout the region.

At the Zweisimmen station, those traveling south will change to the gold-coloured Panoramic or Belle Epoque trains of the Montreux-Bernese Oberland Railway (MOB). Since 2019, a gauge conversion system enables passengers to travel direct to the Lake Geneva Region.

Zweisimmen is part of the Grand Train Tour of Switzerland.

properties.title: Schilthorn
properties.lead_text: The minute you get off the cableway, you are surrounded by panoramic views.
properties.description:
At 2,970 metres above sea, the Schilthorn welcomes you with sweeping views of the panoramic Swiss “skyline”: Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau. The rotating restaurant serves the infamous “James Bond” burger as a tribute to the former film set.

“Piz Gloria”, as the Schilthorn was called in the movie, allows you to follow in James Bond’s footsteps by visiting the interactive adventure exhibition “Bond World 007” or on the “007 Walk of Fame”. Unusual and truly bottomless perspectives open up on the “Skyline Walk” and the “Thrill Walk” at the intermediate stop Birg.

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Schilthorn.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount on your trip to Schilthorn with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Rigi
properties.lead_text: There is more than one reason why Mount Rigi is touted "Queen of the Mountains".
properties.description: In 1871, Europe's first mountain railway made it to this striking viewpoint. Today, two cogwheel railways – one from Vitznau and one from Arth-Goldau – take you gracefully up to Rigi Kulm and its historic summit hotel. From Weggis, an aerial cableway whisks passengers directly up to Rigi-Kaltbad. The summit view across 13 lakes, into the Alps and as far away as the Black Forest delights guests from near and far.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Gornergrat
properties.lead_text: The best views of the Matterhorn can be had at the summit of the Gornergrat at 3,089 metres above sea.
properties.description:
Surrounded by no fewer than 29 giants above 4000 m a.s.l., including the majestic Matterhorn and the Dufourspitze, a trip to Gornergrat will reward you with an epic experience. From the mountain station, it is just footsteps to a lookout point over the third-longest glacier of the Alps.

In summer, marvel at the reflection of the Matterhorn on the surface of the Riffelsee and enjoy great hiking trails on this adventure mountain. In winter, the beautiful tobogganing run from Rotenboden to Riffelberg is just one of the experiences on offer. Sunny slopes, a children’s ski park and snowball fights on the winter hiking trails are just some of the reasons why we recommend the Gornergrat.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Jungfraujoch – Top of Europe
properties.lead_text: A visit to the Jungfraujoch among the eternal ice puts a jewel in the crown of any visit to Switzerland.
properties.description:
For more than 100 years, the Jungfrau railway has been making its journey to Europe’s highest-altitude railway station at 3,454 metres a.s.l. – right at the heart of the UNESCO heritage site “Swiss Alps Jungfrau-Aletsch”. All through the year, the cog railway runs steeply up from Kleine Scheidegg through a tunnel to the Jungfraujoch.

The tunnel leading up from the station Eigergletscher is seven kilometres in length and was built between 1896 and 1912. One stop within the tunnel offers spectacular views onto the glacier world outside through windows. On the summit, you will be greeted by a high-Alpine wonder world made of ice, snow and rocks. All of this can be marvelled at from the viewing platforms “Sphinx” and “Plateau” on the Aletsch glacier or from the “Ice Palace”.
properties.area_of_validity: 25% discount with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) from Wengen/Grindelwald to Jungfraujoch

properties.title: Luzern–Interlaken Express
properties.lead_text: This train line connects Lucerne and Interlaken, two of Switzerland’s most popular tourist destinations.
properties.description:
The Luzern-Interlaken Express turns the journey from one city to the other into a great experience. During a train ride of roughly two hours, passengers marvel at five crystal clear mountain lakes that gather the waters from various rivers and waterfalls. At the lake shore, steep rock faces of surrounding mountains rise up protectively and provide unique photo motifs.

Shortly before starting its steep, winding ascent to Brünig Pass, the train changes to cogwheel drive train technology in order to conquer the gradient. With good reason, the Luzern-Interlaken Express is part of the scenic GoldenPass Line leading to Interlaken and on to Montreux.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: GoldenPass Panoramic
properties.lead_text: The GoldenPass Panoramic train links the German and French speaking regions, showing Switzerland’s diverse cultural heritage.
properties.description:
From Zweisimmen, the premium panoramic train starts out towards Montreux. It feels almost as if the passing scenery had been created specifically for this panoramic journey – one lovely view follows the other: Cows grazing on lush, green pastures, traditional wooden chalet-style houses nestling in the gentle hills, all of it against the backdrop of magnificent Alpine peaks.

And the best is saved for last: Shortly before Montreux, a fantastic view over glistening Lake Geneva opens up to the passengers. The train leisurely winds its way down the hill and puts guests in the perfect mood for the Geneva Region and its Mediterranean flair. The GoldenPass Panoramic is part of the scenic GoldenPass Line and belongs to the Grand Train Tour of Switzerland.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Glacier Express
properties.lead_text: The eight-hour journey on the world's slowest express train is a bucket list experience.
properties.description:
On the relaxing route from dazzling St. Moritz to equally sophisticated Zermatt, the Glacier Express will delight with scenic attractions and state-of-the-art achievements. Within roughly eight hours, you will be passing through 91 tunnels and across 291 bridges.

Thanks to its large panoramic windows, the Glacier Express opens up unobstructed views of unique landscapes. You can travel this section of Switzerland's rail network by the special panorama trains or by regular daily scheduled services. With a GA travelcard or a Swiss Travel Pass, all you have to pay for on panorama trains is the compulsory seat reservation fee and any meals or refreshments. Regular scheduled services require no seat reservation.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Bernina Express
properties.lead_text: This panoramic train connects the north of Europe to its south – right through a UNESCO World Heritage site.
properties.description:
Fresh mountain air and stunning views from the Albula and Bernina rail lines: during summer, open panorama coaches are available on the Bernina Express between Davos Platz and Tirano. The open air coaches truly bring you closer to nature and let you take perfect photos of the breathtaking scenery.

Crossing the Alps in the Bernina Express certainly is one of the most spectacular ways to do it. Along the way, the Bernina Express rolls Hollywood-style over the 65 meter tall Landwasser Viaduct, the signature structure of the Rhaetian Railway and the UNESCO World Heritage site.

Altogether the train passes through 55 tunnels and over 196 bridges on its way from Chur to Tirano. Travellers are treated to marvellous sights during their journey, like the Montebello curve with a view of the Bernina massif, the Morteratsch glacier, the three lakes Lej Pitschen, Lej Nair and Lago Bianco, the Alp Grüm and the Brusio Circular Viaduct.

In summer, the journey can be extended from Tirano to Lugano aboard the Bernina Express Bus.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Lake Lucerne Cruises
properties.lead_text: Admire attractions from the vantage point of beautiful Lake Lucerne.
properties.description:
Meet the paddle steamer flotilla of the Alpine world: On 38 kilometres of waterway, the five nostalgic paddle steamers and 15 elegant salon motor vessels show passengers everything that impressive Alpine nature has to offer.

Not only the historical sites but also the breath-taking panorama around Lake Lucerne can be savoured from the perspective of a boat – admire attractions up close as well as in the distance.

The boats cruise throughout the year on a daily basis, thereby making famous holiday destination like the Bürgenstock, many hiking trails, and mountain railway stations at the shores of the lake accessible.

Among other attractive offers of Lake Lucerne Cruises are: Lunch Cruise (daily throughout all seasons), Cake on the Lake Cruise, romantic Sunset Cruises, Fondue Cruise, India Buffet Cruise, Jazz cruises on a steamboat as well as many other culinary and musical theme cruises. Additionally, elegant and innovative catering services are available on all main and some side routes.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) on scheduled boats

properties.title: Kambly Round Trip "Cookie Train"
properties.lead_text: The Kambly round trip connects Switzerland’s capital Bern with Lucerne and Interlaken.
properties.description:
The "Cookie Train" tour leads through the rolling hills of the Emmental valley, providing breathtaking views over beautiful mountains and valleys. During a single day, you will get to experience the magnificent backdrop of snow-covered summits while travelling along deep blue, pristine lakes, lush green meadows and picturesque farms.

At the heart of idyllic Emmental valley, the train stops right in front of the Kambly Experience at Trubschachen. This show confectionary is one of the highlights of this trip, as you can discover Kambly's origins and learn about where the raw ingredients for their biscuits are sourced.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Globi Express from Lucerne to Engelberg
properties.lead_text: Globi Express travels the route from Lucerne to Engelberg and is pure fun for the whole family.
properties.description:
For those who did not know: Globi is a Swiss children's book character which is loved by many. A specially designed coach between Lucerne and Engelberg carries our youngest guests away to a bright Globi world! The decor includes colourful walls, Globi books and much more.

Globi experiences all sorts of adventures on his journey through the four seasons. Globi pictures that show him during typical seasonal activities keep appearing between Lucerne and Engelberg. Young ones are eagerly trying to answer age-adjusted questions about the places they see in the pictures. Any child who manages at least four correct answers out of six can look forward to a nice present at Engelberg station.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Chocolate Train between Montreux and Gruyères
properties.lead_text: The Chocolate train is a fun experience not only for those with a “sweet tooth”, but also for railway enthusiasts.
properties.description:
One simply cannot visit Switzerland without sampling Switzerland’s most famous specialty – Swiss chocolate. It's a good thing the Montreux-Berner Oberland railway (MOB) has dedicated an entire train to the world’s most delicate temptation. In the stately “Belle Époche”-Pullman vintage coaches from 1915 and/or in modern panorama coaches, you are travelling in style – in 1st class only.

The Chocolate train runs between Montreux and the Cailler-Nestlé chocolate factory at Broc.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

images.title: Chocolate Train between Montreux and Gruyères

images.description: Chocolate Train between Montreux and Gruyères

properties.title: Cheese Train, Montreux
properties.lead_text: Since 2013, the Cheese train has been revealing the secrets of Switzerland’s most popular dairy product.
properties.description:
Every Friday to Sunday between January and April, the “Train du Fromage”, or Cheese train, runs between Montreux and Chateau d’Oex in the Lake Geneva region. 

Whether mild or spicy, creamy or hard – each year the Swiss eat some 21 kg of cheese per capita. The “Train du Fromage” takes a closer look at the most popular dairy product. Each winter, the Montreux-Berner Oberland-Bahn (MOB) adds a special train to its Pays-d’Enhaut route for this 5.5 hours round trip.

On the way from either Montreux or Zweisimmen to Château-d’Oex, you will enjoy some delicious cheese and a glass of regional wine while the train rolls past lovely landscapes. But how is cheese actually made? “Le Chalet Bio” answers this question. In the cozy restaurant with an integrated show dairy, a cheese with the same name is produced in the traditional manner over wood fire.

You will experience up close how the tasty hard cheese is made from 200 litres of organic milk. Right then and there, you can convince yourself of how delicious the cheese tastes by enjoying an organic fondue. After lunch, the “Vieux Pays-d’Enhaut” museum is well worth a visit.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Lötschberg Mountain Route and Centovalli
properties.lead_text: Sometimes, a long and winding route is the best way to reach a destination.
properties.description:
The Swiss may be straightforward, but this panorama journey is not. The ride on the Lötschberger from Bern to Brig does not lead through the Lötschberg Base Tunnel. Instead, you will be travelling along the century-old mountain route.

From Brig, the town of Domodossola is within easy reach. Domodossola is also the town from where the Centovalli railway takes you to sunny Locarno. There is much to marvel at during the ride along the 50 kilometres of this narrow gauge line: some 83 bridges and viaducts, light chestnut forests and the delightful Merlot des Ticino vineyards. By the way: this delicious wine is best sampled during one of the many hiking tours that the region offers. Cheers!
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Lago Maggiore Express – Day Trip
properties.lead_text: The Lago Maggiore Express is an unforgettable day trip by rail and boat.
properties.description:
Starting at the Locarno railway station, the trip takes you through the Centovalli to Domodossola by train. The ride through the "hundred valleys" and the Val Vigezzo is truly memorable.

From Arona, a boat then takes you back to Locarno over the Lago Maggiore. Seat reservations for individual travellers are recommended. You may embark on this trip at any point along the way.
properties.area_of_validity: Combined ticket “Lago Maggiore Express” available

properties.title: Central Alps Passes by PostBus
properties.lead_text: Tackle four of the most impressive Swiss Alpine passes by PostBus in a single day.
properties.description:
This panorama tour represents the ultimate experience for Alpine enthusiasts! You will be negotiating a total of 10,366 metres (approx. 34,000 feet) in altitude, with scenic spots such as the Grimsel Pass. There, your bus will ride past glittering reservoir lakes with many scenic views. Then, Switzerland’s highest Alpine transition negotiable by vehicle, the Nufenen Pass, will surely get your pulse racing...

The Gotthard, nicknamed “King of Mountain Passes”, has been an important north-south trans-Alpine connection since the days of the Roman Empire. Along the way to the Susten Pass, the PostBus crosses no fewer than 25 bridges – and passes through just as many tunnels.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Lake Thun
properties.lead_text: The largest lake located entirely within a single Swiss canton marvels with its deep blue waters.
properties.description:
Embedded within an imposing backdrop of mountains, the deeply blue Lake Thun lies on the northern periphery of the Alps, between the Bernese Oberland towns of Thun and Interlaken. The largest lake located entirely within a single Swiss canton, it is especially popular among sailors and windsurfers who appreciate the prevailing light breeze. As you pass through, why not stop at one of the numerous shores for a swim in the lake?

The BLS vessels offer a variety of interesting theme cruises and relaxing round trips from Thun. The undisputed star is the historic “Blümlisalp” paddle steamer, a classic boat built in 1906.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Stoos
properties.lead_text: Hop onto the world's steepest funicular!
properties.description:
Going uphill is rarely this comfortable: The cabins of the steepest funicular in the world adapt to the most extreme inclination. In this way, you are always on a horizontal surface. But there isn't much time to enjoy the comfortable ride, as it takes just a bit more than three minutes to go up the 743 m of altitude.

The village of Stoos is set in a delightful mountain landscape on a sunny Alpine plateau. The little village with its hotels and holiday apartments is an ideal holiday destination for families. At 1,922 m a.s.l., the Fronalpstock peak can be reached on foot or with a chairlift. 

Unlimited travel to Stoos is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Schynige Platte
properties.lead_text: This great experience starts right when you step into the open coaches of the nostalgic cog railway.
properties.description:
The Schynige Platte is located right at the heart of the Jungfrau region. On the historic cog railway, you will instantly feel as if you were carried back to the Belle Époche. The wooden benches on the coaches as well as the vintage rolling stock date from the nineteenth century.

The mountain station at 1,967 m a.s.l. is the starting point for various delightful circular hikes. It is also home to the Alpine garden with some 650 plant species. The magnificent views can best be savoured from the panorama restaurant “Schynige Platte”, where you will be treated with delicious Swiss specialties.

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Schynige Platte.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Sunnegga and Rothorn in Zermatt
properties.lead_text: According to locals, Sunegga provides the best views of the Matterhorn.
properties.description:
The mountain trip to Sunnegga starts with the underground funicular. If you are lucky, you may discover marmots at one of the observation points. A miniature funicular takes you down to the idyllic Lake Leisee. The journey continues by gondola lift to Blauherd. A walk along the marmots theme trail leads back to Sunnegga – and the "Seenweg" lake path to the valley of the Findel Glacier.

Finally, a large cableway takes visitors to the Unterrothorns summit – from where stunning views comprise many of the 38 four-thousand-metre-high-peaks surrounding the Valais region.

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Sunnegga and Rothorn.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Rochers-de-Naye
properties.lead_text: Just atop Montreux, a singular panoramic view awaits: the Swiss and French Alps, as well as Lavaux and Lake Geneva.
properties.description:
At 2,000 metres a.s.l., you will get to enjoy delightful hikes, observe marmot species from three continents and look at hundreds of plants from around the world.

The railway up to Rochers-de-Naye operates year-round, and the trip from Montreux to the summit takes 54 minutes.

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Rochers-de-Naye.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Pilatus
properties.lead_text: Mount Pilatus is close to Lucerne and easily accessible by public transport. It is the ideal adventure mountain for the whole family!
properties.description:
Pilatus peaks at 2,132 m a.s.l., with scenic vistas of Lake Lucerne and the surrounding Alps. Among the many exciting attractions are: the world’s steepest cog railway departing from Alpnachstad, two cableways from Kriens, as well as Central Switzerland’s biggest rope park. Also, there are five restaurants and two hotels.

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Pilatus.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Monte Generoso
properties.lead_text: Come visit the highest mountain of the Canton of Ticino near the Italian border! With 1,704 metres altitude, it offers a magnificent all-around scenic experience.
properties.description:
Meet with a 360° panoramic view of the Swiss and Savoy Alps, scenic hiking paths, an observatory and the most exquisite architecture. Right next to the summit station, Mario Botta’s masterpiece “Fiore di petra” (stone flower) is located – the new landmark of the mountain. You can admire the building already from afar while approaching by cog railway over the nine kilometre long line leading from Capolago at Lake Lugano to the summit. During the summer, you can also choose to travel up the mountain on a nostalgic steam train. The lower station in Capolago can be reached conveniently by boat or railway. 

The railway to Monte Generoso is in operation during the summer season (April to beginning of November).

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Monte Generoso.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise
properties.lead_text: This is your chance to escape to Europe’s highest mountain station at 3883 metres above sea!
properties.description:
The panoramic view over the largest glaciers of the Alps and over no fewer than 38 breathtaking giants of the Swiss, French and Italian Alps is truly unparalleled. The Mont Blanc, highest mountain of the Alps, appears almost near enough to touch. Visitors are very close to Italian territory now and look at the “endearing rear” of the famous Matterhorn. Below them at the foot of the mountain, they can see Europe’s largest ski region, open 365 days a year.

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Matterhorn Glacier Paradise.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Harder Kulm
properties.lead_text: In just ten minutes, ascend from Interlaken to this local mountain top by panoramic funicular.
properties.description:
For more than 100 years, the funicular has been negotiating the 735 meters of altitude to the Harder Kulm, located at 1,322 m a.s.l. The journey starts near the Interlaken Ost train station, leads through a charming forest and passes the wildlife park.

After a five-minute walk from the mountain station, you will have arrived at a lovely restaurant with a red tile roof. Next to the restaurant, you may visit the “Two-Lakes-Bridge” and an airy viewing platform with a see through floor. Stand there to look down for some truly deep sights, or ahead for the magnificent Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau mountains as well as Lakes Brienz and Thun.

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Harder Kulm.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Grindelwald First
properties.lead_text: First is the starting point for many hiking trails and it offers fun and action.
properties.description:
Grindelwald First tempts visitors with a magnificent view to the Eiger North Face. Adrenaline kicks and speed thrills are virtually guaranteed on the 800 metres long First Flyer and the "trotti bike" scooters. Courageous ones glide freely through the air on the First Flyer – suspended on a rope and at a top speed of 84 km/h. Children will have fun on the 700 square metre playground at the Bort intermediate station. Or how about the free of charge “First Cliff Walk by Tissot”?

A leisurely hike to Lake Bachalp is a must in the First area. From the mountain station, visitors arrive at the world-famous, beautiful picture postcard view of lake and mountains within an hour.

Holders of a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) receive a 50% discount on the trip to Grindelwald First.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Brienzer Rothorn
properties.lead_text: In roughly one hour, ascend from lake level to breathtaking altitudes with scenic vistas.
properties.description:
In roughly one hour, the small steam locomotives push the merry red panorama coaches from Lake Brienz up to the Brienzer Rothorn. Additionally, a cableway makes its way to the Rothorn from the UNESCO biosphere Entlebuch (Sörenberg). Unlike the steam railway, this line also operates during winter. Whichever way visitors choose to travel up: the panoramic view from the 2,350-metre summit remains positively impressive.

The view over the Bernese Alps, Lake Brienz and the Grimsel area is magnificent – as is the view of Pilatus and Hogant. Summit restaurants and the Mountain Lodge Rothorn Kulm with newly refurbished rooms guarantee a memorable stay with spectacular sunsets and sunrises.
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: CabriO Stanserhorn
properties.lead_text: Switzerland's futuristic cableway with rooftop access will take you to the Stanserhorn peak.
properties.description:
Since 1893, the open wood coaches have been travelling up towards Stanserhorn from Stans. Starting at the intermediate station, the cableway with its open roof deck is one of the main attractions. It is a truly amazing feeling to stand up there on the roof of the CabriO cableway. You will experience up close the passage between the supporting masts, feel the headwind and soak in the magnificent views – without any cables overhead!

On the summit circular walk, you will meet rangers who are happy to assist with identifying flowers and mountains. (There are marmots halfway around, too!) The summit restaurant “Rondorama” revolves around its axis.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Gotthard Panorama Express
properties.lead_text: The journey from Ticino along the historic Gotthard panoramic route to Lucerne is a journey through Switzerland's history.
properties.description:
Starting at Lugano or Bellinzona, the journey takes travellers from the Mediterranean south right through the heart of Switzerland – and the Gotthard tunnel built in 1882 – over die Alps towards the north. En route, the church of Wassen can be seen from three different angles; thanks to the bold railway layout with its many loop tunnels it has become world famous.

On a steamboat, passengers seamlessly continue via Flüelen across Lake Lucerne. Many locations steeped in history such as the Rütliwiese, the Schillerstein and Tell Chapel greet guests with their original Swiss charms. In the evening, Lucerne harbour – located right next to the famous Chapel Bridge – welcomes the travelers. And by the way: The journey can easily be traveled in the opposite direction, too.

Apart from the many sights, passengers enjoy special presentations about history, myths and legends around Gotthard during this historic journey through time. Last but not least, the culinary aspect will not be neglected: Guests may indulge in warm meals on the steamboat or enjoy snacks and beverages on the train.
properties.area_of_validity: Unlimited travel with Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Titlis
properties.lead_text: From Europe's highest suspension footbridge to eternal snow and ice: that's Mount Titlis.
properties.description:
The excursion to the top of Mount Titlis is a real treat. The new TITLIS Xpress cableway leads up to the intermediate station. From there, the world’s first revolving cableway continues all the way to the top.

At the summit of the 3000 metre peak, a breathtaking panorama as well as other highlights await: various restaurants with sun terraces, the Glacier Cave (free admission), the “Titlis Cliff Walk” – Europe’s highest suspension footbridge – and of course, eternal snow and ice. On the glacier chairlift “Ice Flyer”, you will quite literally fly over the Titlis glacier to the Glacier Park (free admission).
properties.area_of_validity: 50% discount with a Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)

properties.title: Zermatlantis Matterhorn Museum
properties.lead_text: The Zermatlantis Matterhorn Museum makes a world of powerful pictures and incredible stories come alive.
properties.description:
The museum of Zermatlantis lets you immerse yourself in the adventurous events that took place on the Matterhorn. It narrates a great deal about the thrilling history of the world-famous mountain, from its African origin till the present day.

The landmark of Switzerland is famous thanks to the alpinists who continuously sought out new challenges along its flanks, like Edward Whimper. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and is open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Zunfthaus zur Meisen Porcelain Museum Zurich
properties.lead_text: This exhibition features an amazing porcelain collection.
properties.description:
The Zunfthaus zur Meisen was built over 250 years ago. The Rococo interior is truly impressive and is considered to be the most beautiful in the city. The room with graceful shapes and edges host the famous porcelain collection from the Swiss National Museum.  

The impressive collection was produced by Swiss manufacturers in the 18th century. Here, you will discover valuable tableware and filigree figures. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Zug Castle Museum
properties.lead_text: This is the oldest still preserved secular building of Zug.
properties.description:
The Zug Castle dates back to the 12th century and has been home to the museum of cultural history for the city and canton of Zug since 1983. The permanent display was redesigned in 2014 and each room presents its own exhibition on a specific theme.

This creates a charming variety, which inspires a return visit to explore deeper and experience things from a different perspective. As part of the special exhibitions it holds regularly, the museum provides an in-depth insight into current and particular topics.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and grants access to a playful way for families with children to explore the castle.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Zentrum Paul Klee
properties.lead_text: The Zentrum Paul Klee is dedicated to the person, life, and work of Paul Klee.
properties.description:
Once you get off the bus, take a few steps and you will see the impressive architecture of the Zentrum Paul Klee. The unusual building, designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, has a wave-like structure and houses about 4,000 paintings, including the world's largest collection dedicated to Paul Klee.

Here you can explore the exhibition space, a music and event hall, as well as a children's museum. Klee's works are shown in a regularly changing, rotating selection of 120 to 150 works. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and is open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Wine Growing Museum on Lake Zurich
properties.lead_text: Delight yourself with an extensive collection of wines.
properties.description:
The Wine Growing Museum on Lake Zurich is idyllically located at the foot of a peninsula. Here, you will discover an exciting insight into the viticulture of the region, from the beginning to the present. 

Here on the peninsula Au, you are taken on an oenological journey through time. Immerse yourself in a bygone, for some unknown, world of former times! The showpiece of the exhibition is the 13-meter long tree press from 1761. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Wine Growing Museum on Lake Zurich
images.description: Wine Growing Museum on Lake Zurich

properties.title: Vevey Historical Museum
properties.lead_text: Take a tour of this charming museum where regional themes and original collections alternate.
properties.description:
The Vevey Historical Museum is located in the halls of the Castle of Vevey. Once known as the "beautiful house", the 16th-century estate was the residence of the Bernese bailiffs.  

Objects, documents and visual images are arranged in such a way that they preserve the character of the building. Here, you will discover Vaud and Swiss furniture, handicrafts, old weapons, medal collections, manuscripts, engravings and paintings. The museum also features a unique collection of keys, locks and old caskets.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Valais Nature Museum
properties.lead_text: Learn to appreciate the environment in a fun way.
properties.description:
The Valais Nature Museum opened its doors to tourists in spring 2013. Discover the unique relationship between the inhabitants of Valais and their environment, from past times to nowadays. There is also the possibility to put yourself in their shoes and experiment different aspects of this connection. 

There are also different didactic features regarding the biodiversity and human activity. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Valais History Museum, Sion
properties.lead_text: A collection of history and unique objects for enthusiasts.
properties.description:
Surrounded by a breathtaking natural backdrop and right next to the impressive Basilika of Valeria sits the Castle of Valeria, home to the Valais History Museum. Here, you can enjoy 50,000 years of history. The medieval castle has been perfectly restored, so you can explore its labyrinthine spaces. 

Don't miss the collection of unique objects. You can also spend quality time in the cafeteria that serves regional specialties, snacks, and wine. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Valais Art Museum
properties.lead_text: A place with exceptional history and a picturesque view.
properties.description:
Valais Art Museum introduces you to the works of the artists from Valais, from the 18th century through present days. Here, you can delight yourself with the collections signed by Raphael Ritz, Caspar Wolf, and Oskar Kokoschka, as well as of the painters of the School of Savièse.

There is also an audio guide available if you want to deepen these works and learn art in a fun and creative way. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Typorama, Bischofszell
properties.lead_text: Learn about printing and printing machines.
properties.description:
The Typorama is a typographic museum. Here, you can discover hand-setting, setting and printing machines from the 19th and 20th centuries. The major attraction is the traditional expertise with lead and letterpress printing that is extremely well preserved and very well promoted.

An interesting fact is that all the machines are in use in the Typorama because they live, work and produce every day. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Toy Museum Zurich
properties.lead_text: A place for adults and kids alike!
properties.description:
The Zurich Toy Museum is located in one of the oldest corners of the Old Town. This toy collection with its miniature railways, toy soldiers and dolls provides an insight into how our great-grandparents played.

Here, you can discover a brief yet informative insight into the children’s games of bygone days. Dollhouses have reflected European domestic life from the early 18th to the 20th century. Railways, steam engines and tin cars bear witness to just how technological progress has influenced the nursery. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and offers a play corner for the children.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Tourism Museum Interlaken
properties.lead_text: Learn about the development of travel for leisure in the Jungfrau region.
properties.description:
The Tourism Museum in Interlaken was opened in 1980. It is the first and only museum of its kind comprehensively and exclusively dedicated to the history of tourism. You have three floors to examine its evolution in every detail.

Inside realistic spaces, you are invited on an exciting journey that tells the 250-year-old story of alpine tourism from the perspective of travellers at the time. The museum is located in the historic old town "Untersee" and is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Tibet Museum - Fondation Alain Bordier
properties.lead_text: Who knew that Gruyères is the best place to discover the Himalayan regions?
properties.description:
Within the heart of medieval Gruyères the remarkable exhibition of the Tibet Museum is waiting for you. It was collected by Alain Bordier with immense care and respect. The museum encompasses more than 300 works of art of extraordinary quality from the Himalayan regions. 

The exhibited sculptures, paintings and ritual objects from Tibet, Nepal, Kashmir, North India and Burma represent the entirety of Buddhist deities. Step into the ideal and tranquil surroundings for the immersion in the beauty of this art.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Thun Panorama
properties.lead_text: Embrace the amazing panoramic views of the city of Thun.
properties.description:
The Thun Panorama was produced in 1814 and was the first Swiss work of its type, as well as the world's oldest surviving example of its genre. The artist Marquard Wocher sketched it while sitting on a roof in the middle of the Old Town of Thun.

This panoramic view is fascinating not only because of its size but also because of its charm. Even today, you feel as if its unusual perspective offered you an intimate gaze into living rooms, classrooms and streets. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex). You can also take a public tour for more interesting background information about this work of art.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Thun Castle
properties.lead_text: Thun Castle is an almost completely preserved symbol of power from the Middle Ages.
properties.description:
Thun Castle was built at the end of the 12th century by the Dukes of Zähringen. Thought it was initially designed as a purely administrative castle, its new owners, the Bernese, extended it in the 15th century. 

The five floors of the castle now house a historical museum and host temporary exhibitions on a variety of cultural, historical and current issues. You can also attend concerts and other public events. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and is open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: The Olympic Museum
properties.lead_text: Experience the history of the Olympics from antiquity to today.
properties.description:
To experience the Olympics at close quarters and feel the Olympic spirit the way the athletes felt it, to study the history of the Games from antiquity to today - thanks to the latest computer technology and audiovisual media, all of this can be accomplished in the Olympic Museum in Lausanne.

Opened in 1993 in Ouchy, a district of Lausanne, this museum reflects the spirit of the sports games which bring nations together. An unusual new building in the most beautiful of locations on Lake Geneva is home to interactive exhibitions, documents, films and collections of precious objects dating from Greek antiquity up until modern times. The museum is the largest information center on the subject of the Olympic Games in the world. 

On Saturday and Sundays, you can enjoy a delicious brunch at the TOM Café, savouring the gorgeous views of Lake Geneva and the mountains. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and is open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Thun Art Museum
properties.lead_text: Enjoy contemporary art in five temporary exhibitions!
properties.description:
Thun Art Museum was founded in 1948. The museum runs an exhibition program featuring both Swiss and international artists. In addition to thematic and monographic special exhibitions, one collection exhibition is organised each year.

In its special exhibitions focusing on contemporary art, the Thun Art Museum takes up contemporary positions and participates in the current art discourse. The collection is presented in regularly scheduled exhibitions but is not viewable on a continuous basis. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: The Museum of Communication
properties.lead_text: Interactive displays, surprising objects and large-scale video screens for you to enjoy!
properties.description:
The Museum of Communication aims to answer all questions you can ask yourself regarding communication. The exhibition explores fundamental queries in a playful manner – calling on you to contribute your expert thoughts.  

There are numerous newly developed points of adventure waiting for you. You can take part in a game of film karaoke and re-enact famous scenes, you can breach your opponent’s firewall in a hacking game and other interesting and interactive activities. Each visit is a personal and individual experience.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Textile Museum St. Gallen
properties.lead_text: This is Switzerland's home to historical embroideries and contemporary textile art.
properties.description:
The Textile Museum is internationally renowned. It hosts a collection of about 30,000 objects consisting of fabrics from Egyptian grave sites, historical embroideries since the 14th century, hand-made lace from major European centres of excellence, and much more.

Here, you can find the collection of hand and machine embroidery from Eastern Switzerland. It reveals a huge collection of media in all areas to do with textiles.  

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Wood Carving Museum
properties.lead_text: Step into the only museum in Switzerland dedicated exclusively to woodcarving.
properties.description:
The Swiss Woodcarving Museum studies and presents objects that document the history of this craft from the beginnings to the present. A permanent exhibition of works from the various epochs of woodcarving highlights the great importance of Brienz. 

In conjunction with special exhibitions of works from other regions of Switzerland, the museum takes you on a journey through a sizeable part of Swiss cultural, economic and tourism history. Each tour lasts up to two hours. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and can be visited from February to October/December.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Organ Museum in Roche
properties.lead_text: Learn how to enjoy music even more!
properties.description:
The Swiss Museum of the Organ welcomes you with a remarkable collection of antique organs. It is located in a quite unexpected location, a barn post that is nine centuries old. Here, you will discover the importance of music in the patrimony of the nation.

The major attraction here is the hydraulic organ that dates from about 246 B.C.E. You can also delight yourself with the Elysée organ, the one in cardboard, the barrel organs, and the flute clocks. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss National Park in Zernez
properties.lead_text: 80 kilometres of hiking paths, nature trails and excursion destinations for the whole family.
properties.description:
The Swiss National Park includes a visitors' center in Zernez. There is a permanent exhibition about the National Park, changing exhibitions about natural history and a platform for nature conservancy organisations.

Excursions for families lead far into the park and encourage the playful exploration and discovery of the environment even for small children. Nature-related offers also promote awareness and understanding of nature for teenagers and adults. 

This park is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss National Museum in Zurich
properties.lead_text: The National Museum in Zurich brings history back to life behind its centuries old walls.
properties.description:
The museum was built by Gustav Dull in 1898 to mark the 50th anniversary of the first federal constitution. A modern annex has recently been opened, attracting those interested in architecture.

The National Museum Zurich reveals the life of the Swiss, from prehistory to the present. But there are also temporary exhibitions about history, culture or society. They are usually supplemented with debates, lectures, readings or workshops. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Model Train Museum
properties.lead_text: This is the best place to find historic collections of miniature Swiss railways.
properties.description:
The Swiss Model Train Museum is the place where 150 years of Swiss railway history come to life. Here, you can discover over 1,300 HO scale models. Also, you can learn about the toy train history from 1895 to 1935. 

The Train Museum prides itself on various models exhibited, like the Large American models Colorado. Furthermore, there is a loop film on Swiss trains. 

Very fittingly, this train lover's attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Heritage Center at the Villa Patumbah
properties.lead_text: An interactive exhibition that focuses on the construction culture.
properties.description:
At the Swiss Heritage Center at the Villa Patumbah, you can explore Swiss construction culture inside a magnificent mansion. You will discover an interactive exhibition that is focused on the changes in the landscape, handcrafted details and architectural monuments specific to daily life.

On the second floor, you will be mesmerised by a glass dome that hosts an Asian temple. Once a month, there is a theatre tour that reveals the story of the villa and park. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Swiss Heritage Center at the Villa Patumbah
images.description: Swiss Heritage Center at the Villa Patumbah

properties.title: Swiss Fashion Museum
properties.lead_text: Are you a fashionista? Embrace the evolution of clothing!
properties.description:
The Swiss Fashion Museum is located in the Yverdon-les-Bains castle. Here, you will discover the works of Robert Piguet. There are also temporary exhibitions available that are associated with variaous activities that take place in the castle.

The main attraction of the museum is represented by the works of Piguet. However, at the temporary exhibitions, you can discover some 5,000 film costumes, contemporary Swiss haute couture, private collections and much more. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Camera Museum Vevey
properties.lead_text: Amaze yourself with cameras and photographs that date from the time of their invention to the present.
properties.description:
The Swiss Camera Museum was opened in 1979 and extended in 2001. Here, you will see a wide range of equipment, everything from the camera obscura and the magic lantern to digital cameras. There are also prints from the early days of photography. 

You will learn details of the history of some of the inventors who contributed to the development of photography. There are temporary exhibitions on display all year round. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Alpine Museum
properties.lead_text: This museum offers unconventional exhibitions focusing on the Alpine world.
properties.description:
The Swiss Alpine Museum is focused on the Alps and its majestic peaks. The special exhibits and the broad event and education program give you the chance to engage with current issues regarding the Alpine world.

Here, you get to enjoy a museum that is an interactive platform for posing questions and discussing issues. The attractions include the experimental bivouac, the museum shop and the Alpine cuisine of the museum’s restaurant, "las alps". Highly recommended for "mountain climbers" of all ages!

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Stockalper Castle
properties.lead_text: Visit the spectacular cellars, arcades and halls of the palace.
properties.description:
The Stockalper Palace was built in the 17th century by Kaspar Stockalper. There are so many things you can do here. After you check out the interior of this fortification, you can enjoy the palace garden with rose bushes together with the view of the monastery, the Jesuit church and Brig's Old Town. 

The wallpaper and silk-paintings in the palace halls were designed in Paris in the 18th century. Nowadays, the castle is the headquarters of Brig's municipal administration. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and includes a guided tour.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Spiez Castle and Museum
properties.lead_text: Visit the Spiez Castle and Museum to witness the change from a medieval castle to a patrician residence.
properties.description:
The Spiez Castle has furnished living quarters and rooms used for official functions, dating from the 13th to the 18th century. Among them, there are residential areas and courtrooms dating from the 15th century. 

Make sure you do not miss the wood-panelled Renaissance room and the early Baroque banquet room. The Early Romanesque Castle Church and the manicured park are also part of the grounds. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Silhouettes Museum in Château-d’Œx
properties.lead_text: Get an insight into the art of scissor-cut silhouettes.
properties.description:
The Silhouettes Museum is well-known in particular for its collection of over 60 well-preserved scissor-cut silhouettes. The art of paper cutting produces images that look like lace. They are traditionally produced in one piece, in black and white. 

You will also discover wooden furniture, sculptures, statues, military paraphernalia, cowbells, and skis, all from the 16th century. These objects are proudly displayed throughout 15 individual rooms. It is open all year round from 14.00 to 17.00 h, except on Mondays.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Sherlock Holmes Museum, Meiringen
properties.lead_text: Go incognito and discover how the myth lives on...
properties.description:
The museum opened in 1991 on the 100th death anniversary of Sherlock Holmes. It is located in the basement of the old English church in the centre of the village of Meiringen. Holmes fans will find numerous objects related to the history of their favourite detective.

You can see the authentically recreated parlour of the Victorian home located at Baker Street 221b in London where Holmes lived with his assistant, Dr. Watson. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Science Fiction, Utopia and Otherworldly Travel Museum
properties.lead_text: Europe's one and only museum of science fiction, utopia and extraordinary journeys.
properties.description:
The Science Fiction, Utopia and Otherworldly Travel Museum is an original cultural site with 120,000 documents. In addition to 80,000 books, there are comics, pulp magazines, movie posters, pictures, toys, CDs and works of art, all of which make the museum the most significant base for research in the field of science fiction.

Since 2008, the museum also shows a permanent exhibition dedicated to the work of Jules Verne (and other pioneers of science fiction). This collection is connected to the museum via an avant-garde passageway. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Science Fiction, Utopia and Otherworldly Travel Museum
images.description: Science Fiction, Utopia and Otherworldly Travel Museum

properties.title: Schaffhausen Wine Museum
properties.lead_text: Learn about the history of viticulture in the canton of Schaffhausen.
properties.description:
The Schaffhausen Wine Museum reveals the evolution of wine cultivation in the Schaffhausen region. You will discover how the monks contributed significantly to the spread of wine cultivation and how the canton became Switzerland’s most important supplier of wine.

The grape harvest is the culmination of the wine year. In the Wine Museum, you will get acquainted with the development of the grape through the seasons. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Saaser Museum
properties.lead_text: Take a trip back in time and discover the traditional village life of Saas.
properties.description:
Saaser Museum is perfect if you want to learn more about the 19th century. What makes it even more interesting is the fact that you can stroll around the streets of Saas-Fee and actually feel that you take part in those times.

The museum reveals the life of the peasants who lived in the wooden Valais houses. For an authentic look, there is also an exhibition of household items, embroidered costumes and ethnographic elements. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Rosengart Collection – Klee, Picasso, Cézanne
properties.lead_text: The Rosengart Collection houses two unique groups of works by Paul Klee and Pablo Picasso.
properties.description:
The Rosengart Collection showcases over 300 works of art by 23 different artists of the so-called Classical Modernist Period, including 125 works by Paul Klee and about 180 works by Pablo Picasso.

In 1992 Angela Rosengart (the daughter of the art dealer Siegfried Rosengart who owned the Rosengart Collection) established the Rosengart Foundation, with the goal to make the important collection accessible to the public.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and is open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Roman Museum and Amphitheater Nyon
properties.lead_text: Noviodunum is a former colony founded by Julius Caesar.
properties.description:
The Roman Museum in Nyon takes you on a trip back in Roman times. The town of Nyon was actually built on the site of the Roman Noviodunum, founded by Julius Caesar in the year 45 B.C.E.

The museum was opened in the Basilica of the Roman Forum in 1979 – an administrative building dating from the 1st century C.E. Here, you will discover amphorae, lamps, ceramic tableware, glass urns, coins and jewellery, engraved stones and sculptures. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) together with the festival of archaeology films that takes place every two years.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Rietberg Museum
properties.lead_text: Step into the only art museum for non-European cultures in Switzerland.
properties.description:
The Rietberg Museum boasts an internationally renowned collection of works from Asia, Africa, America and Oceania. With its presentation of works of art, it seeks to highlight the fascinating variety of artistic forms of expression, arousing an interest and understanding of foreign cultures, beliefs and religions.

The architecturally spectacular "Emerald", as the new museum is called, consists of a glass pavilion and fits perfectly into the existing ensemble of villas in the beautiful Rieterpark. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Richard Wagner Museum
properties.lead_text: Step into the former residence of the well-known artist!
properties.description:
The Richard Wagner Museum was formerly the residence of the artist. Wagner resided here with his wife Cosima and their children. At the ground floor, you can visit a collection about the artist himself and the time that he lived in Tribschen. 

In addition to the food and beverages served, the Sommercafé on the beautiful museum court affords magical views of the mountains and lake. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Rhaetian Museum
properties.lead_text: Archaeology plus cultural and folk art objects from pre-historic times to early 20th centuries.
properties.description:
The Rhaetian Museum was initially the house of Baron Paul von Buol zu Strassberg und Rietberg. The baroque-style patrician house has meanwhile been turned into a foundation to promote science and art.  

Today's permanent collection has been completely rearranged. The basement is dedicated to the "Finds and Findings" of archaeology. The first-floor deals with "Power and Politics", the second with "Bread and Work" and the third with "Faith and Knowledge." 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Rapperswil-Jona Municipal Museum
properties.lead_text: Embrace 800 years of town history and culture.
properties.description:
The Stadtmuseum Rapperswil-Jona presents a unique ensemble of buildings. The distinctive newly constructed “Janus” building with its perforated façade in architectural bronze is the hallmark of the museum. It serves as the entry foyer and connects the historic buildings. 

Its impressive interior features clean lines and a refined transmission of light. The entire ensemble is dominated by a mighty tower from the 14th century. The newly conceived permanent exhibition explores the eventful history of Rapperswil-Jona. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Prehistoric Lakeside Village
properties.lead_text: Learn interesting details about Prehistory in a reconstituted village.
properties.description:
The Prehistoric Lakeside Village at Gletterens aims to reveal how our distant ancestors used to live their lives. You will be invited to participate in presentations and workshops. There are also many events that are focused on the activities of the first farmers who lived on these shores between 4500 and 800 BC.

Here, you will learn to make a Neolithic knife, a lamp, or a pendant. You will see how they used to light a fire and even try a Stone Age meal.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Pottery Museum in Bonfol
properties.lead_text: An interesting collection of pottery from the 18th to the 20th century.
properties.description:
The Pottery Museum prides itself on two collections. One was built by Armand Bachofner, and the other one comes from the CISA ceramic slab factory. Various purchases, finds and donations are regularly added to this collection, which comprises several hundred pieces from the 18th to the 20th century. 

You will discover a whole room dedicated to the old and new ceramic techniques. The former basement of the building gives you an overview of the productions of the 20th century. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Polish Museum in the Castle
properties.lead_text: Find out more about the work of Polish emigrants and their Swiss friends.
properties.description:
The history of the Polish Museum in the Rapperswil Castle began as early as 1870. The valuable collections of the Polish Museum are complemented with numerous temporary exhibitions.

Here, you can enjoy Polish music concerts, as well as most interesting topical lectures concerning Switzerland and Poland. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Patek Philippe Museum
properties.lead_text: A wonderful introduction to 500 years of watchmaking history.
properties.description:
The Patek Philippe Museum invites you to explore the origins of watchmaking through its magnificent collections of Swiss, Genevan and European watches and enamels from the 16th to the 19th century.  

A library devoted entirely to watchmaking documents these historic collections. Here you can discover watches, musical automata and portrait miniatures painted on enamel as well as the prestigious creations of the enterprise that has been based in Geneva since its founding in 1839. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Pasquart Art Center in Biel/Bienne
properties.lead_text: A space dedicated to innovative and creative young artists.
properties.description:
The Pasquart Art Center was opened in 1990 in the former city hospital. Here, you will discover the work of Basel architects Diener & Diener. The ensemble offers a perfect and harmonious blend of old and new. 

The museum provides Switzerland and in particular the region with innovative contemporary art exhibitions. These support the awareness of contemporary artistic creativity and its importance to the community, contributing to the promotion of the artists. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Oskar Reinhart Museum
properties.lead_text: Immerse yourself in this collection of pictures and drawings from Swiss, German and Austrian artists.
properties.description:
Oskar Reinhart came from a wealthy family, and he shaped the artistic life of the city of Winterthur like no other. He committed himself to establishing his collection and make it accessible to the public. You will notice this passion for art when you wander through the rooms of the museum. 

The 27 paintings by Ferdinand Hodler constitute one of the focal points of the collection. There are also unexpected treasures like famous paintings such as "Chalk Cliffs of Rügen" by Caspar David Friedrich. This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Oskar Reinhart Collection "Am Römerholz"
properties.lead_text: Discover one of the most distinguished private collections of the 20th century!
properties.description:
The Winterthur art collector Oskar Reinhart turned his residential house into a museum. After his death in 1965, his beneficiary, the Swiss Confederation, opened the doors to Reinhart's treasures to the public. Here, you can enjoy the works of 19th century French painters as well as individual exquisite paintings from the old masters such as Rubens, Goya, and Bruegel.

The villa and historic park with its sculptures combined with the collection constitute an intimate and impressive synthesis of the arts. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Old Arsenal Museum Solothurn
properties.lead_text: Visit a historic building that shapes Solothurn’s cityscape.
properties.description:
The Old Arsenal Museum is an impressive building that has amazed people for centuries. Tremendous things are viewed in the permanent exhibition stretching over a total four floors. And the former armory still houses weapons, arms and military equipment. 

Unique throughout Switzerland is the collection of 400 coats of armor, half of which are exhibited in the former arming hall. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Oberhofen Castle
properties.lead_text: This gem of a castle by the lake features a medieval keep and a lake tower.
properties.description:
The Oberhofen Castle exibits neo-Gothic dining rooms and knights' suits of armor, as well as a Turkish smoking parlour. The large castle park is considered to be one of the most magnificent in the region of the Alps. 

The castle chapel with its wall paintings from the late 15th century can still be used today for baptisms and marriages. The imposing mountain landscape above the lake makes the garden one of the most photographed backdrops for newlyweds. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: North America Native Museum Zurich (NONAM)
properties.lead_text: Discover an exquisite exhibition dedicated to native North Americans.
properties.description:
The NONAM is a great place to visit if you want to learn more about native Americans. Here, you will discover different items used in everyday life, as well as pieces of jewellery. If you want to see how indigenous inhabitants of North America live nowadays, make sure you do not miss the special exhibitions. 

Make sure you visit the “Sounding Museum”, which was recognised by the Swiss UNESCO Commission.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Nidwalden Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover faith and customs in everyday life and festivities.
properties.description:
Nidwalden Museum has three separate venues: the Salzmagazin, the Winkelriedhaus and Castle Fürigen. The second floor of Winkelriedhaus (pictured) looks at the themes of faith and customs from childbirth to the deathbed, from peasant wear to the amulets worn to ward off evil spirits.

A majority of Castle Fürigen’s rooms and furnishings originate from the era of the castle’s building. You can check the narrow passages and numerous rooms hewn into the rock of Mount Bürgenstock. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Naturama Aarau
properties.lead_text: Visit one of the most modern nature museums in Switzerland.
properties.description:
Naturama invites you on an exciting journey through indigenous nature. Here, you can discover the world of the dinosaurs and the mammoths. In order to make you feel like you actually live the moment, the museum creates encounters with live animals and affords the brave a look into the future.

The Naturama also has a museum café and a shop. Special exhibitions on current issues are regularly shown. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Natural History Museum Winterthur
properties.lead_text: Playful and informative insights into the fascinating world of nature.
properties.description:
The Natural History Museum in Winterthur is the best place to take your kids to discover the wonders of nature. Like little badgers, children can sniff around in an oversized badger's burrow and label and display their finds from forest and meadow in the drawer museum. 

The popular doll, Kerala, will accompany you on the tour. She is also available for a birthday party. In a playful manner, a museum teacher guides the children through the various themes. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Natural History Museum Bern
properties.lead_text: Barry, the famous St. Bernard, is on display at this internationally renowned museum.
properties.description:
The Natural History Museum in Bern was officially founded in 1832 but it was moved into a new building in 1936. It is an excellent example of the “Neue Sachlichkeit“ style. The museum has 5,100 square metres of exhibition space and an international reputation founded initially on its historical dioramas.

Here, you can enjoy around 4 million objects, including Barry, the famous St. Bernard. NMBE is also known for housing the giant Planggenstock crystals. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Music Museum in Basel
properties.lead_text: Welcome to Switzerland's largest collection of musical instruments.
properties.description:
The Music Museum is the reconstruction of the former monastery complex and the prison, revealing a successful example of combining the old and the new. Since the year 2000, Switzerland's largest collection of musical instruments has been on display in the "Lohnhof".

Here, you can view approximately 650 exhibited instruments from five centuries. You can even experience them acoustically by means of a multi-media information system. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Tinguely
properties.lead_text: This unique museum houses the world’s largest collection of art by Jean Tinguely.
properties.description:
Jean Tinguely (1925–1991) is one of the most innovative and important Swiss artists of the 20th century. The permanent exhibition at the museum dedicated to him presents a cross-section of his work over four decades.

Here, you can enjoy interactive exhibitions and explore his influences, the work of his contemporaries and the latest trends. The building is a work of art in itself, designed by the leading architect Mario Botta. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Stamparia in Strada
properties.lead_text: This historical museum building dates back to the late 16th century.
properties.description:
Museum Stamparia is housed in a building from the late 16th century,  the home of a printing family. The museum has a striking collection on the history of printing and shows the Stamparia printed matter at that time, as well as old bible prints and printing presses from different eras. 

The main attraction is the full-facsimile edition of the 42-line Gutenberg Bible. Further exhibitions are dedicated to the former living and music culture. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of the Verzasca Valley
properties.lead_text: Way in the back of the Verzasca Valley is this museum about how people used to live here.
properties.description:
The Museum of the Verzasca Valley is located in an old house with an interesting design. The collection includes thousands of objects that highlight how life used to be in this Ticino valley.

In one room, you will find evidence of the economy of subsistence. In rooms two and three, how a typical house looked. In room four, there is a school and in rooms five and six, a history of local chimney sweepers. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Photography Lausanne
properties.lead_text: Europe’s leading museum devoted entirely to photography.
properties.description:
The Museum of Photography is housed in a mansion above Lake Geneva, built between 1780 and 1783 by the architect Abraham Fraisse. It is a leading center of expertise in the conservation and enhancement of the photographic heritage. 

The museum possesses more than a million images along with entire photographic collections – including those of Burri, Maillart, and Charlie Chaplin. Here, you will find out about the history of photography from early inventions such as the daguerreotype to modern digital image processing. The museum covers all artistic, social, political and cultural forms of this fascinating, ever-changing medium.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
