properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Natural History Basel
properties.lead_text: The place where dinosaurs come to life.
properties.description:
A tour of the Museum of Natural History is like an expedition into the remotest corners of our planet. You will discover the most beautiful minerals from the distant past when dinosaurs ruled the earth. Natural objects are there to be inspected and contemplated, turning this visit into a memorable experience.

The exhibitions cover virtually all aspects of the natural sciences: from the history of the earth to indigenous minerals, from extinct to living mammals, from mammoths to insects. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art (MAMCO)
properties.lead_text: Here's a truly outside-the-box museum – original in every way!
properties.description:
The MAMCO is located in a former Geneva factory. This means that you can expect large windows, vast rooms and expansive floors bearing the traces of long-gone machinery. Each corner is completely redesigned three times a year. MAMCO has staged 450 exhibitions with works dating from the 1960s to the present day. The "Nuit des Bains" (baths night) event is held three times a year. This is when the district is transformed into a large gallery.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and attracts thousands of art lovers and sightseers.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art (MAMCO)
images.description: Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art (MAMCO)

properties.title: Museum of History and Porcelain Nyon
properties.lead_text: Take a glimpse of unique collections in a lively and warm atmosphere!
properties.description:
The Museum of History and Porcelain is housed in a 12th century castle that was lavishly restored to provide an authentic look. Along the corridors you are welcomed by numerous portraits of Nyon citizens that line the walls, ranging from the 17th to the 20th century.

Here, you can discover temporary exhibitions of photography and contemporary art. There is a display of the magnificent 18th century Nyon porcelain, and the gripping atmosphere of prison cells that were closed only in 1979. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Fine Arts, Basel
properties.lead_text: The Museum of Fine Arts is the best place to enjoy contemporary art.
properties.description:
In 2013, the London Times named The Museum of Fine Arts in Basel the world’s fifth best museum. An interesting particularity is represented by the extension building. The architects, Christ & Gantenbein of Basel, linked it with the main building by an underground connection. This brings the museum up to a total number of three buildings. 

The main building at St. Alban-Graben features art from the period from the 15th century up to 1960. The generously spaces extension building houses special exhibitions and works created between 1960 and 1990. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Ethnology Basel
properties.lead_text: Explore cultural dimensions in this vast collection of artefacts from all continents.
properties.description:
The Museum of Ethnology aims to promote cultural life and awareness in the Basel area and beyond by hosting attractive, exciting exhibitions and varied events. This is one of the most important ethnographic museums in Europe. 

Here, you can discover an inventory with more than 300,000 impressive and world-renowned items. The focus of the collection has been developed over generations and features gems from Europe, Africa, America, Oceania and Asia. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts (mudac)
properties.lead_text: The ultra-modern «mudac» wants you to take a different look at art.
properties.description:
Covering design, graphics and fashion, the Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts (mudac) showcases all forms of modern art and loves building bridges between different styles. It is the only museum of applied arts in western Switzerland. It is the mudac's philosophy to help you let go of preconceived ideas and take a fresh look at art.

There are two permanent exhibitions and four to six annual shows on current themes, devoted to a variety of beautiful things. You can also check the platform for performing arts - with dancers, musicians and various performers. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts
images.description: Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts

properties.title: Museum of Art Lucerne
properties.lead_text: Have you spotted Lucerne's most eclectic building near the train station?
properties.description:
The Museum of Art Lucerne is located on the top floor of the Culture and Convention Center Lucerne (KKL), which was designed by Parisian architect Jean Nouvel. On an area of 2,100 square metres you can discover changing exhibitions displaying significant works of modern art with an emphasis on 19th and 20th-century landscape painting and international art from 1960.

The architectural simplicity of the museum and the sophisticated use of light make every visit a genuine cultural experience.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex). Please visit the website of the Museum for the current exhibition program.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Lindwurm
properties.lead_text: This museum reveals how respected families lived (and made a living) back in 1850.
properties.description:
Museum Lindwurm is located in the heart of Stein am Rhein’s Old Town. The rooms have been arranged in such a way that you could imagine a real awakening any second. The museum not only fascinates adults but entire families as it invites you on a journey back in time.

Rays of sun dance upon freshly laundered clothes, the pointed-hood hen waddles through the inner courtyard, and a fully laid table patiently awaits distinguished guests. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Castle of Sasso Corbaro
properties.lead_text: Discover a ducal fortress from the 15th century.
properties.description:
The Museum Castle of Sasso Corbaro was restored by the architect Paola Piffaretti from 1992 to 2006.  The castle was built in 1479, and the entire concept was designed and completed in the incredibly brief time of six months by the military engineer, Benedetto Ferrini of Florence.

This is a great place to view temporary, thematic and anthological exhibitions. Make sure you do not miss the Emma Poglia room, built towards the middle of the 17th century in dorian and baroque style. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Castle of Montebello
properties.lead_text: This ducal fortress on the Montebello hill has been restored by the architect Mario Campi.
properties.description:
The Museum Castle of Montebello was restored from 1971 to 1974. In the process, the regional archaeology was carefully preserved: artefacts from various tombs in necropolises dating from the Bronze and the Iron Age, from the Roman era and from the early Middle Ages (Langobardic shield). 

At the museum, you can also enjoy Italiot ceramics (4th – 1st century B.C.), 15th-century stonework, capitals, baptismal font and weaponry from the 15th to 19th century. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and can be combined with a visit to the other two castles of Bellinzona.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Amden
properties.lead_text: Shift into discovery mode and learn all about the Amden region!
properties.description:
The Museum Amden invites you to get to know the country and people of Amden along with their history. A significant part of the permanent exhibition is devoted to geological topics.

You will learn about the impressive mountain structure, the fascinating "Rinquelle" spring, the exploration of the Alpine karst system and the landslide of 1974. Four times a year, temporary exhibitions are held with various artists. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Murten Museum
properties.lead_text: The history of the Murten region can be explored in a fun way.
properties.description:
From the long-lost lake dwellers to the famous Battle of Morat, this museum brings history to life. There is a permanent exhibition of about 150 years worth of archaeological digs, but you can also discover the everyday lives of the first waterside villagers.

There are several well-preserved objects that will help you understand the activities conducted each day by the inhabitants. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Municipal Museum of Modern Art Ascona
properties.lead_text: Enter a beautiful palazzo dating back to the 16th century.
properties.description:
The Municipal Museum of Modern Art houses an important selection from the permanent municipal exhibition and is home to two foundations, the Marianne Werefkin Foundation and the Richard Seewald Foundation. 

The municipal art collection goes back to 1922 when many of the artists living in Ascona decided to donate one of their works. This way, they laid the first stone for a future municipal museum. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Municipal Museum of Modern Art Ascona
images.description: Municipal Museum of Modern Art Ascona

properties.title: Morges Castle and Museums
properties.lead_text: This special fortress with an interesting architecture is also home to four museums.
properties.description:
At Morges Castle, you can actually find four museums concealed within the mighty fortress walls: the cantonal military museum, the Swiss museum of historic figurines, the artillery museum and the museum of the Lake Geneva regional police. 

It is also a good idea to take a short detour into the adjacent old town or a pleasant stroll along the promenade that runs parallel to an extensive park. You will see that they are well worth the time. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Montreux Museum
properties.lead_text: This museum is all about the history of the lakeside town of Montreux.
properties.description:
Montreux Museum is an important architectural site that dates from the 17th century. Here, you will discover buildings with an architectural cohesiveness that you can rarely meet. The museum hosts local objects and collections of natural sciences. 

There are coins, traditional utensils, branding irons, woodworking tools and much more on display. You will also have the opportunity to learn about the Montreux region. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Migros Museum of Contemporary Art
properties.lead_text: Embrace contemporary art inside a former brewery.
properties.description:
The Migros Museum of Contemporary Art was founded in 1996 to make all the works accessible to the public. It is situated in the Löwenbräu-Areal in Zürich. Intended as a dynamic location for the production of contemporary art, the two story museum presents alternating solo and group exhibitions as well as works from its own collection.

Here, you can enjoy 1,300 works, mostly by contemporary artists from Urs Fischer to Christoph Schlingensief. Thirty-five percent of the artists come from Switzerland. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Memories at “Nutli Hüschi” in Klosters
properties.lead_text: Embrace the traditional lifestyle of former times in an idyllic location.
properties.description:
“Nutli Hüschi” is a house built by Christian Nutli in 1565 and is now a museum. In 1996 a barn was added to the house. Here, you can see valuable furniture, tools and toys from the 16th to the 18th century.

The museum will help you discover the traditional lifestyle and construction style of the Grisons people. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Maison Cailler, the Swiss Chocolate Factory
properties.lead_text: Listen up, chocoholics! Maison Cailler is Switzerland's chocolate factory that's open to the public.
properties.description:
The Maison Cailler gives you a window into the world of chocolate by means of a transparent and sparkling aesthetic. The past comes to life through a selection of photographs that retrace the factory's history from 1898 to 1960. Did we mention unlimited tasting opportunities?

You can also visit a specially designed shop which sells the entire range of Cailler of Switzerland chocolates. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Maison Cailler, the Swiss Chocolate Factory
images.description: Maison Cailler, the Swiss Chocolate Factory

properties.title: Lötschentaler Museum, Kippel
properties.lead_text: Step into the world of Alpine traditions.
properties.description:
The Lötschentaler Museum aims to reveal traditions and customs from the Alpine regions. Here, you will discover tools that people used in everyday life and artefacts specific to different celebrations. They are presented in an interactive way through historical films, photographs and various publications and documents.

The activities here are very diverse thanks to the temporary exhibitions that are constantly renewed and expanded. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Lokremise St. Gallen
properties.lead_text: A cultural center with a theater, a dance area, a cinema, arts and a restaurant.
properties.description:
The Lokremise St. Gallen was built between 1903 and 1911. This urban building is the largest surviving locomotive ring depot in Switzerland and thus a monument of national importance. During recent renovations, great care was taken to ensure that the basic structure remain intact. 

In this unique setting, there is a concert and theatre space, the St. Gallen Kunstmuseum, the Kinok repertory cinema and the Restaurant Lokal - all offering an exciting and enriching program. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Lion's Monument Lucerne
properties.lead_text: The Lion's Monument commemorates the Swiss guardsmen fallen during the French Revolution and is one Lucerne's most popular sights.
properties.description:
The Dying Lion of Lucerne was hewn out of stone on site and commemorates the fallen Swiss guardsmen who died in 1792 during the French Revolution. The nearby Glacier Garden exhibits glacier potholes from the last Ice Age.

The exhibits are complemented by interactive stations and multimedia presentations. The landscape is literally at your feet when you view the world's oldest mountain chain relief from this very location here in Central Switzerland! 

Both the Lion's Monument and the Glacier Garden are included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and are open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Liechtenstein Country Museum
properties.lead_text: Learn about Liechtenstein’s cultural heritage.
properties.description:
The Liechtenstein National Museum in Vaduz is the place where visitors can enjoy an exciting journey. There are 42 exhibition rooms that expose Liechtenstein’s cultural heritage. You will be surprised to see how many interesting details you can find. 

You can learn details about the history as well as the culture and natural environment of Liechtenstein. In addition, you can see a part of the Liechtenstein crown jewels - a replica of the “princely hat”. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Lenzburg Castle
properties.lead_text: Discover the legend of the dragon slain by two noble knights.
properties.description:
From the moment you cross the drawbridge and enter the courtyard, you are engulfed in the castle’s 1,000-year history. It features a variety of exhibits: a museum of life in the old times, an exhibit about knighthood and nobility, a dragon research station, a children’s museum and a history studio.

Public tours are very interactive and include old crafts and special events, such as a medieval market. If you are an adventure seeker, there is the Castle Fox Trail – an exciting treasure hunt. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Langmatt Museum
properties.lead_text: Inside this mansion is the legacy of an industrialist and collector family.
properties.description:
Langmatt Museum houses an outstanding collection of works by the French Impressionists, a collection of Venetian vistas from the 18th century and rare ceramics and carpets. The living areas contain exquisite French furniture. 

Round off your museum visit by going to a café in the former orangery or having a picnic in the historic park. In addition to the special exhibitions, a range of special events for adults and children is also offered. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Lake Geneva Museum in Nyon
properties.lead_text: Become the fount of knowledge on the largest lake in Western Europe!
properties.description:
At Lake Geneva Museum, you can enjoy a unique collection of objects and documents relating to the lake and its waters, and the nature and culture surrounding it, including more than 30 boats and more than 150 models of the prestigious naval heritage. 

The permanent exhibitions reveal recreational boats, small boats, engines, models and wrecks. You can also check the Aquariums for snapshots of lakeside wildlife, the mouth of a river, marshes and canals. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: LAC Lugano Arte e Cultura
properties.lead_text: An impressive platform for contemporary creativity from southern Switzerland.
properties.description:
LAC Lugano Arte e Cultura is open to visitors in two different localities and offers a fascinating view of cultural worlds that share the same regional roots. Both locations bid collections and temporary exhibitions in a worthy backdrop.

The Palazzo Reali is the magnificent Renaissance building displaying works from 1400 to 1850. In the new "LAC am See" edifice by the lake, the focus is on arts from 1850 until today. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: La Maison du Gruyère Show Dairy
properties.lead_text: La Maison du Gruyère Show Dairy is the place to learn about the production of Le Gruyère AOP cheese.
properties.description:
The show dairy, which was opened in 1969, is located in Pringy near Gruyères, at the foot of the castle hill. Here you get to learn about the production of Le Gruyère AOP cheese, a process steeped in tradition that has been passed on from generation to generation.

The exhibition is interactive and sensual: you can listen to cowbells ringing, pet a cow, smell the fragrance of Alpine hay and, of course, taste the cheese in its different stages of ripeness.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: La Maison du Gruyère Show Dairy
images.description: La Maison du Gruyère Show Dairy

properties.title: Kyburg Castle Museum
properties.lead_text: This is an award-winning castle museum featuring a historic iron maiden.
properties.description:
Kyburg is Eastern Switzerland's most important feudal castle and now home to a lively, newly arranged museum. You can take part in a court of justice, look around the cellar, the attic and the torture chamber, or sniff at spices of the medieval kitchen.

Kyburg Castle was the home of the counts of Kyburg, one of the greatest noble houses in South Germany. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kunsthalle - Art Gallery
properties.lead_text: Discover a wide range of Bernese, national and international artworks.
properties.description:
The Bern Art Gallery has become renowned worldwide for its special exhibitions of artists such as Klee, Giacometti, Moore, Johns, Lewitt, Nauman, and Buren. There are also themed exhibitions such as Harald Szeemann's "When Attitudes Become Form". 

This museum sees itself as a place for artistic debate and critical questioning of the phenomena of our times. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Le Laténium Archaeological Museum
properties.lead_text: More than a hundred archaeological sites brought to light for your delight.
properties.description:
The Archaeological Museum is the largest one in Switzerland of this kind. It is located on the spot where remains of three prehistoric sites were discovered. There are 3,000 fascinating finds that illustrate our ancestors' everyday lives. You can also check the authentic, faithful reproductions that are on show in the archaeological park. There are guided tours and workshops for groups. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex), and the boat trip between the Neuchâtel harbour and the Laténium's jetty is free of charge.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kunst Museum Winterthur
properties.lead_text: Discover one of the most beautiful modern art collections in Switzerland!
properties.description:
Since the inauguration of the new building in 1995, the Kunstverein Winterthur can permanently exhibit part of its splendid collection. The mature old building now houses an overwhelming collection of French masterpieces from the Impressionist period, as well as other more modern art movements. 

You will also encounter famous names such as Monet, Van Gogh, Kandinsky, and Picasso. The museum is home to both established as well as hardly known contemporary artists. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kirchner Museum Davos
properties.lead_text: Admire the works of the expressionist Ernst Ludwig Kirchner.
properties.description:
Kirchner Museum is the work of the Zurich architects Annette Gigon and Mike Guyer. The more than 1,400 works by the German expressionist Ernst Ludwig Kirchner are staged in four cubes, connected by a branched and bright foyer. 

Kirchner spent the last 20 years of his life in Davos. Here, he developed his unmistakable style – constantly representational but noticeably flat. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kipfen Gorge at Kalpetran
properties.lead_text: This is one of the most scenic sections along the Glacier Express route.
properties.description:
The train line and the River Vispa run parallel at close quarters. In the past, flooding and avalanches have caused considerable damage. The flow of the Vispa is now regulated and the railway track is protected by a brick wall to avoid further damage.

The wild and romantic Kipfen Gorge is among the Glacier Express route’s most scenic sections, and it is part of the Grand Train Tour of Switzerland.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Jenisch Museum
properties.lead_text: This museum is entirely dedicated to art lovers.
properties.description:
The Jenisch Museum in Vevey with its impressive exterior houses a collection of art work. While discovering this gem of a museum, you will be surprised by the pointy arches and well-defined interiors of the building's architecture.

The fine arts gallery also houses the cantonal print collection. Besides this, You will find here the Kokoschka Foundation collection. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Jegenstorf Castle
properties.lead_text: Enjoy numerous events and a stunning, freely accessible castle park.
properties.description:
Castle Jegenstorf is set amid a paradisiacal park. It was rebuilt as a baroque-style manor in the 18th century. This is the place where iridescent figures such as Friedrich von Erlach, General Guisan and Emperor Selassie of Ethiopia once slept. 

Today, the building is home to Bern’s museum of living. A majestic space with filigree chairs and heavy wooden cabinets that stand on thick carpets, walls adorned with oil portraits. In the Castle Café, you can drink cider produced from the fruits of the own castle gardens. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: International Red Cross and Red Crescent Museum
properties.lead_text: This is a unique opportunity to learn about the history of humanitarian action.
properties.description:
The International Red Cross and Red Crescent Museum allows you to explore three major challenges in today’s world: defending human dignity, restoring family links, reducing natural risks. The exhibition is an adventure, initiating visitors into contemporary humanitarian action.

Within each zone, you enter a phase which aims at raising your awareness and during which you live through an intense emotional experience. A second stage provides you with information and historical background. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: International Museum of the Reformation
properties.lead_text: Martin Luther and Johannes Calvin: Do you know the history behind the two reformers?
properties.description:
The International Museum of the Reformation in Geneva was opened in 2005. Its purpose is to depict the history of the Reformation initiated by Martin Luther, Johannes Calvin and others. The museum is the winner of the 2007 Council of Europe Museum Prize.

Here, you can find numerous archival documents and a rich iconography that reveals the origins of the reformation movement - from past to present. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and incorporates an underground passageway that connects the museum to the archaeological site under the Saint-Pierre cathedral.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: International Clock Museum
properties.lead_text: Tick-tock, tick-tock. Welcome to the home of more than 4,500 collection pieces!
properties.description:
The International Clock Museum reveals the technical, artistic, social and economic aspects of the history of watchmaking. Everything is illustrated in a lively manner. Among other collection pieces, you will be able to inspect about 2,700 watches and 700 wall clocks.

You can slip into the role of the observer or become the short-term supervisor of some surprising little experiments, while your eye catches the beauty and ingenuity of the exhibited movements. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: HR Giger Museum
properties.lead_text: The surreal works of H.R. Giger come alive inside the Château St. Germain castle.
properties.description:
H.R. Giger bought Château St. Germain after he was awarded an Oscar for his “Alien“ monster. And since 1998, the noble abode has been a museum in which you can view the large collection of works by the artist with great amazement.

The rooms of the museum are filled with scurrilous film decor, pictures, sculptures, and furniture. In the famous HR Giger Bar, you find yourself seated in a vault of imitation bones as you gaze at shelves full of dead sculls while taking a sip of your drink. A weird and wonderful experience in keeping with the memory of the late artist.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: House of Rousseau and Literature (MRL)
properties.lead_text: Here's a lively introduction to the legacy of this famous citizen of Geneva.
properties.description:
Jean-Jacques Rousseau was born at 40 Grand-Rue in Geneva’s Old Town. The House of Rousseau and Literature has now been created at this address. The goal is to keep alive the work of one of the minds that have had the profound impact on modern thinking. 

The trajectory of this illustrious Genevan citizen, writer, musician and philosopher is staged in a subtle synchronisation of sound and image. Here, you can enjoy extracts from literary and musical works that bring the character of Rousseau to life. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: History Museum Baden
properties.lead_text: The museum is dedicated to the history of the city and region of Baden.
properties.description:
The History Museum Baden transports you back into the past. You basically enter a large area by the river with significant Roman finds, city models, photographs, and many other documents and objects that throw light on the history of the local industry.

The historic rooms in the Governor’s Castle bear witness to Baden’s role as the official meeting place for the council of the Swiss Confederacy. Here, you will learn how the ruling classes did as they pleased, and what their relationship with their subjects was like. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: History and Ethnology Museum St. Gallen
properties.lead_text: Embrace an exciting blend of history and ethnology.
properties.description:
The History and Ethnology Museum collection includes items dating from prehistory and early history to the 20th century. You will also find many articles from different cultures of the world. Since 2007, the History and Ethnology Museum has been home to a special children's museum. 

There are also several temporary exhibitions displayed each year. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Historic Museum Bischofszell
properties.lead_text: Discover two listed patrician houses from the 18th century.
properties.description:
The Museum Bischofszell prides itself on more than 20 rooms offering an insight into the living culture as well as into the city's history. Since 1972, the museum has been home to cultural items of the past 500 years, from late Gothic to the 20th century.  

The collection of ceramics, the map collection, the drugstore and the pharmacy, as well as toys from the 19th and 20th centuries, are among the main focal points of the exhibition. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Hegi Castle Winterthur
properties.lead_text: Discover the residence of noble families across several centuries.
properties.description:
The Hegi Castle Winterthur is very well preserved and includes a residential tower built in 1200, a knights’ house added later, and a farm building. The interior will transport you to the Late Middle Ages.

Here, you will discover furniture, stoves, ceramic items, glass paintings and weapons that date back to the period between the 15th and 18th centuries. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Haus Konstruktiv
properties.lead_text: It's the only institution in Switzerland dedicated to the historical and contextual processing of concrete, constructive and conceptual art.
properties.description:
Haus Konstruktiv prides itself on changing exhibitions and collection presentations on five floors. This means that you have access to a range of ways in which you may discover art and its historical background. On permanent display is the gem of the collection, the legendary “Rockefeller Dining Room” by Swiss artist Fritz Glarner. 

Alongside the exhibitions, there are also regular lectures, talks, and discussions with artists. You can also spend some fun time at the attractive cafe-lounge or at the versatile museum shop. This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Grindelwald Museum
properties.lead_text: Learn more about the history of mountaineering in a fun way.
properties.description:
The Grindelwald Museum was opened in 1963. Here, you can discover how the profession of mountain guiding started and how it evolved. There are also exhibitions that focus on crafts, Alpine farming, agriculture and other aspects related to mountains.

Since 2014, there is a special room where you can listen to five radio plays that evoke the history of the Eiger. There is also an electronic museum guide available in English and German. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Graubünden Art Museum
properties.lead_text: Meet with an art collection that's been more than 100 years in the making.
properties.description:
The Graubünden Art Museum was founded in 1900. Since then, the collection has grown year after year. You can look back on more than 100 years of focused art collection work. One of the unmistakable collections that you must not miss was created by Angelika Kauffmann.

The collection also reflects the variety of contemporary artwork. Five to six special exhibitions are held every year. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Glass Blowing at the "Glasi" Factory Hergiswil
properties.lead_text: Visit the only factory in Switzerland where glass is still mouth-blown.
properties.description:
Commonly known as "Glasi", the glass blowing factory in Hergiswil is popular among locals and tourists. Here, you can discover a unique technique of shaping glass. The workers blow the shapes by mouth.

You will also take part in this exquisite process. Together with a glassblower, you will be able to create your own glass ball. Every aspect of glass is explained in the museum. 

This highlight is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Glacier Garden
properties.lead_text: Glacier Garden is nature's own monument to its history, with a park and museum.
properties.description:
Glacier Garden is a tourist attraction and an oasis of peace, far from the hustle and bustle of the city. Here, you can witness the remains of the last ice age, but also fossilised mussels and palm leaves found in the local rock strata.

The exciting history is brought to life by a multimedia show and interactive informative system. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Gianadda Foundation - Archaeology and Classic Cars
properties.lead_text: The Gianadda Foundation is an internationally renowned cultural foundation with multi-faceted aspects.
properties.description:
The Gianadda Foundation offers an interesting range of archaeological exhibits, vintage cars and sculpture park to art collections and concerts. The museum was built by the engineer, artist and art patron Léonard Gianadda who found the ruins of Switzerland's oldest Gallo-Roman temple while building his house. 

The cultural center houses findings dating back to the Gallo-Roman era, as well as no less than 50 classic cars. You can also check the collection of sculptures in the park. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Gianadda Foundation - Archaeology and Classic Cars
images.description: Gianadda Foundation - Archaeology and Classic Cars

properties.title: Geneva Old Town and Cathedral of Saint Pierre
properties.lead_text: The Cathedral of Saint Pierre sits on the peak of the hill on which the old town is located.
properties.description:
The architecture of the cathedral has undergone more than one change during the course of its history. Its first phase of construction dates back to 1160 and lasted nearly a century. The cathedral has the largest collection of Gothic and Romanesque capitals in Switzerland. 

You can also enjoy an amazing 360° panorama of Geneva and the lake after you climb the 157 steps. And who would have guessed that there is an archaeological site located underneath? 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Old Town and Cathedral of Saint Pierre
images.description: Old Town and Cathedral of Saint Pierre

properties.title: Geneva Art Museum
properties.lead_text: Over 7,000 exhibits are on display, ranging from prehistoric finds to modern paintings.
properties.description:
The Geneva Art Museum is the largest art museum in the city and home to an extensive collection by the eccentric and distinctive Swiss portraitist, Jean-Etienne Liotard. Here, you can discover thematically categorised and separated collections. 

There are also important finds dating back to early history, prehistoric times and antiquity can be viewed in the Archeology Department. Finally, a special section is devoted to fine arts.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and includes numerous works by Ferdinand Hodler, Félix Vallotton and Jean-Baptiste Camille Corot.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Forte Airolo Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover an interesting military museum.
properties.description:
The fortress Forte Airolo is located 1.5 kilometres above Airolo in the Leventina on the cantonal road and today serves as a military museum. The exhibition puts emphasis on weapons, equipment, blueprints and documents about this fortress.

Make sure you also take a closer look at the fortress as it is the oldest one in Europe. It was built between 1886 and 1891 and had the task of defending the whole area and access to the rail and road to the St. Gotthard. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fondation Pierre Arnaud
properties.lead_text: Immerse yourself in an exhibition space of around 1,000 square meters!
properties.description:
An impressive thing about Fondation Pierre Arnaud is the extraordinary facade. There are 84 solar glass panels cover the building of Architect Jean-Pierre Emery. The purpose of this building is to create a kind of dialogue between Swiss and European art.

The summer and winter exhibitions surprise with themes such as "Black Homme" or "The devil, feather and paintbrush". If you want to discover the major Swiss collections, you need to visit the museum in autumn. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fondation de l’Hermitage – Art Museum
properties.lead_text: Delight yourself with a view that inspired the leading landscape painter Camille Corot.
properties.description:
In 1841, the banker Charles-Juste Bugnion purchased a piece of land above Lausanne and built a stately mansion on it. The view from the mansion was immortalized by Camille Corot in a painting.

The house was turned into a private foundation in 1976. Here, you can find paintings created by past and present Swiss painters as well as past and present foreign artists, including Bocion, Degas, and Plazzotta. 

By the way: Don't miss out on the excellent brunch called “Art and Cuisine”.

The admission to the museum is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fine Arts Museum, Le Locle
properties.lead_text: The Musée des beaux-arts features no less than four floors.
properties.description:
The Fine Arts Museum is famous for its intriguing and strange atmosphere. Here, you will discover an exhibition that will bring you closer to nature. Once you advance through the halls of the museums, you will be mesmerised by a change of scenery towards a multitude of objects.

You will see that the pictures are far beyond your imagination. It is also interesting the way the exhibits were spread around the four floors. 

This museum is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: FIFA World Football Museum
properties.lead_text: The FIFA World Football Museum was created in honour of the most popular team sport in the world.
properties.description:
On 3,000 square metres, the museum presents the fascinating history and development of international football. The interactive multimedia exhibition reveals how the sport has influenced and enriched the lives of people around the world.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Ethnography Museum Neuchâtel
properties.lead_text: Discover an interesting exhibition with themes from a long lost past.
properties.description:
The Ethnography Museum Neuchâtel prides itself with interesting permanent exhibitions. Here, you will see artefacts coming from Ancient Egypt and the Himalayas, collections from Bhutan and Tibet. You will also explore the works of General Charles Daniel de Meuron's.

There are so many interesting things to discover here that it is a great place to visit with the entire family. The children will certainly not get bored!

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Espace Jean Tinguely & Niki de Saint Phalle
properties.lead_text: Discover the rattling work of art by Fribourg-born Jean Tinguely.
properties.description:
The sophisticated and dynamic works of art by the artist Jean Tinguely exert an extraordinary fascination on viewers. You could spend hours here trying to understand the complex mechanics, the likes of which are second to none. 

Inside the Espace Tinguely, it’s easy to see time fly away. You can analyse Tinguely's infernal machines and admire the beautifully round and harmonious shaped sculptures of his wife Niki de Phalle. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Engadiner Museum St. Moritz
properties.lead_text: Learn to embrace the culture of the Engadine inside this typical house.
properties.description:
The Engadiner Museum, whose exterior looks like a 300-hundred years old Engadine-style house, is actually only one hundred years old. It was Riet Campell (1866 - 1951) who founded this museum and entrusted the architect Nikolaus Hartmann (1880 - 1956) with the construction of a house for his collection. 

Its purpose is to reflect the typical Engadine style. The museum shelters an important collection of furnishings and objects specific to the Engadine region. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Collection de l'Art Brut
properties.lead_text: This museum showcases a one-of-a-kind collection of “outsider art”.
properties.description:
The Collection de l'Art Brut displays a different type of art, produced by self-taught social misfits such as psychiatric hospital patients and prisoners. 

The current was noticed by Jean Dubuffet, who called it "Art Brut." Dubuffet gathered countless examples which he donated to the city of Lausanne in 1971. The collection has since become known as the international focus for artistic communication from another world. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Chocolat Frey Visitor Centre
properties.lead_text: Chocolate moments for you, your friends and your family.
properties.description:
Discover the world of the cocoa bean while on the chocolate trail and find out what kind of chocolate lover you are. Give your sense of smell a good workout in the aroma laboratory, and see who can create the heaviest block of chocolate in the chocolate tank.

Finally, enjoy the fascinating experience of chocolate tasting and chocolate moulding. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Chablais History Museum in Vouvry
properties.lead_text: Discover the cultural heritage of the Chablais region.
properties.description:
The Chablais History Museum is located in the Château de la Porte-du-Scex dating from the 16th century. It opened its doors in 2008 and offers permanent and temporary collections.

The latter collections include 3D models of the Chablais region, making the museum highly interactive. The temporary exhibitions are changed every two years and reflect the cultural heritage and history of the region. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Cerny Inuit Collection in Bern
properties.lead_text: A museum dedicated to Polar cultures.
properties.description:
The Cerny Inuit Collection focuses on topics like family, compositions, animals, hunting, and people. The impressive sculptures are made of natural materials, like whalebone, antler, stone, or musk ox horn. The purpose of this collection is to reveal the similarities between the people living in the Polar regions and the rest of the world.

You will feel connected to people from all cultures and thus become part of the cultural diversity. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Castle of Gruyères
properties.lead_text: Visit Castle of Gruyères for fascinating insights into 800 years of history, art, and legends.
properties.description:
The Castle of Gruyères was built in the 13th century. Today, the medieval fortress houses prestigious collections. You can explore the castle and exhibition on your own with the handout guide available in twelve languages.

Here you can embark on a journey through the ages and discover its many amazing treasures: the precious stained-glass windows dating from the Middle Ages, capes belonging to Charles the Bold’s Knights, paintings by Jean-Baptiste Camille Corot and so on. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and is open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Castelgrande Castle
properties.lead_text: This UNESCO Cultural World Heritage site is one of the main attractions in Ticino.
properties.description:
Not only unique to the Alpine region, Castelgrande Castle is also part of the prestigious UNESCO Cultural World Heritage list since the year 2000. The mighty walls, towers, battlements and gates of these imposing fortress never cease to astonish you.

Castelgrande, also known as Castello di San Michele or Burg Uri, was built in the 13th century. There are two museums inside the castle: The Archaeological Museum and the Museum of Art. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Cartoon Museum Basel
properties.lead_text: Delight yourself with caricatures, humorous drawings and comics courtesy of 700 cartoonists from around the world.
properties.description:
The Cartoon Museum Basel hosts more than 4,000 original works by around 700 artists from 40 countries. It is the only cartoon museum in Switzerland and has received a special architectural design of Herzog & de Meuron to host all the works. 

In the angular rooms, everything revolves around satire, caricatures, humorous drawings and comics. There are also individual exhibitions, readings, and workshops. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Bourbaki-Panorama - Giant Panoramic Painting
properties.lead_text: An impressive and disturbing witness to the history of the media and war in the 19th century.
properties.description:
The Bourbaki-Panorama in Lucerne is a humanistic portrayal of the German-French war of 1870-1871. This was the subject of intense public scrutiny and emotions at the time. Newspapers published reports about it; painters depicted the events in images.

A museum (very close to the Glacier Garden) conveys knowledge about the war and the fate of the Bourbaki army. Impressively, the painter of the gigantic panorama, Edouard Castres, experienced the war as a Red Cross volunteer. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Berry Museum
properties.lead_text: Visit the museum dedicated to the doctor and painter Peter Robert Berry.
properties.description:
The Berry Museum is housed in a century-old villa in the heart of St. Moritz. Here, you can view a comprehensive family collection, assembling the majority of the artist‘s oil paintings, pastels and drawings created over more than forty years.

The purpose of the museum is to offer deeper insights into the artistic vision of Peter Robert Berry. The paintings are inspired and influenced by the internationally celebrated and locally important artists Giovanni Segantini and Giovanni Giacometti. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Berne Historical Museum
properties.lead_text: Visit one of Switzerland's most important cultural and historical museums.
properties.description:
The Berne Historical Museum hosts a general historical collection containing approximately 500,000 objects as well as the Einstein Museum. In its permanent exhibition, you can discover highlights from the fields of history, prehistory, early history and ethnography through a diverse, multi-media approach. 

The objects on display range from the Stone Age to the present, from cultures of all continents. The integrated Einstein Museum offers a powerful presentation of the life and work of Albert Einstein and places it in the context of world history. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Benedictine Monastery St. Johann
properties.lead_text: This is one of the few existing architectural remnants from the Carolingian period.
properties.description:
The Benedictine Monastery St. Johann houses the world's largest and best preserved early medieval picture cycles. The convent museum in the Planta tower enables the nuns to provide visitors with a glimpse of the convent's inner workings.

Hence the Alpine region's oldest castle tower, dating back to 960, is now accessible. Within nine rooms, the exhibition presents 1200 years of monastic and architectural history. As the edifice dates from 775 C.E., you will discover the largest cycle of early medieval frescoes.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex). It is considered a UNESCO World Heritage site.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Basel Toy World Museum
properties.lead_text: This truly fantastic museum hosts over 2,500 teddy bears, dolls, doll houses, little old shops and carousels.
properties.description:
Basel Toy World Museum is the home of toys from top to bottom. There are over 6,000 exhibited objects waiting to warm children’s hearts and awake nostalgia in adults. The collections, arranged in the form of real settings, almost appear to be alive.

The entire building is wheelchair accessible - and a digital listening device is available to those with hearing difficulties. Furthermore, the own smartphone or tablet may be used as an interactive museum guide. You may also want to treat yourself to a break in the restaurant La Sosta between toying around. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Basel Paper Mill
properties.lead_text: A combination of museum and hands-on workshops.
properties.description:
The Basel Paper Mill is one of the few museums in Europe to maintain and preserve the historic techniques at an authentic venue. The building housing was completely refurbished. There is a permanent collection that was renewed in its entirety. 

You can access different activity points, presentations and workshops. You are even invited to try and make your own paper in the medieval environment of the Basel Paper Mill. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Basel Historical Museum – Music Museum
properties.lead_text: If you love music, this is your museum!
properties.description:
Since the year 2000, Switzerland's largest collection of musical instruments has been on display in the "Lohnhof", a historic building. Approximately 650 exhibited instruments from five centuries can now be experienced even acoustically by means of a multi-media information system. 

The reconstruction of the former monastery complex and the prison tract for museum purposes is a successful example of combining the old and the new. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex):
properties.area_of_validity: 스위스 트래블 패스 소지 시 무료로 관람할 수 있다.

properties.title: Basel Historical Museum
properties.lead_text: Basel Historical Museum has three different locations – each brings history to life.
properties.description:
Basel Historical Museum with its three sites is widely regarded as the most important museum of cultural history on the Upper Rhine. It collects, conserves, records and researches objects and artefacts of relevance to our cultural heritage for future generations, tells visitors the story of Basel, and is a place for discourse and engagement with the past, present and future.

- "Barfüsserkirche" (church): Experience history from up close
- "Haus zum Kirschgarten": Basel's greatest interiors of the 18th century
- "Musikmuseum" (music museum): Switzerland's largest collection of musical instruments

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Barryland, the Saint Bernard Museum
properties.lead_text: Share in the world of the legendary Saint Bernard dogs.
properties.description:
The museum was founded in 2006 with a focus on St. Bernard hospice dogs. The ground floor houses the kennels and space where the dogs are taken care of. You can watch the unique dogs as they run around the park premises. 

You can also take a tour and find out more about the history of the Great Saint Bernard on the first floor. The second floor hosts temporary exhibitions. There is also a restaurant available for a pleasurable visit. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Barbier-Müller Museum
properties.lead_text: Primitive objects used by man in search of beauty.
properties.description:
The Barbier-Müller Museum houses sculptures, masks, jewels, ritual objects, cloth and all types of ornaments. These are forms, styles and materials used by primitive people, and you will surely be mesmerised by these unique objects.

Here, you will discover exceptional collections from distant civilisations throughout the world, including Africa, Oceania, Indonesia. The sculptures and stone monuments, in particular, are unique pieces, so you will definitely have lots of things to analyse. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Aventicum – Helvetians and Romans
properties.lead_text: Take a trip back in time and discover Aventicum from over 2,000 years ago.
properties.description:
The museum Aventicum – Helvetians and Romans displays important finds: the copy of the 33-centimetre-tall golden bust of Emperor Marc Aurel, mosaics, stone inscriptions and numerous artefacts of the Romans' daily life.

As the capital of the Helvetians and the Roman colony, it was an economic, spiritual and cultural center thanks to its good traffic links and trade routes. You can now visit the remains of the impressively large buildings, the forum's thermal baths, the amphitheatre, as well as the temple ruins.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and displays an impressive heritage of long lost times.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Augusta Raurica - The Roman City
properties.lead_text: Live the life of the Romans in the best-preserved Roman town north of the Alps.
properties.description:
Augusta Raurica is a 2000-year-old settlement named after the Celtic Rauriker tribe and the Roman Emperor Augustus. In its heyday, the city was home to as many as 20'000 inhabitants. Workshops, commercial enterprises, taverns, temples and public baths are closely strung close together.

Take some time to discover countless finds such as the largest silver treasure dating from Late Antiquity, the Roman domestic animal park with ancient animal species - and much more. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art Museum Appenzell
properties.lead_text: Who would have imagined to find contemporary art amid historic Appenzell?
properties.description:
The Art Museum Appenzell prides itself on changing exhibitions that present aspects of the works of the painters Carl August Liner (1871-1946) and Carl Walter Liner (1914 -1997). You can also enjoy 20th century and contemporary art.

The museum was designed by the noted architects Annette Gigon and Mike Guyer. It is truly worth a visit if you are in love with art, architecture - or both! 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art and History Museum Neuchâtel
properties.lead_text: Here's the best place to learn about the history of Neuchâtel.
properties.description:
The Art and History Museum is located on an elegant promenade right by the port of Neuchâtel. The building presents itself in Renaissance-style elements. Here, you can enjoy a contemporary and extraordinarily versatile program among the more than 20 rooms. 

The changing exhibitions regularly broach new and exciting aspects of the city's history. Also worth seeing are the collections comprising images of Pierre-Eugene Bouvier or the watch collections of Ferdinand Berthoud. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art and History Museum Fribourg
properties.lead_text: Discover the largest collection of sculptures of Switzerland!
properties.description:
The Art and History Museum has been founded almost two centuries ago. Today, it is housed in three different buildings: in the noble Ratzehof city palace, in a former slaughterhouse and in a disused armory. 

You will be amazed at the size and diversity of this large collection of sculptures. It includes works from the 12th century up until today. You can immerse yourself in the story of stained glass and be inspired by the sophistication of the old goldsmiths.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex), and you can also visit the stately French-style gardens and beguiling roses.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Ariana Museum – Ceramic and Glass Art
properties.lead_text: At this museum, twelve centuries of ceramic history meet seven centuries of glass production.
properties.description:
Ariana Museum - Ceramic and Glass Art documents both ceramic and glass production with over 27,000 exhibits from Switzerland, Europe, the Near East and the Far East. The museum was build by Gustave Revilliod in a Neo-Classical and New Baroque architectural style at the end of the 19th century.

The Ariana Museum is appreciated far beyond the borders of Switzerland and is the seat of the International Academy of Ceramics. 

This museum admission is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

images.title: Ariana Museum - Ceramic and Glass Art
images.description: Ariana Museum - Ceramic and Glass Art

properties.title: Appenzell Folklore Museum
properties.lead_text: Here's a major collection of Swiss peasant art.
properties.description:
The folklore museum in charming Appenzell is closely associated with farming and Alpine dairy culture. The museum documents this dairy tradition with handicraft exhibits on the ground floor, focusing on Alpine cheese-making and the implements and receptacles that were once used.

You can also see the typical regional decorations worn by people and animals: bells and belts, braces and dog collars made by Alpine saddlers, as well as costumes, traditional jewellery and accessories. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Alimentarium – Museum of Nutrition
properties.lead_text: Vevey is host to the first museum in the world devoted exclusively to nutrition.
properties.description:
At the Alimentarium – Museum of Nutrition, you can peek inside pots to view the contents and culinary habits of people from near and far. All facets of the human diet of yesterday and today make for interesting discoveries as you become more familiar with the eating habits, and artistic aspects of food and nourishment.

The emblem of the Alimentarium is an eight-meter-high fork, which, incidentally, is even registered in the Guinness Book of Records. Make sure to take a selfie with the fork and the lake behind you... 

This museum is entirely included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Albula Railway Museum
properties.lead_text: Are you a railway enthusiast? This museum is a must!
properties.description:
The Albula Railway is a UNESCO World Heritage site. It is one of the most spectacular Swiss railway lines, and this museum tells its fascinating story. Its rooms contain a wealth of original exhibits, including one of the last «Crocodile» locomotives in existence.

In all, the extensive collection covering more than 1,300 square meters includes more than 400 exhibits from more than 100 years of railway history. And fittingly for Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) holders, the admission to this attraction is entirely included.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Aigle Castle
properties.lead_text: Discover the Vine and Wine Museum within the prestigious castle walls.
properties.description:
Aigle Castle is located in the heart of the renowned vineyards between the Alps and Lake Geneva. The magnificent fortification has reigned supreme since the end of the 12th century. You are now invited to discover its secrets and the Espace Frédéric Rouge within its prestigious walls.

The castle is the former residence of the Knights of Aigle, the nobility of Compey-Thorens and then the Bernese Governors. 

The castle and museum are included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and are open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Abbey Library St. Gallen
properties.lead_text: St. Gallen's Abbey Library is one of the oldest and most beautiful of its kind in the world.
properties.description:
The origins of Abbey Library St. Gallen date back to the 8th century. Many of its 160,000 priceless texts are nearly that old, including a Gospel of John ca 800 AD, liturgical works, prayer books and biographies of saints from as early as the 9th century AD.

The library was constructed between 1758-67 in rococo style. You also need to check the burnished woodwork and ceiling frescoes. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Abbey Basilica - Monastery Treasure
properties.lead_text: This is one of the richest ecclesiastical treasures in Europe.
properties.description:
Founded in the year 515, the Abbey of St. Maurice in Valais is the oldest Christian monastery in the Western world to have existed without interruption in its original location. 

As a cultural heritage site of global significance, the Abbey has opened a new and updated tour to the public. You can discover the basilica, the archaeological site of the former churches and the jewels of the treasury using an audio guide with music. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and is open throughout the year, every day except Mondays.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Aathal Dinosaur Museum
properties.lead_text: Are you ready to step into the empire of dinosaurs?
properties.description:
The Aathal Dinosaur Museum opened its gates to the public over 20 years ago. Here, you can enjoy a huge selection of exhibits as well as interesting activities. The interactive displays show you how dinosaurs lived, and there is a way to peek into a real lab where paleontologists are at work.

Besides the traditional tour of the museum, you can also watch films and participate in play activities. This is also a great place to spend time with your family. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: “Col-des-Roches“ Cave Mills in Le Locle
properties.lead_text: Learn how the inhabitants of the valley of Le Locle began to use subterranean streams.
properties.description:
The “Col-des-Roches“ Cave Mills aim to reveal how the subterranean factory was set up 400 years ago. The cave factory, which is the only one in Europe, was restored by volunteers and is open to the public today.

This fascinating museum illustrates the use of hydro power and enables you to gain insight into the special character of the Jura. In the grottoes and in the tunnels you can view the restored mill and sawmill mechanisms. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Ital Reding-Haus
properties.lead_text: Visit a magnificent manor house dating back to the 17/18th century.
properties.description:
The Ital Reding-Haus is located in the Reding estate. Here, you will stumble upon a magnificent manor house that dates from the 17 - 18th century. You will find the museum on the 1st floor. Also, do not forget to visit the baroque garden. 

Another major attraction is a remarkable building within the estate: the house Bethlehem that was built in 1287. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Henry Dunant Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover a museum dedicated to the personality and life of Henry Dunant.
properties.description:
Henry Dunant is an important Swiss personality. He was the founder and initiator of the Red Cross and lived from 1887 to 1910 in Heiden. 

His memory is kept alive at the Henry Dunant Museum. Here, you will discover an entire room dedicated to his vision of a world without war and poverty. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Franz Gertsch
properties.lead_text: A museum dedicated to the works of the renowned Swiss artist Franz Gertsch.
properties.description:
The Museum Franz Gertsch is an extraordinary building - more than worth a visit if only to admire the architecture. Franz Gertsch is one of Switzerland's leading contemporary artists who made himself a name far and wide through his monumental photo-realistic woodcutting and paintings. 

The collection housed in the centrally located museum in Burgdorf includes works by Franz Gertsch from the years from 1984 until today. There are also changing exhibitions held on a regular basis, presenting a wide range of additional contemporary art. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Wildegg Castle
properties.lead_text: Discover an oasis of calm and an invitation to stroll, smell and marvel.
properties.description:
The Wildegg Castle welcomes you in the speaking gallery of ancestral portraits. Ladies and lords of the castle manor will make you feel like royalty. Former castle residents provide entertaining and informative insights into the castle’s history from medieval times to the 20th century. 

You can also experience authenticity with historic gardens and lifestyle. The living and working rooms of the castle are originally furnished and show the sophisticated culture and the exquisite taste of the Effinger family. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and if you want to spend the night here it is important to mention that there are rooms available for rent.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Ursern Valley Museum
properties.lead_text: Take a fantastic tour through Andermatt!
properties.description:
An interesting thing about this museum is that it is part of the Andermatt tour that starts when it’s dark. The guide (Bänz Simmen) tells stories about the life in the Urserntal valley. During the tour, you might even spot a nocturnal animal.

Hot beverages and pastries are served for refreshment in the Ursern Valley Museum, followed by a tour of the exhibits to conclude the evening. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Tell Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover a museum dedicated exclusively to the Swiss patriot, Wilhelm Tell.
properties.description:
The Tell-Museum is home to a unique collection of historical and artistic documents, accounts and miscellanea spanning six centuries relating to the Swiss patriot, Wilhelm Tell. Here, you can learn interesting details and be mesmerised by the evolution of this famous freedom fighter.

The museum is quite interactive. This means that you can enjoy an instructive slide show called "Wilhelm Tell". 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Baselland
properties.lead_text: Discover exhibits that alternate between natural and cultural sciences.
properties.description:
Museum Baselland (Museum.BL) holds a collection of over two million originals from the fields of natural science, archaeology, ethnology, art, and photography. A considerable part of these is attractively and understandably presented according to the individual subject areas. 

A separate exhibition is dedicated to the silk ribbon industry. There are also temporary exhibits on various subjects, as well as a café and a museum shop. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Bellpark
properties.lead_text: Spend quality time analysing original exhibitions.
properties.description:
Museum Bellpark prides itself with exhibitions on the theme of motorways, huts and shacks, or tunnels and bunkers. Traditional objects are surprisingly juxtaposed with contemporary objects in this museum.

Photography is among the main themes of the museum, including temporary exhibitions showing current trends in Swiss art and the latest video art. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museo Castello San Materno Ascona
properties.lead_text: Discover the art collection of the Kurt and Barbara Alten Cultural Foundation.
properties.description:
Museo Castello San Materno prides itself on a permanent exhibition that features German Impressionist and Expressionist works by artists from the Worpswede artists’ colony. Included among them are paintings by Paula Modersohn-Becker, Otto Modersohn, Hans am Ende, Fritz Overbeck, and many more. 

You will also discover the works of "Brücke" and "Der Blauer Reiter" groups of artists. A special exhibition has been held each year during the summer months since 2016. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Regional Museum Chüechlihus Langnau
properties.lead_text: Discover the fascinating history of the Emmental.
properties.description:
The Regional Museum Chüechlihus Langnau is located in one of the oldest building in the region. It is almost 500 years old. Here you will discover the industries of Emmental, handicrafts and get to know the most significant people who lived here.

An interesting aspect of the building is the fact that it had multiple purposes throughout its history. At the ground floor, there once was a coffee shop with delicious pastries. Actually, the name of the museum is derived from it. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fundaziun Museum Bergün
properties.lead_text: Discover this cultural and meeting place for young and old!
properties.description:
The Fundaziun Museum Bergün aims to be a lively cultural and meeting place. Here you will come across people of all ages. The purpose of the museum is to be more than a 300-year-old Bündnerhaus. 

Here, you can enjoy various attractions displayed in 9 showrooms. The Court, for example, reveals several cellars and stables. At the Carpenter workshop, you will discover different tools used for woodworking. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: City Museum Aarau
properties.lead_text: Amaze yourself with 134 life-size reliefs by the sculptor Josef Felix Müller.
properties.description:
The City Museum Aarau reveals an exciting architectural history. Here, you can enjoy both permanent and temporary exhibitions.
