The permanent one reveals the story of the small town Aarau its diversity of life. You will take a stroll back in time and delight yourself with different types of objects.

The temporary exhibitions are usually hosted in the foyer. Make sure you do not miss the Meyerstollen, an exhibition space for the early industrial building of the textile manufacturer Meyer. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Roman Camp at Museum Aargau
properties.lead_text: Experience the life of the former Roman legion camp.
properties.description:
On the legionnaire's trail in Vindonissa, you can immerse yourself in the fascinating history of Switzerland's only Roman legion camp. Here, you can take a trip back in time and discover the lives of legionnaires and senior officers.

Make sure you do not miss the kitchen and the Roman spa. If you have children, you can take the game tours and participate in numerous public events. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kunst(Zeug)Haus
properties.lead_text: Discover this lively house for Swiss contemporary art.
properties.description:
The Kunst(Zeug)Haus prides itself with an interesting design and with an architecture prize. Here, you will discover Swiss contemporary art. The location is quite outstanding, considering it is a former armoury.

The unique exhibition houses approximately 5'000 works of art. However, they are not all displayed at once, but only selected samples. You will also have the chance to enjoy temporary exhibitions of Swiss artists from a few decades ago to present day.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and it is opened every Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Forum of Swiss History Schwyz
properties.lead_text: Discover the cultural history in the Alpine region.
properties.description:
The Forum of Swiss History Schwyz is one of the most important museums of cultural history. The modern museum reveals a mix of history and culture and makes for a special experience. Here, you can learn how the old Confederation of Switzerland evolved in the Middle Ages.

It is an intriguing museum to visit, considering that you will discover how Switzerland came to be the state that you know today. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Vitromusée Romont, Stained Glass Museum
properties.lead_text: Amaze yourself with works of art that have been created on and behind glass!
properties.description:
In the Stained Glass Museum, exhibits range from medieval glass paintings to the art of reverse glass painting. From the Middle Ages onward up until today, artists have created diverse types of images on glass that are best enjoyed when held up and viewed against the light. 

You will see that there are no informative panels to accompany the exhibits, so you can concentrate fully on viewing the exhibits. Presentations, introductory courses on Glass Art and a research and information centre on Glass Painting are also offered. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: House of Electronic Arts (HeK)
properties.lead_text: Discover the home of electronics!
properties.description:
The HeK introduces you to new forms of art in the age of information - permitting time to ponder over social effects and view the vast potential in a comprehensive way thanks to exhibitions, workshops and guided tours. 

HeK is housed in a former warehouse. The building was cleverly adapted to meet today’s “here and now” standards by the Basel-based architects Alban Rüdisühli and Christoph Ibach. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kunsthaus Zug
properties.lead_text: The most comprehensive collection of Viennese Modernism outside Austria.
properties.description:
The Kunsthaus Zug houses outstanding works by Gerstl, Klimt, Schiele and Wotruba. Since 1996, the collection has been enhanced by the works of international artists such as Tadashi Kawamata, Richard Tuttle, Pavel Pepperstein and Olafur Eliasson. The idyllic garden, bright rooms and a charming bar invite you to linger. 

Each year, there are also five to six temporary exhibitions of 20th century and contemporary art. You can explore Swiss surrealist and fantastic art as well as art from Zug and Central Switzerland. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art Museum Olten
properties.lead_text: Enjoy modern and contemporary Swiss art!
properties.description:
The Art Museum Olten was initially opened in 1905 and houses important collections of modern and contemporary Swiss art. However, the first works were those of political draftsman from Olten and the cartoonist Martin Disteli. 

This lively cultural centre includes charming rooms in the former residential and commercial building. You can visit the special exhibitions on two different floors. There are both thematic groups and solo representations. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Gruyère Regional Museum
properties.lead_text: Explore local traditions, customs, and the heritage of the Gruyère region.
properties.description:
At the Gruyère Regional Museum, you will discover sculpted spoons, wardrobes, costumes and much more. An interesting feature of this museum is that traditional elements are displayed in a modern setting.

The museum traces the history, art, and traditions of the Gruyère region from the 16th and 20th centuries. By means of reconstructed interiors, interactive audiovisual installations and picture albums,  the museum offers a dynamic introduction into the economic, religious and social history of the inhabitants of the region. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of the Swiss Charters of Confederation
properties.lead_text: A collection of the most important documents from the history of the Old Swiss Confederation.
properties.description:
The focal point of The Museum of the Swiss Charters of Confederation is the legendary Federal Charter of 1291 which has long been considered the founding document of Switzerland. It is today as famous as the stories of the Rütli Oath, the freedom battles and the Burgenbruch (destruction of castles), of Wilhelm Tell and the expulsion of the Habsburg bailiffs.

In this museum, you can immerse yourself in the fascinating world of Swiss history and learn important facts on the founding and development of the Swiss Confederation. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Sensorium at Rüttihubelbad
properties.lead_text: Discover entertaining activities for the entire family!
properties.description:
The Sensorium at Rüttihubelbad aims to bring the family together through activating sensory perceptions. Here, you can explore the laws of nature in a unique way. You will learn to appreciate colours, fragrances, light, dark, but also vibrations and sounds. 

There are also temporary exhibitions where you can experience different aspects. To make the experience even more personal, you can have your own picnic in the bistro, or try the local cuisine at the restaurant. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Graubünden Natural History Museum, Chur
properties.lead_text: Find out more about the fascinating flora, fauna, and geology of the Canton of Graubünden.
properties.description:
The Graubünden Natural History Museum was initially housed in the Rhaetian Museum, but starting from 1981, it has been located at Masanserstrasse 31 in a building specially designed for this purpose by the architect Bruno Giacometti.

The permanent exhibition is focused on the themes of biodiversity, habitat, minerals, geology, and fish. The museum also hosts the biodiversity exhibition, which you can experience with all your senses. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: The world of Sasso San Gottardo
properties.lead_text: Discover one of the most secret places in Switzerland in the 20th century.
properties.description:
At the world of Sasso San Gottardo, you will enjoy multimedia exhibitions about mobility and energy. The Metro del Sasso will take you to the historic part of the fortification which used to be top secret. A side tunnel leads to a new observation platform with surprising views of the mountains around the Gotthard. 

You will also be mesmerised by a unique find that was discovered in a crevice – a group of crystals weighing 1.5 tons. To make things even more interesting, you can follow a fascinating film about the amazing crystals of Planggenstock. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and it is opened from June to October.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss National Museum Château de Prangins
properties.lead_text: A beautiful castle and museum overlooking Lake Geneva.
properties.description:
The Swiss National Museum is actually a castle that captivates with its classic architecture, seemingly endless suites and beautiful French style park. The greatly interesting permanent exhibitions are well worth a visit.

Don't miss the new exhibition “Noblesse oblige! – Life at a château in the 18th century», the historic castle kitchen garden – the largest of its kind in Switzerland – and the information center, which is open year-round. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Casa Console Art Museum, Poschiavo
properties.lead_text: Embrace the beautiful world of paintings!
properties.description:
Casa Console Art Museum displays a collection of important paintings from the 19th century. Here, you can enjoy the works of Carl Spitzweg, Franz von Lenbach, Ferdinand Hodler, Alexander Calame, etc. The building offers a unique feeling as it has been renovated entirely in period style.

At this museum, you will also find a gallery, an art school and a music room. There are many things to see, so you may well spend a couple of hours here. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Natural History Museum Neuchâtel
properties.lead_text: A beautiful permanent exhibition of mammals and birds found in Switzerland.
properties.description:
The Natural History Museum is a place for people of all ages. You will find it at the heart of Neuchâtel city. The museum is housed in a historic building that was subject to all-embracing renovations. 

Here, you will enjoy traditional landscape paintings that bring to light the region’s fauna. New rooms, inaugurated in 2012, are dedicated to insects and geology. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Rumine Palace + Espace Arlaud, Lausanne
properties.lead_text: Two interesting museums that you must not miss.
properties.description:
Rumine Palace was built in 1900 thanks to the specific bequest of Gabriel de Rumine. The palace includes a clutch of buildings: the University, the library and the Fine Arts and Science museums.

Espace Arlaud is a building with an appealing design and it is also the oldest museum in Lausanne. Here, you can discover temporary exhibitions of multidisciplinary art. You can visit it for free on the first Saturday of each month. 

These attractions are included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: The Interdisciplinary Educational Museum Zurich
properties.lead_text: Analyze 600 million years of animal and human evolution.
properties.description:
The Interdisciplinary Educational Museum combines science with cultural history. Here, you can enjoy two exciting journeys through time. In the museum hall, the first journey takes you through 600 million years of evolution to the earliest civilisations. You can experience the exciting evolution of life – starting with the first animals, and including the dinosaurs and prehistoric man – right up to the present day. 

The second journey takes you through human life from conception to death. You will be amazed and informed as you enjoy the many unusual exhibits on display.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Martin Bodmer Foundation
properties.lead_text: Discover one of the largest private libraries in the world!
properties.description:
The Martin Bodmer Foundation’s permanent collection consists of hundreds of western and oriental manuscripts, 270 incunabula (printed before 1500), including one of the few copies of the Gutenberg Bible. 

Here, you can also find cuneiform tablets, Greek and Coptic papyri, as well as testimonies of ancient civilisations and even a number of minerals and fossils. It is a real temple of modern architecture, designed by Mario Botta that testifies five millennia of human creativity. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Puppet Museum, Fribourg
properties.lead_text: The puppet kingdom – puppets and theatre masks from Chinese and Indian shadow-theatres.
properties.description:
The Swiss Puppet Museum was founded in 1985 by Jean Bindschedler, a painter, sculptor and creator of puppets. Nowadays, you can enjoy a collection of over 3'000 pieces. These puppets, masks, shadows and paper theatres make up a collection that is unique in Switzerland. 

You can also check the video-viewing area, a space for playing with puppets, a library and archives. On the same premises, there are regular performances by the Théâtre des Marionnettes de Fribourg. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Jewish Museum of Switzerland
properties.lead_text: Discover an extraordinary collection of Judaica, one of the best in central Europe.
properties.description:
The Jewish Museum of Switzerland has the purpose to introduce you to the Jewish history specific to the Basel region. Here, you will find interesting religious item as well as tools used in everyday life. 

For a more in-depth approach, you can also check the Hebrew books that were actually printed in the printing houses of Basel. All the object date from the Middle Ages to modern times. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Grandson Castle
properties.lead_text: Explore an extraordinary collection of weapons and armour!
properties.description:
Grandson Castle is a medieval fortress dating back to 11th and 14th centuries. It has been well-maintained and is in fantastic condition. Here, you can discover permanent exhibitions with arms, models of the castle and historical details of the famous battle of Grandson in 1476. 

There is also a popular automobile museum, where Greta Garbo's famous Rolls Royce is displayed amongst other vintage models. An absolute must-see is the armoury and its impressive suits of armour. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Applied Arts and Design Winterthur
properties.lead_text: An interface of functionality and design, craft and industrial production.
properties.description:
The Museum of Applied Arts and Design is famous for its changing exhibitions. Here, you will find out more about design in all its facets and get surprising, extraordinary and sensuous insights into everyday culture. It is a truly unique museum in Switzerland. 

You will also encounter designers and their work. There are narrations about the history of various items and materials. Space is provided for you to engage with industrial productions and craftsmanship as well as with new and traditional technologies. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Appenzell Customs
properties.lead_text: Get an insight into the typical domestic culture of Alpine farming and traditional handicraft workshops.
properties.description:
At the Museum of Appenzell Customs, you will immerse yourself in traditions such as the “Silvesterchläuse”, Alpine cattle drive, mountain farming, home life and string music. The museum exudes a homely atmosphere with its crooked, low-ceilinged rooms and slanted wooden floors. 

Here you will get an insight into the peasant culture of the Appenzellerland, its associated crafts and the customs that are deeply rooted in the population of the Urnäsch Valley and still practised to this day.  

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Le Locle Watch Museum
properties.lead_text: Amaze yourself with the most beautiful watches one can ever imagine!
properties.description:
The Le Locle Watch Museum is located in a castle built in 1790. You will be delighted by the ticking of the clocks as you walk through the exhibition rooms. The overall feeling is of a mysterious time in a magical place. 

You will also immerse yourself in the fascinating world of inventors, artists and thinkers. Embark on a journey through the centuries to the time of earlier civilisations and at the same time dare to step into the future. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: The “Pharmacy museum” University of Basel
properties.lead_text: Perfect not only for specialists but also for interested laymen.
properties.description:
The “Pharmacy museum” contains collections of old pharmaceuticals, pharmacy furniture, laboratory utensils, ceramics, instruments, books, art, and craftwork. It is very interesting to find out how medicines evolved throughout the years. 

The museum is situated in the old town in the medieval house “Zum Vorderen Sessel”, that was once frequented by the famous alchemist Paracelsus and the humanist Erasmus. The architecture is very worth looking at. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum zu Allerheiligen (All Saints), Schaffhausen
properties.lead_text: Visit a museum housed in a former Benedictine monastery.
properties.description:
Das Museum zu Allerheiligen covers a variety of fields. An interesting aspect of this museum is the location. You will discover the building complex of the former Romanesque All Saint’s Benedictine Monastery, making it even more appealing.

Here, you can see archaeological finds, historical artefacts, natural history and art. They are displayed in over 80 rooms. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Alpine Museum Pontresina
properties.lead_text: Learn more about the development of the popular Pontresina mountain resort.
properties.description:
The Alpine Museum offers you important information concerning lifestyle, culture, and development of the farming village as well as its transformation into a popular mountain resort.

The museum is located in a beautiful old Engadine house and shows plenty of interesting exhibitions, many of which will be of interest to children as well: a bird collection with recorded birdsong, a magic world of minerals with exhibits from the region and from all over the world, objects about hunting, game and the environment, as well as information about the development of summer and winter alpinism. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Sarganserland
properties.lead_text: Travel back into the 13th century!
properties.description:
The Museum Sarganserland housed in the Castle Sargans majestically stands on a hilltop. It was awarded the title “European Museum of the Year“ in 1983. In 1987, it was included on the list of the 37 museums most worth seeing throughout the world. 

This is not an ordinary museum, but stimulating and informative, thereby reviving the land and the people of Sarganserland. Here, you will discover exhibitions from both the Modern Age and the Middle Age. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: History Museum La Chaux-de-Fonds
properties.lead_text: A great way to dive into the history of the town La Chaux-de-Fonds.
properties.description:
The History Museum will capture your imagination as soon as you get close to it. The 19th-century villa has a beautiful design and stands alone in the centre of the park. The renovated residence will help you travel back in time.

Here you will find plenty of object, photos and videos that reveal the history of the town. There is a wealth of information to explore. Children can take a separate tour matching their interests. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Children's Museum Baden
properties.lead_text: Step into a lively meeting place for exchange between cultures and generations!
properties.description:
The Swiss Children's Museum displays in twenty exhibition rooms historical and current developments relating to children. Temporary exhibitions reveal exciting insights into children's culture. Truly, a world for young and old!

The Children's Museum describes itself in these words: "Just imagine walking into a big, old house and discovering traces of your ancestors. You see your mother’s schoolbag in the classroom, the toy steam engine your grandfather used to play with and the doll’s house your great-grandmother used..."

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Toy Museum Thun
properties.lead_text: Take a step towards another world – a child’s world from bygone days!
properties.description:
The Toy Museum Thun was opened in 2005 by a private initiative. Housed in 12 rooms, the collection features a wide range of children’s toys and games items from between 1850 and 1960. Travel down memory lane and watch your children explore the way their grandparents and great-grandparents played.

Here you can enjoy dolls, teddy bears, construction kits, small shops, play kitchens, trains, model cars, toy soldiers, children's books, board games and more. For the perfect family adventure, you can visit the Engel museum café. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fossil Museum Monte San Giorgio
properties.lead_text: Discover a selection of fossilised animals and plants!
properties.description:
The Fossil Museum Monte San Giorgio, also known as “dinosaur mountain”, is full of fossilised fish and marine reptiles – a treasure trove 240 million years old. Illustrations and models explain the long extinct world whose fossils have been excavated, prepared and scientifically described.

You are welcomed by the 2.5-meter-long reconstruction of the saurian Ticinosuchus. The museum spreads over four floors and the exhibitions showcase the wide variety of animals that populated the former subtropical sea and its coastline in southern Ticino. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and it is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum for Music Automatons Seewen
properties.lead_text: Discover an internationally significant collection of music automatons.
properties.description:
At the Museum for Music Automatons, you can enjoy a guided tour of the three thematic halls that reveal the music automatons dating back as far as two centuries ago. There is a wide range of luxuriously equipped, Swiss-made music boxes, delicate figurine automatons, barrel organs, automatic pianos, fairground, and dance organ.  

You will also be introduced to the mighty automated Britannic organ and its fascinating history – it was built over 100 years ago for the sister ship of the Titanic. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex). The museum is open from Tuesday to Sunday, between 11.00h and 18.00h (groups by appointment).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Dürrenmatt Centre
properties.lead_text: Discover an exhibition environment which borrows both from literature and from the fine arts.
properties.description:
At the Dürrenmatt Centre you can enjoy all kinds of contemporary concerts, conferences, and talks in a lively atmosphere of the place. But overall, you can delight yourself with the work of Friedrich Dürrenmatt.  

Although Dürrenmatt (1912-1990) was a famous writer and dramatist, he was also a passionate painter throughout his life. This Centre is tasked with the mission of making his artwork accessible to all. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Blonay-Chamby – Oldest Museum Railway
properties.lead_text: Visit the largest collection of operable meter gauge rolling stock in Switzerland.
properties.description:
The museum railway of Blonay-Chamby is owned by a cooperative that maintains the museum's own narrow gauge railway line and exhibits over 60 historic vehicles ranging from the steam tramway locomotive to the electric streetcar in two halls. 

The museum is unique especially because the steam locomotives, electric locomotives, electric railcars, tram carriages, railway carriages, freight cars and company vehicles are maintained so that they are operational at any time. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Village Museum «Alter Bären» Konolfingen
properties.lead_text: Find out more the local history in a complex museum!
properties.description:
The Village Museum is housed in a former guesthouse, a beautiful historic half-timber house from 1601. The exhibits are displayed in twelve rooms. Here, you will discover a rich collection that includes agricultural objects, craft and household appliances, toys, kitchen and cheese making equipment. 

Other interesting collections you need to look for are the schnapps distillery, the pharmacy of the country doctor. W. Schüpbach, picture documents about Konolfingen, musical instruments, radios, and photo cameras.  

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Australian Aboriginal Art Museum "La Grange" Val-de-Travers
properties.lead_text: A museum unique in Switzerland!
properties.description:
The Australian Aboriginal Art Museum is an interesting place even for people living in Switzerland. The works of Australian Aboriginal art come from the Burkhardt-Felder Foundation Arts and Culture.

The museum building is actually an annexe of the Château d’Ivernois that was recently renovated. You can analyse here different artefacts and painting of Australian Aborigines. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: BirdLife-Naturzentrum Neeracherried
properties.lead_text: Experience a wonderful adventure and an interactive exhibition!
properties.description:
BirdLife Nature Centre welcomes you with a footbridge leading to a reedy marsh and observation huts, two nature trails and an interactive exhibition. This unusual natural oasis is the breeding ground of rare birds such as the Lapwing, and the resting place of migrating birds like the blue Kingfisher.

Thanks to observation huts within the nature reserve you can observe these birds without disturbing them. The Nature Centre also offers wonderful exhibitions for all ages, as well as a variety of guided tours. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Château de Coppet
properties.lead_text: Explore an interesting castle dating from the thirteenth century.
properties.description:
The Château de Coppet is mostly famous for one of its residents, Jacques Necker and his daughter Germaine, the famous Madame de Staël. She was banished from Paris by Napoleon who considered her to be "too developed spirit for a woman". For many years, the castle became sometimes prison, sometimes refuge.

Here, you can view a collection of textiles, marquetry, books as well as remarkably well-preserved murals. Make sure you take your time to get to know this brilliant woman a little better. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Anna Göldi Museum, Ennenda
properties.lead_text: Visit the touching Anna Göldi exhibition!
properties.description:
The Anna Göldi Museum, located in Ennenda, is renowned for its extensive and challenging program. Here, you can delight yourself with one permanent and three temporary exhibitions. The topics change from one year to another, ranging from women rights to death sentences. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and it is opened from April to October. If you want to book a tour, you can do it via internet or telephone.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Schatzkammer Liechtenstein Vaduz
properties.lead_text: Delight yourself with exhibits belonging to the Princes of Liechtenstein!
properties.description:
Schatzkammer Liechtenstein prides itself on an extensive collection belonging to the Princely Family of Liechtenstein. The exhibits are more than 400 years old and include paintings of the Old Masters,  world-famous arms, and a collection of Easter eggs. 

Make sure you do not miss the lunar rock brought by the Apollo 17 mission and the design of the first-ever postage stamp. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Safien Heritage Museum
properties.lead_text: Step into an unusual museum and be mesmerized by the unique collection.
properties.description:
Located at 1766 metres surrounded by ancient Walser houses, the building itself and its furnishings are the focus for the Safien Heritage Museum. This is one of the highest settlements in the Safien valley to be inhabited all year round. 

The themes presented in this unusual museum include weaving and crochet work based on a fully-functioning loom, etching Easter eggs, emigration and the craft of shoe-making. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Cement Trail Morbio
properties.lead_text: Discover the history of cement in a unique way!
properties.description:
The Cement Trail is one of the main elements of the redevelopment project of the area. The educational path exploits the preserved features of the cement plant and illustrates you the ways in which the raw material, that is the rock, was transformed into cement. 

You will also discover the two contrasting realities, rural and industrial, that have marked the history of the territory. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Colombire Hamlet: Alpine Farm and Eco Museum
properties.lead_text: Experience all the delights of mountain life!
properties.description:
The hamlet is split into two themed halves. One area, including the reception, restaurant and terrace, is devoted to Alpine farming, while the second area focuses on mountain hut settlements. The Eco Museum comprises a total of three huts.

The huts are authentic as they were dismantled in the surrounding area and rebuilt here in Colombire according to the old tradition. These two worlds of discovery are symbolically separated by a footpath for visitors. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Local Museum Vaz/Obervaz
properties.lead_text: Discover the life and works of the original peasant population.
properties.description:
The Regional Museum Vaz/Obervaz reveals how people used to live in Vaz, as well as the development of tourism to the world-famous spa town of Lenzerheide-Valbella. The collection includes folklore, agriculture, handicraft, church history, sports and tourism items. 

Make sure you do not miss the fully equipped forge and wagon, the mill, and the weaving loom. The latter is still operational. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Wine and Vineyard Museum "Hof" Ligerz
properties.lead_text: Explore a romantic inner courtyard and beautifully designed rooms.
properties.description:
The "Hof" was built around 1555 by Rudolf von Ligerz on former royal-episcopal premises and stands today on community grounds in La Neuveville. The museum is located in one of the most beautiful houses on the left side of Lake Biel. 

The building has been in the possession of the Foundation "Wine and Vineyard Museum on Lake Biel HOF Ligerz” since 1970 and was completely renovated in the 1970s. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Valle Onsernone
properties.lead_text: Find out more about the history, the nature and culture of the valley!
properties.description:
The Museum of Valle Onsernone is located at the beginning of Loco in an old Onsernoneser house. The permanent exhibition focuses on the straw manufactory. The temporary exhibitions reveal different aspects of the past and present of the Onsernone.

The museum runs a traditional water-powered mill from the 18th century. You can even buy polenta loaves, which are available for direct sales. A small exhibition illustrates the history and technology of the Onsernoneser mills. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Foundation des Vieux Moulins de la Tine (VIMOTI)
properties.lead_text: Discover an industrial site in an exceptional natural setting.
properties.description:
The old mills of la Tine are located in an idyllic area. This industrial site dates from early 1400. The museum is open to the public. Here, you can visit the mills, fullers and forges and they are in perfect working condition. 

If you want to see the mills working, you can go on specific days or request a demonstration. You will also discover a collection of tools, as well as a permanent exhibition on hemp. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Engiadina Bassa Scuol
properties.lead_text: Explore how people lived in the Lower Engadine until the middle of the 20th century!
properties.description:
The Museum of Engiadina Bassa shows in a comprehensive way different areas of agriculture, specific to the Lower Engadine. Here, you will discover the historical culture of life and the economic forms on the basis of work processes, thus making the everyday life comprehensible.

Make sure not to miss the exhibition on the prehistoric settlements in the Lower Engadine, as well as a library with copies of the first Bible printed in Scuol in 1679. There is also a special exhibition every year. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Traditions and Barques du Léman
properties.lead_text: Discover a collection relating to the Lake Geneva boats!
properties.description:
Protected by the walls of the castle of Saint-Gingolph, the Museum of Traditions and Barques du Léman gathers a collection of objects and documents relating to old cargo ships. Here, you will learn about the Latin sails and the life of the boatmen. 

The exhibition also evokes the life of the community and the village at the time of the boats, such as crafts, the exploitation of forests, the harvest of chestnuts, and so on. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Eugène Burnand
properties.lead_text: Marvel at the works of the renowned artist Eugène Burnand!
properties.description:
The Museum Eugène Burnand focuses on a permanent exhibition that reveals the impressive work of the artist. You will find drawings and large-scale oil paintings. Make sure you do not miss these famous paintings: La Fuite de Charles le Téméraire, Le Taureau dans les Alpes, and Le Labour dans le Jorat.

Eugène Burnand lived between 1850 and 1921. He established his reputation through his paintings inspired by nature. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Museum of Speleology Chamoson
properties.lead_text: Explore the underground world and its curiosities!
properties.description:
The Swiss Museum of Speleology aims to encourage you to explore the nooks and crannies of caving in a fun way. It was founded in 1994 and it looks like a labyrinth of 200 square meters. You will live the adventure of your life here. 

As the museum was built in the form of a cave, you will actually feel like an explorer. You will also learn the history of speleology. During the temporary exhibitions, you will find out interesting details about glaciospeleology, the history of speleology in Valais, and much more.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and it is open from Wednesday to Sunday, except winter when it is closed.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Regional Museum Schwarzwasser
properties.lead_text: Discover archaeological finds from the Schwarzenburg region.
properties.description:
The Regional Museum Schwarzwasser prides itself on a permanent exhibition that reveals archaeological finds from the region, like the ruin Grasburg. It is a great place to visit if you like history as there are many interesting items you can analyse. 

There are also special exhibitions that deal with selected regional or general topics. They are usually on display for one to two years. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Nature Center Les Cerlatez
properties.lead_text: Embrace nature and wildlife in a fun way!
properties.description:
The Nature Center Les Cerlatez is located at 1,000 metres a.s.l. extending around the Etang de Gruère. The thousand-year-old pond in the peat bog near Saignelégier is an ideal and popular place for observing birds, animals and plants. 

You definitely need to take a detour to the Centre Nature Les Cerlatez, where art and nature go hand in hand. The postbus, or the Jura trains, will take you there. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Bergsturz Museum Goldau
properties.lead_text: Let the power of nature amaze you in a different type of museum!
properties.description:
Bergsturz Museum Goldau opened its doors to the public in 1956. You can find it at the entrance to the Goldau Nature & Wildlife Park. Here, you can discover a variety of exhibits of one of the greatest natural disasters of modern times in Switzerland.  

You will come across various excavated objects, reliefs and iconographies deformed by the impact of the landslide, depicting the valley before and after the catastrophe. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Children's Village Pestalozzi
properties.lead_text: A great place to spend quality time with the whole family!
properties.description:
The Children's Village Pestalozzi invites families to spend a special day in the visitor centre in Trogen. Here, you will learn more about the Foundation's commitment in Switzerland and in twelve countries around the world.

Children, grandchildren or godchildren will enjoy crafting and fairytale lessons. This educational place manages to mix learning with having fun in a creative way. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Lindengut Winterthur
properties.lead_text: Enjoy a beautiful villa and a magnificent park!
properties.description:
Museum Lindengut is located in a Villa built around 1780. The rooms are decorated in baroque style and they shine in their splendour. Temporary exhibitions reveal topics like the history of Winterthur. 

You can also find objects from Roman antiquity to modern times, as well as outstanding crafts and past industries, revealing the customs of our ancestors. Of particular charm is the toy collection in the former coach house. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Muggio Valley
properties.lead_text: Discover the characteristics of a typical pre-alpine valley.
properties.description:
With its ravishingly beautiful landscape, the Muggio Valley is a great place to visit. You will escape the hustle and bustle of the city and enjoy a region where agriculture still plays an important role.  Here, you can enjoy quiet, peace and a magnificent scenery.

Besides hiking and admiring the flora and fauna, you can also visit the Ethnographic Museum. You will find various buildings of historical interest that have been restructured. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Cristallina Museum of Minerals
properties.lead_text: Discover an interesting collection of minerals.
properties.description:
The Cristallina Museum of Minerals owns a collection of minerals from the whole Bündner Oberland. This is known to be the largest mineral region in Switzerland. You can expect to see here interesting shapes and colours.

You will delight yourself with unique crystals and minerals from the Surselva. Thanks to the microscope, you can even analyse the smallest pieces of minerals. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Les Ormonts
properties.lead_text: Discover a region with a rich heritage where traditions come first!
properties.description:
The Museum Les Ormonts aims to highlight and preserve the traditions in Vers-l’Eglise. It was opened in 2008 in a restored post office building. Here, you will find publications and audio-video recordings as well as temporary exhibitions. 

There are many interesting facts you can discover here. You can learn about natural hazards, historical architecture, the study of names and so on. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Isérables
properties.lead_text: Discover the particularities of the village of Isérables!
properties.description:
Museum of Isérables opened its gates to the public in 2003. It is located in a modern building, near an old family house, offering an interesting contrast. The exhibitions are displayed on three levels. 

The main attraction and the permanent exhibition is represented by the  slope. The village itself is built on a slope at 1,100 metres altitude. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Bickel, Walenstadt
properties.lead_text: Enjoy contemporary art from Switzerland and regional artists!
properties.description:
The Museum Bickel was founded in 2002. Here, you can enjoy three exhibitions per year. The program set by the museum is quite entertaining and includes guided tours, podium discussions and concerts. Not to mention that it is an important venue for the artists who live in the Bickel region.

The museum is sponsored by the Karl Bickel Foundation and offers a unique exhibition with the works of Karl Bickel each year. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Rehmann
properties.lead_text: Discover the unique sculptures of Erwin Rehmann!
properties.description:
The Museum Rehmann is not a museum in the classical sense. The former workshop and the studio of the sculptor Erwin Rehmann, born in 1921, were integrated as part of the tour. The permanent exhibition is focused on the works of the famous sculptor. 

There are also changing exhibitions of other well-known artists. These are always connected with the works of Rehmann. You will also enjoy fascinating perspectives and three-dimensional pieces. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of grapes and wine Boudry
properties.lead_text: Discover the rich history of Boudry wine!
properties.description:
The impressive Château de Boudry, which rises above the Neuchâtel vineyards, is home to the fascinating Museum of grapes and wine. This place is devoted to the development of grape varieties and wine-growing over the centuries. 

The castle also has a wine bar that offers local wines and other products for tasting, so make sure you do not miss it. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Musée du Vieux-Moudon
properties.lead_text: Find out more about the history of the Moudon region.
properties.description:
Musée du Vieux-Moudon aims to reveal various parts of Moorish history. You will discover everyday life activities displayed on the grounds of a castle dating from the 16th century. 

The exhibition includes a model of the city from the 15th century, old signs, the reconstruction of a notary's study, tools and instruments of the old local crafts, farm tools, weapons and documents. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art collections Hans and Marlis Suter
properties.lead_text: You will find some of the best works of the 20th century.
properties.description:
The emphasis of the Art collections Hans and Marlis Suter is on paintings, drawings and graphic art from Bern and in particular from the Lake Thun region. 

You will discover amazing pieces of art that will make you want to visit this museum for a second time. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: La Sarraz Castle and Horse Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover a collection of valuable objects acquired over the centuries by the generations of La Sarraz barons.
properties.description:
La Sarraz Castle will make you feel like you visit a family home. The furniture and works of art go well hand in hand, making it a fascinating place to visit. The whole interior expresses the taste of the patrician family. 

The Horse Museum is located in the Sarraz Castle and it is a great place for families. Here, you will discover different themes, including coaches, army horses, toy horses, workhorses, urban horses and horses in art. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Il Museo in Erba, Lugano
properties.lead_text: Explore didactic exhibitions on art and ethics for children.
properties.description:
Il Museo in Erba prides itself with an interesting concept. The unique pedagogical approach, based on humour and play, allows children not only to discover art but also the world surrounding them. This makes it one of the best place to spend quality time together with your family.

Another great thing that makes this museum even more entertaining is the fact that children will experiment with what they have seen in the Museum's workshops. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Obwalden Historical Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover interesting aspect of prehistory and early history.
properties.description:
The Obwalden Historical Museum is housed in the Armory built in 1599. It opened its doors to the public in 1877. Here, you can discover a vast exhibition that focuses on prehistory and early history (including finds from the Roman settlement in Alpnach). 

Among the items you can analyse here, the most popular ones are the state antiquities (Julius banners, official costumes, coins, measures and weights), and the ecclesiastical art from the 14th to18th centuries. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: The Fellini Foundation
properties.lead_text: Visit this international foundation for culture and cinema.
properties.description:
The Fellini Foundation was established in 2001 in Sion. Here, you will find the largest collection in the world focused on the work of Federico Fellini and thousand other directors. There are also 35 publications and two books edited by this foundation.

You will discover drawings, scripts, letters, photographs, costumes, production stuff, artefacts, and press releases. This contemporary exhibition is actually a world premiere. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Bagnes
properties.lead_text: Discover beautiful rooms decorated with a remarkable mural!
properties.description:
The Museum of Bagnes is located in a place steeped in history, the former parish house. The oldest parts of the walls date back to the beginning of the thirteenth century. The venerable building, enlarged and refurbished over the centuries, was renovated and transformed into a place of exhibitions in 1984. 

Here, you will discover rooms which are generously equipped with stoves of soapstone, panelled rooms with stuccoed ceilings, and an amazing painted ceiling from the early eighteenth century. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum La Truaisch
properties.lead_text: Visit a museum in a 19th century stone house!
properties.description:
La Truaisch, or The Valley Museum is located in Sedrun. In addition to one of the most valuable mineral collections in Switzerland, you will find an apartment from yesteryear, a weaving and spinning room as well as objects of flax culture, dairy farming and Alpine agriculture. 

The museum also has a harness collection of the Hafner Deragisch by Bugnei. Every year special exhibitions are held. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Schmelzra S-charl Mining and Bear Museum
properties.lead_text: Find out about the lives of mountain people who lived 300 years ago.
properties.description:
The Schmelzra S-charl shows how for 300 years the mountain people on the Mot Madlain dug out the ore by hand before smelting it in the valley. The purpose was to obtain the precious silver and lead. 

From the tools and carts of that time shown here, you can see vividly how the miners and the farmers lived. There is also a permanent special exhibition about the last bears hunted in Switzerland.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and is open from June to October.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Orbe Roman Mosaics
properties.lead_text: Marvel at impressive mosaic floors from an imposing Roman villa.
properties.description:
The Orbe Roman Mosaics were discovered in the mid-19th century. You will be mesmerized to see the complex figures made of naturally coloured stones. Here, you will find shapes of gods, geometric shapes, and scenes of Greek Mythology. 

Initially, this site was used as an educational place for archaeology students. After the diggings, an additional mosaic and a spa were discovered. The site is currently available for visitors to see.  

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Espace Ballon Château-d'Oex
properties.lead_text: Learn everything about the surprising and poetic world of ballooning.
properties.description:
The Espace Ballon is located in a restored historical building. The museum is divided into two separate spaces: the reception is on the ground floor and the exhibition and gallery are upstairs. The first floor is entirely devoted to presenting the hot air balloon.

You will discover here an open space, punctuated by the different zones displaying the different aspects of ballooning, from history to technology to the adventure of Piccard and Jones and the ballooning history of Château-d'Oex. You can also try the 3-D cinema. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Leventina Museum Giornico
properties.lead_text: Discover the history of the valley!
properties.description:
The Leventina Museum is housed in two prestigious historic buildings. Here, you will find valuable objects that reveal how people used to live in this area. In this case, the man is in the centre of attention. 

The person who set up the exhibition did not want to provide answers but ask questions. You are encouraged to look for his answer through interactive games, projections of historical documentaries and photographs. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Hôtel-Dieu Museum Porrentruy
properties.lead_text: Delight yourself with this magnificent late baroque building!
properties.description:
The Hôtel-Dieu Museum is located in the charming old town of Porrentruy. The historic building dates from the 18th century and it was initially a hospital. You will be immediately attracted by the old walls designed in baroque style.

You must not expect a huge museum, but rather a modest-sized one. The works of art displayed here remind of the history and culture of the country. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: MASI Lugano
properties.lead_text: One museum, exhibition sites, plenty of contemporary art!
properties.description:
MASI’s work is undertaken concurrently over two locations: the main site is located within the LAC building, while the second one is in the Palazzo Reali. The LAC displays the works of art over three floors, with a total surface of 2,500 square metres. 

MASI will focus on Twentieth Century and contemporary art, in all its diverse forms of expression and techniques. Here, you can expect to see the works of young and emerging talents, to current and future themes of art and society. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Hermann Hesse Foundation Montagnola
properties.lead_text: Look at some of the most important works by Hermann Hesse.
properties.description:
At the Hermann Hesse Foundation, you can see personal objects, photos, books and watercolour paintings that reveal the moving life of the German writer. During his years in Ticino, he wrote not only short stories, but also some of his most important works. 

Besides the permanent exhibition, you can enjoy thematic shows, lectures, concerts, films and readings. And it is no wonder that beautiful walks in the surrounding landscape that once inspired the poet and writer will also lure you. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Jura Farmers Museum Les Genevez
properties.lead_text: Explore the rural life in an interesting museum!
properties.description:
The main attraction of the Jura Farmers Museum is the building itself. You will stumble upon a large double storey farmhouse from the 16th century with a shingled roof. This museum north of Tramelan depicts the homes of two peasant families from centuries past.

Here, you will receive an impressive insight into what life was like back then. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and it is open all year round upon request.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Poschiavo
properties.lead_text: Visit this interesting ethnographic museum!
properties.description:
The Museum of Poschiavo has two locations: the baroque Palazzo de Bassus-Mengotti and a  peasant house with medieval origin - Casa Tomé. The two buildings focus on various facets of the local past. 

The Palace houses the museum's ethnographic collections and temporary exhibitions. The House is opposed as it reveals the life of the peasants, focusing on stable and barn, the kitchen and specific rooms. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Arts and Sciences Sainte-Croix
properties.lead_text: Discover a collection of objects relating to the local industry.
properties.description:
The Museum of Arts and Sciences Sainte-Croix opened its doors in 1972. Since then, local people donated historical objects and created a rich heritage. Here, you can discover items related to local history and crafts, and even souvenirs people brought from different journeys. 

The major attraction here is the famous paintings of Dr Camille Jaccard that were completely restored. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Planetarium and Observatory Kreuzlingen
properties.lead_text: The perfect place to embrace the stars!
properties.description:
The Planetarium and Observatory brings the sun, the moon and the stars closer to earth. You can admire them even on rainy days. There are different programs available that target adults, families and children. 

Here, you can observe the moon, star clusters, gas nebulae and galaxies. On the roof terrace, you will find experts who explain the constellations and planets that are visible in the night sky. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and it is opened every Wednesday evening.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Finance Museum Zurich
properties.lead_text: Learn how the Swiss economic system works!
properties.description:
The Swiss Finance Museum aims to answers questions regarding the financial market, the origins of the economic system, and the evolution of the stock exchange. This multimedia exhibition offers interesting facts and actual figures concerning the financial market.

It is also important to mention that this museum hosts the world‘s most significant collection of historical securities. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Indian Land Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover the past and present of the different cultures of North American Indians!
properties.description:
The Indian Land Museum is unique in its kind. Here, you will see items from different eras and the different areas of life of the tribes of North America. This way, it will be easier for you to understand their culture and habits.

The museum endeavours to provide the explanations necessary for you to understand their evolution and history. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Sherlock Holmes Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover interesting facts about the number one detective in the world!
properties.description:
The Sherlock Holmes Museum is the work of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's son who created this museum to honour the work of his father. Here, you will discover besides the objects and books referring to Sherlock Holmes, furniture belonging to the great British writer.

You will also discover a replica of the Baker Street and the room where the detective used to work. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Sanktur Train Station Museum
properties.lead_text: A museum with exhibitions on modern art and social themes.
properties.description:
The Sanktur Train Station Museum offers a collection that includes showpieces in different categories. Here, you can learn about reverse glass painting, goldsmith’s art and sculpture, weapons and coins as well as archaeological finds. 

Accompanied by the house marten, Urbi, children big and small can embark on an exciting voyage of discovery through house and history – and even get a chance to solve tricky puzzles. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Pegasus Small World, Aeugstertal
properties.lead_text: A marvellous toy museum, situated in an idyllic location!
properties.description:
The Pegasus Small World will manage to impress you with the unique ambience. Here, you will admire toys ranging from 1890 to 1980. The main attraction is the renowned collection by Ewald Schuler.

You will have the opportunity to delight yourself with tin cars, model trains, stuffed animals and many collectable rarities. This visit will make you feel like a child again. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Agricultural Museum of the Mendrisiotto
properties.lead_text: Discover ethnographic artefacts from the world of farming!
properties.description:
This Agricultural Museum of the Mendrisiotto opened in 1981 in Stabio. Here, you can discover different rooms dedicated to exhibitions of carts, important ploughing devices, harnesses and various different kinds of trap. 

One room is dedicated to themed exhibition each year. The museum opens its gates in the afternoon on Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday, Sunday and public holidays. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Ecomuseum Simplon
properties.lead_text: Discover the interaction between humankind and the environment in a fun way!
properties.description:
The cultural trail, Stockalperweg, is the backbone of Ecomuseum Simplon. You will re-live history in an unusual way, more precisely on a hiking tour. You will discover panels along the way that point to objects of interest.  

In the five museums: Stockalper Palace in Brig; The Old Inn in Simplon village; Old barracks and Fort Gondo in the Gondo Canyon and in the Gold Mine Museum in Gondo, you will find further traces left behind by famous names such as Napoleon or Kaspar Stockalper. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Exhibition Transportation Hub Switzerland
properties.lead_text: Find out more about the world of today's shipping!
properties.description:
The Transportation Hub Exhibition Switzerland deals with all current means of transport. You will see how shipping is done via water, rail, road and air. You will also discover the development of Rhine shipping.

Today's railway, truck and aircraft models complete the show. They illustrate the interlinking of ways of transport in Switzerland and the whole world. To make things interactive there are boards and videos. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Civic and Archaeological Museum Locarno
properties.lead_text: Find beautiful artefacts from the Roman times!
properties.description:
The castle of the Visconti family is nowadays the Civic and Archaeological Museum. Here, you will discover valuable vases, blown-glass goblets, and artefacts from Roman times. Close to the castle, you can find the Rivellino, a defence tower. 

This defensive bastion may even be, according to some historical papers and recent studies, the work of the great Leonardo da Vinci. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fri Art – Freiburg Art Hall
properties.lead_text: Enjoy exhibitions with works of international renown artists.
properties.description:
Freiburg Art Hall is a centre for contemporary art. The club and museum have made it their goal to emphasize the creative process and to foster contemporary art. This means that you can expect to see interesting exhibitions focused on current events.

The face-to-face encounter with the public where it tends to spend time (on the street) is an important part of achieving this goal. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Historic Museum Uri
properties.lead_text: Discover a museum built in Neo-Gothic style.
properties.description:
The Historic Museum Uri prides itself with ecclesiastical art, wooden figures, the replication of a Celtic gold treasure, portraits, models of castles of the Canton of Uri, weapons, ancient national banners, traditional costumes, a stagecoach, and an Alemannian tomb.

The main focus here is on churchly art, that you can found in the permanent exhibition. There are also temporary exhibitions, club meetings and publications of the annals. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Mendrisio Art Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover exhibitions dedicated to the 20th-century masters.
properties.description:
The Mendrisio Art Museum is located in a former monastery. The works of art are highly appreciated by both visitors and critics. Here, you will discover reappraisals of painters such as Georges Braque, Eduardo Chillida, Julius Bissier, Meret Oppenheim, Renato Birolli, and many more.

The museum is recognised internationally and collaborates with different European museums. There are also temporary exhibitions that present local history and artists. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Grubenmann Collection, Armory Teufen
properties.lead_text: Find out about the history and works of the Grubenmann family, important master-builders of the 18th century.
properties.description:
Grubenmann Collection is focused on the family Grubenmann, regional builders from Teufen. You will learn about their works, like the wide wooden bridges, many church buildings and stately homes. Their reputation was well known far beyond the borders of the canton. 

The exciting exhibition presents models of bridges and trusses, a sound-picture show and a large selection of old tools for woodworking. The major attractions are the replicas of the Rhine bridge in Schaffhausen and the Limmat bridge at the Wettingen monastery. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: House of Wheat and Bread Echallens
properties.lead_text: Come and discover the history of wheat and bread!
properties.description:
The House of Wheat and Bread welcomes you with a slideshow that helps you experience the wheat-to-bread process. During the show, various projectors highlight the pieces of equipment displayed: ploughs, swing-ploughs, harrows, seeders and rollers.

In the milling section, you will start the old grinding stone and help in milling demonstrations. Later in your visit, you will see an authentic reconstruction of a grain store. There is also a rich collection of traditional costumes from the Vaud area. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Pully Museum of Art
properties.lead_text: A museum dedicated to the works of writer C. F. Ramuz.
properties.description:
The Pully Museum of Art is housed in a beautifully designed building that was completely restored. It is the family home of the famous writer C. F. Ramuz. Here, you can discover an important amount of his work in an impressive collection.

There are also temporary exhibitions promoting regional visual art. You will be amazed to see how well they blend with the museum's collection. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Oron Castle
properties.lead_text: Take a closer look at a fortress from the 12th century!
properties.description:
The Oron Castle is a historical monument that played a major role in the past. Its purpose was to control the passage from Broye. On the upper floor used to live wealthy people, this means that you will discover sitting rooms, an old kitchen, and a music room.
 
You will also see a library, that used to be the world's most important private collection. If you wish, you can also spend the night here, as the ground floor is opened to guests. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Glarus
properties.lead_text: Immerse in numerous fascinating exhibitions and interesting museums.
properties.description:
Museum of Glarus has been housed in the Freuler Palace since 1946. The textile printing exhibition deals in depth with what was for a long time the canton’s most important branch of industry. The department dedicated to the cantonal past showcases history dating back to the first settlements in this region.

The department of military history presents a spectrum of topics, ranging from the foreign legion to Glarus Battalion 85. The ski sports section showcases the pioneering role of the Glarus region in ski sports. The original rooms in the Freuler Palace can be admired in the residential museum with its historical rooms. A very complex museum indeed!

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: m.a.x.museum
properties.lead_text: Learn how posters tell entire stories and writings express emotions.
properties.description:
The building of m.a.x.museum was designed by architects Durisch and Nolli and it is enclosed in glass cladding. At night it shines with soft light, during the day it is a place of pilgrimage for lovers of graphic design.

Here, you can enjoy Max Huber's works and you can also discover the work of younger, contemporary graphic artists. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Alexis Forel Museum Morges
properties.lead_text: A multi-disciplinary museum that displays original works of art.
properties.description:
Alexis Forel Museum was renovated in 2005-2006. Here, you can visit eleven rooms that are representative of the late Gothic style in Morges. The permanent collection includes the work of Alexis Forel, Russian icons and paintings done by Morges artists. 

There is also a collection of 150 dolls and toys belonging to René Morax. To make things even more interesting, you can enjoy a collection of decorative arts, porcelain and furniture from the Middle Ages to the 19th century. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Silberweide Nature Reserve
properties.lead_text: Discover a unique view of the fascinating flora and fauna found in the Greifensee region!
properties.description:
Silberweide Nature Reserve allows you to climb, research and discover to your heart’s content on its trail and adventure playground. Walking barefoot to feel and touch the changing surfaces and materials beneath your feet such as stone, wood and mud holes is a novel experience too. 

You can also observe birds in the practically invisible observation hut. When hunger raises its head, you can go to the bistro, picnic areas or barbecue spots. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Muri Abbey and Museum
properties.lead_text: Be amazed by 1,000 years of the monastery’s history!
properties.description:
Muri Abbey and its museum house a wonderful exhibition. You will learn about the history of the monastery founded by the Habsburgs: from the Reformation, to the banishment and the last Habsburg Emperor. 

A major attraction here is the mechanical pop-up book that recounts the founding history. You can even visit the abbots’ cellar and learn more about its history from seven abbots. There is also an exhibition room where you can find items that reveal the Benedictine daily life. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Mühlerama Museum Zurich
properties.lead_text: A museum that takes the eating culture seriously.
properties.description:
The Mühlerama Museum approaches aspects like eating, food production and culinary enjoyment. You will discover interesting details in a fun but informative way, as all exhibitions are interactive.

This means that you will get to grind your own flour and bake your own bread after you hear the story of the 100-yeas-old industrial mill. If you like to make puzzles, you can also discover a mysterious story. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Vincenzo Vela
properties.lead_text: Admire the works of the Vela family!
properties.description:
The Vela Museum tells the story of the Vela family. Two brothers met with their due fame as sculptors in Milan. The younger, Vincenzo, made a fortune and had a typical 19th-century style art villa built in his native village Ligornetto.
