Around the turn of the millennium, Mario Botta then renovated the estate. 

In the majestic building set amid a magnificent English garden, the works of Vincenzo Vela together with those of his brother Lorenzo, his son Spartaco and those of artist friends are united under the same roof. 


This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Museum of Agriculture Burgrain
properties.lead_text: Learn more about the development of the agricultural technology.
properties.description:
The Swiss Museum of Agriculture covers an area of 2,500 square metres. Here, you will discover the former customs of Swiss peasants and farmers and how they developed the agricultural technology. You will get to take a trip back in time and see different methods of working the land.

Other places of interest here are the educative exhibition stand, where you discover bees with all your senses, the chapel of St. Blasius, the Castle "Kastelen", and the Agrivision experience. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Nature Olten
properties.lead_text: A museum that offers an interesting perspective regarding the animal kingdom.
properties.description:
The Museum of Nature is known to be an important institution of the city of Olten. The major attractions here are a 3D preserved crane of an Ichthyosaurus and the remains of a mammoth. The first and second floors are dedicated to domestic animals. You can also see live stick insects and vitrines about the preparation of birds.

There is also a museum cinema. Besides the permanent exhibitions, you can enjoy talks, excursions and special exhibitions. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Hair and Comb Museum
properties.lead_text: Hairy stories about combs, hair-dos and a globally successful company!
properties.description:
The Hair and Comb Museum is located in the former comb factory in Mümliswil. There are refined hair specialities all around. Here, you can learn how a small comb factory can be linked to the royal houses of England and Spain. 

You will also see how combs were produced and the harsh working conditions people had to face. This museum is ideal for groups, schools, clubs, and anyone interested in hair. There are also guided tours and workshops available. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Champ-Pittet Nature Center Yverdon-les-Bains
properties.lead_text: Discover one of the most interesting nature trails in Switzerland!
properties.description:
Pro Natura Champ-Pittet Nature Center near Yverdon-les-Bains is a place to relax and discover.  With a wide wealth of nature trails, the marshland and forest trail, it is one of the most appealing places that will simply mesmerise you.  

Besides the fascinating marshland path, you can also experience the reed path. This oasis of calmness will definitely make you love nature even more. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Prehistory Zug
properties.lead_text: See how life-like human figures bring the everyday life in bygone days back to life.
properties.description:
At the Museum of Prehistory, you will find palaeolithic hunters, pile dwelling builders, Iron Age traders, Roman women and early medieval warriors that have left their mark on Canton Zug. A large number of finds on display evidence some 20,000 years of history. 

Life-size scenes and vivid models make a museum visit a real experience for both young and old. Children can join the Paleolithic tent and can relax on furs and cushions, or even do some exciting puzzles. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Bakery Museum Benken
properties.lead_text: The secrets of traditional Swiss baking craft!
properties.description:
The idea of the Bakery Museum belongs to Paul Wick, who to start collecting moulds and bakery equipment. After he managed to gather an impressive number and restore them, he began to exhibit them.

You will find tools used for candy making, baking, and pastry, 100 different Easter rabbit moulds, models used for gingerbread and "Tirgel". You can also see the type of equipment used for harvesting grain. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Wallpaper Museum Mézières
properties.lead_text: Discover an exceptionally rare collection!
properties.description:
The Wallpaper Museum is located in the castle of Mézières. It appears that Jean-Georges de Diesbach, who purchased the caste, used wallpapers to decorate it in the '70s. Restoration began in 1994. 

Here, you can discover a rich collection of old wallpapers that managed to survive through time. They are extremely rare, and this makes them even more valuable. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Jeremias Gotthelf Centre Emmental
properties.lead_text: Get to know one of Switzerland’s best-loved writers!
properties.description:
The vicarage in Lützelflüh, where the poet-pastor Jeremias Gotthelf wrote his most important works, has been converted into a museum. The Gotthelf Center opened its doors to the public in August 2012. The entire ground floor has been transformed into a permanent exhibition.

This is the best place to find your inspiration and get a new perspective. You will also learn about the many facets of Gotthelf’s life and work. For example, Gotthelf’s phenomenal output as a writer is presented in his reconstructed study. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Pinacoteca Comunale Casa Rusca
properties.lead_text: Discover an 18th-century townhouse dedicated entirely to art.
properties.description:
A look at the façade of Casa Rusca may already reveal certain features that bear witness to its feudal interior: the elegant little balcony with the chiselled railing or the high windows on the upper floor. What will actually surprise you is the mansion's inner world.  

On the exterior space of the premises, you can admire the works of Jean Arp, among others. Inside, the villa lures with art by Varlin, Sophie Taeuber, Hans Richter and Ticino-born Filippo Franzoni. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Castle of Hünegg Hilterfingen
properties.lead_text: Explore a museum of interior furnishings!
properties.description:
Castle of Hünegg Hilterfingen was built from 1861 – 1863 by the 26-years old architect Architect Heino Schmieden. The Loire castles Blois, Chenonceau and Azay-Le Rideau served as a pattern for the architecture of this castle. 

This is not the typical museum with collections. The interior has remained unchanged since 1900. It seems as if time has stood still and that the owners have just left and will return at any moment. The noble residence is situated in a beautiful wooded park. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Music Boxes and Automatons (CIMA)
properties.lead_text: Visit the museum and see who invented the music box.
properties.description:
Museum of Music Boxes and Automatons is solely dedicated to mechanical music. The museum exhibits the history of this type of music with objects ranging from singing birds to music boxes to the cylinder phonograph invented by Thomas Edison.

The museum is located in Sainte-Croix, a village that welcomes its visitors to the "land of mechanical dreams". Alongside the well-equipped museum, the Reuge company has not only kept this tradition alive but continues to produce modern artworks of mechanical music. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Uri Mineral Museum
properties.lead_text: Enjoy the most beautiful finds from the Central Alps!
properties.description:
The Uri Mineral Museum is located next to the lovely, late Gothic water castle A Pro (1558), in its former, now carefully restored, economic building. Here, you can discover a charming exhibition that will allure you in this magical ambience. 

The minerals displayed are changed every year. A sound picture show or a film put together by active spotlights completes the eventful museum visit. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Jurassic Museum of Art and History Delémont
properties.lead_text: Discover in a fun and exciting way what makes the identity of the Jura.
properties.description:
The Jurassic Museum of Art and History in Delémont has been completely redesigned and renovated. It reopened its doors in December 2011. Nestled in historic buildings, sitting on the ramparts of the old city, this museum will amaze you with the beautiful exhibitions.

Here, you can enjoy a permanent exhibition which, starting from clichés or symbols about the last-born of the Swiss cantons, illuminates the events that have marked the region and its inhabitants. Every Saturday and Sunday, you can opt for guided tours around three objects to discover.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and is open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Castle and Village Werdenberg
properties.lead_text: Experience 800 years of history in an unparalleled architectural environment.
properties.description:
The castle from the late Middle Ages, with the tower, palace, additions and courtyard, was founded around 1230. Today, the architectural complex comprises two museums that tell the 800-year history of the rulers and their subjects.  

Three of the epochs – the times of the counts, the governors of Glarus and that of the well-to-do Hilty family – are effectively displayed in the castle. The Museum Schlangenhaus, that you can find in the town, shows how people in the Werdenberg region lived in the olden days. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: The Peasant Museum
properties.lead_text: Go back in time to the life of clock-making peasants in the Neuchâtel Jura.
properties.description:
The Peasant Museum is located in a lovely 17th century Neuchâtel farmhouse. Here, you can enjoy a variety of objects displayed to give an insight into the lives of the farmer/watchmakers and their families, who prepared, built and developed the region. 

Besides the permanent items, there is also a different temporary exhibition every year, as well as various types of entertainment. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art Museum, Aarau
properties.lead_text: Delight yourself with Swiss art dating from the 18th century to the present day.
properties.description:
The Art Museum displays collective exhibitions that are featured in addition to thematic insights and single presentations of national and international relevance. Furthermore, special attention is drawn to young performers and to regional artists. 

You can enjoy 3,000 square metres of exhibition space. The foyer houses a café and a shop selling art books, while a reference library and the art education studio are located on the lower level. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum in the Warehouse St. Gallen
properties.lead_text: Embrace different areas of outsider art.
properties.description:
The Museum in the Warehouse is an unusual museum dedicated to fostering and promoting an interest and understanding of the different areas of outsider art. Here, you will discover a range of exhibitions that set exciting accents.

The focus is very much on Swiss art brut and naive art. The museum and its related foundation are therefore a centre of excellence for this type of art. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Toggenburg Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover an interesting and intriguing regional museum.
properties.description:
The Toggenburg Museum prides itself with eleven rooms. Here, you will discover the history and culture of the Thur and Neckertal region. It ranges from the Counts of Toggenburg to the shaping developments of the 20th century. 

Here, you will be amazed by magnificently painted furniture, the Toggenburg costume and typical instruments such as the house organs.  Make sure you do not miss the special exhibitions in the cellar vault. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Rainer Maria Rilke Foundation
properties.lead_text: All about the work of the famous poet Rainer Maria Rilke.
properties.description:
The Rainer Maria Rilke Foundation is located in the Maison Pancrace de Courten. It is a place that aims to honour the work and life of the great European poet. It is a great place to visit if you want to see authentic writings. 

Here, you will find a permanent exhibition and a library where you can find approximately 7,000 items and archives. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Maggia Valley Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover the cultural heritage of the Cevio region.
properties.description:
The Maggia Valley Museum prides itself on two exhibition sites. The two Museum buildings are located in the old part of Cevio, a nucleus of great interest and value, architecturally as well as scenically. 

If you wish to visit and understand this valley, the Maggia Valley Museum is an indispensable source.  Here, you can learn about the rich natural environment and the astonishing historical evidence left by the people of this region. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Alpine Gardens of Valais
properties.lead_text: Discover vibrant, colourful open-air museums.
properties.description:
The Alpine Gardens of the Canton of Valais represent an unusual type of "museum" as they are in the open air. They may be located at the foot of a valley or near a quaint village, or dominate a mountain lake. So, you can imagine the idyllic sceneries.

Here, you will discover the rich flora of Valais. There are several thousand species of plants, numberless alpine flowers and also ancient varieties of cereal. Not only the colours but also the scents will make your day better. 

These attractions are included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Riehen Toy Museum
properties.lead_text: A remarkable and unforgettable experience for toy lovers.
properties.description:
Riehen Toy Museum houses European toys from the 19th and early 20th centuries. There are three departments for you to visit: Technology in the Nursery, Wooden Toys, and The World of Dolls. In each of these areas, you can answer fun questions. 

The display includes toys spanning two centuries such as tin cars, railways, magic lanterns, clay animals, dolls, stoves, shops and doll houses. Famous toy brands such as Steiff and Märklin are on display as well. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fine Arts Museum, La Chaux-de-Fonds
properties.lead_text: A listed historical monument with an impressive art collection.
properties.description:
At the Fine Arts Museum, you can enjoy Swiss and international art from the 19th and 20th centuries. The mixture of modern and old rooms, as well as the lighting effects, add dimension and depth. The wealth of the permanent exhibition alone is impressive.

Here, you can enjoy the works of Léopold Robert and Le Corbusier, as well as the René and Madeleine Junod Collection (works by Van Gogh, Derain, Rouault, among others). 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Straw Museum Wohlen
properties.lead_text: Learn about straw products in a fun way.
properties.description:
In the 19th century, the Freiamt region was famous for the quality of its straw products – from fine baskets to exquisite hat braiding. Most of them were exported around the world. This means that you will delight yourself with lots of interesting shapes made completely of straws. 

You can learn everything about this intriguing piece of local history at the Straw Museum in Wohlen. You will see that the guided tours are quite fascinating. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum im Kornhaus (mik), Rorschach
properties.lead_text: An adventure museum for the goal-oriented mediation.
properties.description:
This mik aims to make you think about daily topics, like education, history and politics. There are also 50 interactive and educational study places. Here, you can learn about illusion, magic, math, communication, writing and optical phenomena. 

You will put all your senses to work as you will learn through practice. This is a museum perfect for all ages and for families as well. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Villa dei Cedri Museum
properties.lead_text: Enjoy art and nature in a magnificent blend.
properties.description:
Villa dei Cedri Museum is actually the Municipal Museum for Modern and Contemporary Art. The Park around it is a living example of an English-style park of the 19th century. 

Besides admiring the works of art from the museum, you can visit the vineyard, as it adjoins the park. There is also a library next to the museum and a small playground. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Regional Surselva Museum
properties.lead_text: See what life was like in the Surselva in earlier times.
properties.description:
The Regional Surselva Museum shows exhibits on five floors where you can see how people worked in the old days. There is also a special museum tour for children that encourages touching and trying out antique objects.   

The adventure workshops are dedicated to various topics to intensify the experience of history. You will be invited on an “Alpine walking tour with butter-churning workshops”, to a laundry day filled with hard work of the traditional kind, or to bake “snake bread”. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Uri House of Art, Altdorf
properties.lead_text: Enjoy contemporary art in a fun way!
properties.description:
The Uri House of Art has three temporary exhibitions on contemporary art per year. The art education offers a varied program with numerous events for children and adults. This means that it is a great place to visit together with the whole family. 

Thanks to the generosity of Max Dätwyler, the work of the Uri artist Heinrich Danioth (1896 - 1953) in the newly built Danioth Pavilion receives the adequate appreciation. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Vallorbe Iron and Railway Museum
properties.lead_text: This is more than a museum: it is a lively place that never sleeps!
properties.description:
Situated on the site of the "Grandes Forges", which was used from 1495 onwards, the Vallorbe Iron and Railway Museum displays a number of machines driven by four huge paddle wheels powered by the river Orbe. 

The forge is the main attraction in the museum. When it is working, it is noisy and hot, providing an unusual atmosphere. Audiovisual displays, temporary exhibitions, pictures and working model trains complete the experience. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Rathaus Sempach
properties.lead_text: Discover the local history in a newly designed museum.
properties.description:
The Museum Rathaus Sempach welcomes you with a diverse exhibition spread on four floors. Here, you will get a close insight into the economic, religious, political and social life in Sempach. The objects you will find here date from Late Middle Ages to contemporary time.

Make sure you do not miss the attic room as it is devoted to the 1386 Battle of Sempach and the national hero Winkelried. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Centovalli and Pedemonte Museum
properties.lead_text: Explore interesting collections that are spread over 20 rooms!
properties.description:
The Centovalli and Pedemonte Museum opened its doors to the public in 1989. Here, you can discover an old nut oil mil and a wood-fired baking oven. The exhibits are spread on three floors. The first floor is dedicated to the traditional kitchen.

On the second floor, you will see the typical cloth shoes worn by people in the ancient times. On the third floor, you will discover tools used by people in their everyday life. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Napoleon Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover a tastefully furnished castle and a large park.
properties.description:
A fortification complex has existed on the Arenenberg Mountain from the middle of the 15th century onwards. Arenenberg Castle was owned by patrician families until it was sold to Hortense de Beauharnais, the adopted daughter and sister-in-law of Napoleon I who altered it in the style of the French Empire.

Nowadays Napoleon Museum prides with interiors and furnishings nearly completely preserved. You have free access to all rooms of the castle. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and is open year-round.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Maison de la Rivière
properties.lead_text: "Plunge" into this educational centre dedicated the world of nature and water.
properties.description:
The Maison de la Rivière (House of the River) is a unique place with interactive exhibitions inside and learning activities outside. Here, you can enjoy a lake aquarium, educational pond, giant tactile wall, birdhouses and much more. 

The permanent exhibition reveals the local cultural and natural heritage. Make sure you do not miss the main attraction - Jacques Piccard’s submarine. You can also go through the observation channel and see the fish that swim in the river. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Baud
properties.lead_text: A paradise for lovers of mechanical musical instruments.
properties.description:
The unique collection that you can find at the Museum Baud was created by a family of enthusiasts whose passion has also been their craft and profession for three generations. The exhibition contains 55 objects. 

Here, you can analyse pianos, fairground organs, music boxes and other mechanical instruments. This world vibrates, whistles and lives to the rhythm of another age. Guided tours take approximately one hour. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Wine Museum Sierre
properties.lead_text: Have fun and learn interesting things about grapes.
properties.description:
Located in the heart of the Valais, the Wine Museum is divided into two parts: one within the Château de Villa at Sierre and the other in the winegrowing village of Salgesch. The Wine Museum at Sierre is devoted to temporary themed exhibitions.

The Wine Museum at Salgesch presents the different facets of the region’s winemaking tradition in a colourful and playful manner, including the role of the soil, the grape-picking season, the mysteries of cellaring, different ways of drinking and the image of wine. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Espace Horloger de la Vallée
properties.lead_text: Discover the current productions by the main watchmaking companies in Joux Valley.
properties.description:
The farmers-watchmakers in this rough region of Joux Valley have produced watches and measuring instruments for centuries. The objects exhibited at the hall of watchmaking history in Joux Valley let you discover the beginnings of watchmaking in this region. 

You are immersed in an innovative museography featuring new technologies. You will get to see a presentation of the watchmaking professions on touch pads, 3D films, and a virtual game (Ludotemps). Here, you can assemble your own watch and obtain information about its parts and their functions. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and includes interactive tablets that present the watchmaking professions in a fun way.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art Museum St. Gallen and Art Zone Lokremise
properties.lead_text: An Art Museum and Art Zone of international renown.
properties.description:
The Art Museum houses an abundant collection of paintings and sculptures from the Late Middle Ages through to the present. The Kunstzone (art zone) in the Lokremise, the second «venue» of the Kunstmuseum, serves as a culture lab for contemporary art.

The Lokremise is an urban building – the largest surviving locomotive ring depot in Switzerland and thus a monument of national importance. Not only it retains its industrial history but can also be used for contemporary culture. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: NMB New Museum Biel
properties.lead_text: A versatile and attractive museum of History, Art and Archaeology.
properties.description:
The NMB is a very interesting museum as it covers different areas: history, art and archaeology. In the two adjacent buildings, the "Schwab" and "Neuhaus", the NMB hosts varied exhibitions on the cultural history of the region.

Here, you can enjoy pieces that date from prehistoric times up to the present days. You can also learn about the history of cinema. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art Gallery Interlaken
properties.lead_text: Discover an interesting combination of historical architecture with a new building.
properties.description:
The Art Gallery of Interlaken will amaze you as soon as you get close to it. You will discover the old authority building combined with a new building. The multi-functional art gallery hall with a bar on the ground floor convinces by aesthetics and functionality. 

With its professional equipment it is suitable as a performance area for concerts, theatres, readings, film and video presentations and also as a congress, seminar and meeting place. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Herisau
properties.lead_text: All you need to learn about the cultural history of Herisau.
properties.description:
The Museum Herisau reveals different aspects of Herisau's cultural history from the Middle Ages to modern times. The exhibitions can be found in the former guildhall of Appenzell Ausserrhoden. You will be astonished by the way the knights lived in their castles. 

There are many things to amaze you. You will delight yourself with unique objects that illustrate the history of education, as well as exquisite painted furniture. You can also take a glimpse into Robert Walser's original documents. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Arbon Castle Museum
properties.lead_text: Find here the largest local and regional history museum in the Thurgau region.
properties.description:
The Arbon Castle Museum hosts a modern permanent exhibition that takes you on an exciting journey through time. There are 5,500 years of fascinating settlement history on Lake Constance.

This impressive time period is documented with many original finds, true to scale models, pictures and photos. Different exhibits in the mighty tower showcase everyday life and the society of bygone times. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and includes temporary special exhibitions for a fascinating new experience.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Valaisian Suonen Museum
properties.lead_text: Dedicated to issues pertaining to the ancient irrigation channels.
properties.description:
The Valaisian Suonen museum is located in the “Painted House”, a building from the 17th century that is a protected monument. In the exhibition area of 270 square metres, you can retrace the history of the Suonen over the centuries, from the Romans to the present. 

On the four floors, you basically embark on a journey into the past. “Suonen” are mainly old, narrow channels, which for centuries carried water from distant glacier streams to the rain-starved Valaisan valleys. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Heidegg Castle
properties.lead_text: Discover the history and culture centre of the Seetal valley.
properties.description:
Heidegg Castle is a living museum in which you learn stories and customs of aristocratic families, with the spirit of the past further rekindled. You can also take a stroll in the large park with its beautiful rose garden.

The castle hosts regular events in the context of history and culture centre of the Seetal valley. Inside the history-steeped walls and rooms, you can immerse in the 800-year-old history of the castle, its surroundings and life at that time. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kunstmuseum Thurgau and Ittinger Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover the home to communities of monks over many centuries.
properties.description:
The Ittinger Museum explores the history of the location and the peculiarities of the Carthusian order. The frescos in the rococo church tell the story of Saint Bruno, who founded the Carthusian order in the Middle Ages. 

The Kunstmuseum Thurgau, with its high-calibre collection and attractive temporary exhibitions, offers a fascinating counterpoint to the idyllic past of the former monastery. Among other things, it houses the legacies of Adolf Dietrich, Carl Roesch and Hans Krüsi. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Diorama Bethlehem
properties.lead_text: Discover the Christmas story in amazing illustrations.
properties.description:
Diorama Bethlehem is focused on the Christmas story. You will follow along the entire path, from the announcement to the shepherds, the scene of the birth of Christ and the arrival of the three kings, till the flight into Egypt.

You will delight yourself with over 450 wood-carved figures wearing oriental costumes. You will see that the reproduction of the environs of Bethlehem is extremely realistic. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Cultural History Museum Grenchen
properties.lead_text: Find out about the history of industrialisation and which were its consequences.
properties.description:
The Cultural History Museum focuses on the region of Grenchen. You will discover the impact of industrialisation on different historical periods. They are beautifully exposed in the "Vom Bauerndorf zu Industriestadt" - a modernly designed exhibition.

You will see how people used to live and where they worked. You will also get a glimpse of the watchmaking industry, specific to the "Golden Age". 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Brother Klaus Museum
properties.lead_text: A museum dedicated to Brother Klaus.
properties.description:
Brother Klaus, father and hermit, farmer and visionary, politician and mystic, is Switzerland's only saint. The museum is located in one of the most beautiful patrician homes of the Canton of Obwalden. Built in 1784, the villa with its Baroque garden is in its original condition for the most part. 

The basics – along with continually new special exhibitions on attractive topics – lure enthusiastic visitors from both at home and abroad. Here, contemporary contributions mingle with the historical past. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Military Aviation Payerne
properties.lead_text: Amaze yourself with the rapid evolution of military aircraft.
properties.description:
From the Vampire through the Venom and Hunter to the Mirage III, the Museum of Military Aviation displays high-performance aircraft. You will discover the rapid progress made in subject matters of aerodynamics, weapon systems or materials. 

Located in Payerne, the main Air Force base of Swiss F/A-18 operations, the museum shows the military aeronautics of the second half of the 20th century. On demand, you can opt for guided visits. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass. You can also see the original Flight Simulator of the Mirage III in action.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Clocks and Mechanical Musical Instruments
properties.lead_text: Measure time in a fun and unique way!
properties.description:
The Museum of Clocks and Mechanical Musical Instruments is located in the main house of the Wichterheer Manor in Oberhofen. It was established in 1518. Here, you can discover timepieces and clocks from seven centuries. 

You will be conducted through the magnificent collection. You can listen to the mechanical musical instruments and learn a lot about measuring time and clock technology. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: MEG Ethnography Museum Geneva
properties.lead_text: Visit one of the largest ethnographic collections in Switzerland.
properties.description:
MEG Ethnography Museum prides itself on more than 80,000 museum exhibits in a new building by the Zurich architects Marco Graber and Thomas Pulver. Inside you discover a bright, enlightening and expansive cosmos in which the treasures of MEG are set out to their best advantage.

The permanent exhibition entitled "The archives of human differences" clearly depicts how the different cultures have evolved and drawn apart over time. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Jean-Jacques Rousseau Museum Val-de-Travers
properties.lead_text: Explore the depths of Jean-Jacques Rousseau!
properties.description:
Jean-Jacques Rousseau Museum is located precisely in the area where Rousseau used to walk. You will get to see half of his apartment dating from the 15th century that is completely intact. The exhibition is placed in his former kitchen and bedroom. 

Here, you will discover pictures of landscapes, prohibited books, his portrait in pastel, details regarding his passion for botany and so on. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Brasilea Foundation - Collection Walter Wüthrich
properties.lead_text: Explore the collection of paintings by the Austrian painter Franz Josef Widmar.
properties.description:
The Collection Walter Wüthrich of the Brasilea Foundation offers a permanent exhibition focused on the works of Franz Josef Widmar. Here, you will discover over 500 of his paintings, so schedule enough time to savour each one of them. 

You will be mesmerised by the shapes and colours, and you do not need to be a specialist in order to enjoy this collection. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Walser House Bosco/Gurin
properties.lead_text: Gather interesting information on the culture of the Walser people.
properties.description:
Walser House is a former association founded to preserve the history and culture of Bosco Gurin, and of the Walser settlements in neighbouring Italy. Nowadays, it functions as a small museum. Since the opening of the museum in 1938, the number of exhibits has steadily increased. The exhibition also includes a barn and a garden. 

The museum aims to chronicle the German vernacular of the Walsers, the vanishing language of Gurin that you will actually hear. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Roman Museum, Lausanne-Vidy
properties.lead_text: Discover the story of the Roman city of Lousonna.
properties.description:
The Roman Museum prides itself on a permanent collection and annual temporary exhibitions. Here, you will discover vestiges of a wealthy Roman residence containing an atrium and painted rooms. 

You will learn how people used to live twenty centuries ago and be amazed by the rooms equipped with floor heating. There are also special workshops for children all year round. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex). The admission to the museum is free for all visitors on the first Saturday of each month.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Toggenburg Sound Trail
properties.lead_text: Explore the natural life of Toggenburg through music.
properties.description:
Toggenburg Sound Trail is a hiking path on which you can play natural "music" at 27 sound points. It leads in three stages from Alp Sellamatt near Alt St. Johann to Oberdorf near Wildhaus. You can walk the stages separately in a few hours or complete the trail all in one go within a day. 

There are several different ways to walk the sound trail. You should allow between one and three hours to walk the stages. With the sound experiments and a rest break, you should allow for a total of six hours for the whole trail.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and is open from June to October.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Landshut Castle
properties.lead_text: Discover a unique moated castle surrounded by a vast English-style garden.
properties.description:
The Landshut Castle prides itself on historical rooms, paintings with hunting motifs and hunting trophies. The purpose is to introduce you to the style of living from the 17th to the 19th century. 

In the castle building and adjacent granaries, the Swiss Museum of Wildlife and Hunting houses a collection of historical hunting weapons and tools that is unique in Europe. Make sure you do not miss the outstanding presentation on the evolution of the hunting horn. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Coal Mine at Käpfnach
properties.lead_text: Take a fun trip for the whole family and discover interesting facts about the history of mining.
properties.description:
The Coal Mine at Käpfnach is located in the former coal repository. Here, you will get a fascinating insight into the 100-year old mining tradition in Horgen-Käpfnach and discover how coal is formed. 

You will be delighted to see films, display boards and exhibits of mining lamps, tool and fossils. This is followed by a 1.4-kilometre rail ride through the dark mining tunnel, a thrilling adventure for the entire family. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kunsthaus Langenthal
properties.lead_text: Discover an interesting art museum with a focus on modern art.
properties.description:
The Kunsthaus Langenthal is housed in a building designed by the architect Joseph Purtschert between 1790-1808. The initial purpose of the house was to serve as a market, with its octagonal layout and four clock faces.

Here, you can enjoy four art exhibitions each year that focus on the latest trends of contemporary art. You will discover not only Swiss artists, but international ones as well. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Gallery Noah's Ark
properties.lead_text: A great place to visit with the entire family!
properties.description:
The Gallery Noah's Ark is like a magnet for children, but also for adults who want to experience something different. Here, you will discover a huge collection of stuffed animals. It is a great way for children to see animals and get close to them without any risks.  

You will find wolves, tigers, bears, and birds that you usually see on television or read about in books. Most important, they look really lifelike. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Kleines Klingental, Basel
properties.lead_text: Amaze yourself with these original medieval sculptures.
properties.description:
The Museum Kleines Klingental opened its doors to the public in 1939. It is housed in a very interesting place, the former Klingental Dominican Convent. This means that you will also enjoy the historical cleric rooms.

Here, you will see original medieval sculptures brought from the Basel Cathedral, you will see what the city looked like in the 17th century thanks to the scaled model, and also learn about the history of the Convent. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Art Museum Glarus
properties.lead_text: Discover an incredible exhibition venue for art!
properties.description:
The Art Museum Glarus was built in 1952. The architecture is quite interesting, as it focuses on modernist forms that are highly minimalist. The museum is known to be the place where Swiss and international artists come to find their inspiration. 

Here, you will find interesting pieces of art, like sculptures, paintings, and drawings. The works of artists like Monica Bonvicini, Urs Fischer, Urs Lüthi, Nina Beier, Hanspeter Hofmann, Adrien Missika, or Kilian Rüthemann will amaze you. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Wilderness Park Sihlwald
properties.lead_text: Embrace a unique combination of forest, wilderness and animals!
properties.description:
The Wilderness Park Sihlwald is home to the Sihlwald forest, a visitor centre with a museum and the Langenberg park. You will find yourself among old giant trees and gnarly deadwood. Since nature has been largely left to its own devices, the area has been increasingly transformed into an unspoilt forest wilderness. 

Make sure you do not miss the animal park. Here you will see wild animals like bears, beavers and lynx in giant, natural enclosures that can be observed as they move around their natural habitat. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Jurassica Museum Porrentruy
properties.lead_text: Discover Jura's natural heritage!
properties.description:
The Jurassica Museum, together with the Botanic Garden, offers a unique experience. At the Gardens, which are more than 200 years old, you can discover interesting plants. The architectural setting is as amazing as the exhibits. 

Make sure you do not miss the Greenhouse as this is where you can find orchids and cacti. At the museum, you will see the paleontological heritage of the area. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Foundation akku Emmen
properties.lead_text: Learn interesting things about public education and art education.
properties.description:
The Foundation akku Emmen aims to offer a high-quality environment where you can learn interesting stuff. Here, you can discover useful information regarding the educational and cultural systems.  

You will be introduced to aspects about how to hold and manage an art collection. You can also discover a cultural meeting platform for Emmen and surroundings. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Lake Museum Kreuzlingen
properties.lead_text: Discover the history of navigation and fishing on Lake Constance.
properties.description:
The Lake Museum Kreuzlingen is a great place to visit if fishing is one of your passions. Not only fishermen are welcomed, but everybody who wants to discover the beauty of the lake and the marvellous surroundings.

The special attraction here is represented by the paintings of Lake Constance and surrounding landscapes. The museum was built in 1717 as a granary, wine cellar and winepress of the Augustine Monastery in Kreuzlingen. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Thurauen Nature Center
properties.lead_text: Visit the largest floodplain in Central Switzerland.
properties.description:
Admire around 50 species of both butterflies and birds at the Thurauen Nature Center! In addition, it is also the main spawning ground of the European tree frog and the Rana Dalmatina agile frog. Several beaver families thrive here as well. 

You can also delight yourself with remarkable plants, including gracious silver willows and a variety of orchids and fringed gentians. The interactive exhibition will take you on a journey through time and habitat and on the adventure trail you will learn about the heart of the riparian forest. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of the Countryside Saanen
properties.lead_text: Explore the evolution of the Saanen region!
properties.description:
The Museum of the Countryside Saanen aims to reveal how the Saanenland has developed into a tourist region during the building of the railway (MOB) in 1905. In the last 100 years, the freedom-loving subjects of the Counts von Greyerz have become ski instructors, hoteliers and entrepreneurs. 

You can also see the traditional craftsmanship and Alpine farming, cattle breeding and cheese production, as they play a major role in the industry of this region. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Sursilvan Trun
properties.lead_text: You will discover one of the most beautiful buildings in the Surselva.
properties.description:
The Museum Sursilvan is located in the former monastery courtyard and the seat of the «Grauer Bund» (grey alliance), from which the Canton's name originates. The historical museum includes various collections of folk culture, a collection of weapons and a library. 

You can admire a magnificent beetle, a masterly work with inlays of various native woods in the Abtsstube. There are also two rooms with the original works of painters Alois Carigiet and Matias Spescha. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fortress Vallorbe
properties.lead_text: Explore an interesting World War II Site.
properties.description:
The purpose of Fortress Vallorbe was to defend the Jougne Pass and the French border. Up to 200 men were stationed here. It was built between 1937 and 1941 and was also used during the Second World War. Nowadays, it is part of the military cultural history. 

Here, you can see the defence bunkers with their subterranean tunnels, munitions dumps, rooms for the wounded and the sick, and living quarters. Documentaries and exhibitions offer insight into life in the fortress.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and is open during the summer months.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Brick and Tile Museum Cham
properties.lead_text: A fascinating museum in a forest.
properties.description:
The Brick and Tile Museum is as fascinating for adults as it is for children, so it is a great place to visit together with your family. Here, you can learn how to make bricks and tiles by hand. You will be also amazed by the structural ceramics made from fired clay in the permanent exhibition.

You can mix a traditional museum visit with a relaxing walk, or even a barbecue. There is also a restaurant available for tasty snacks and refreshing beverages. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Paul Gugelmann Museum
properties.lead_text: Marvel at the works of art of Paul Gugelmann!
properties.description:
Despite significant offers, the "poetic machines" of Paul Gugelmann remained unsaleable and you can marvel at them at the Paul Gugelmann Museum. According to the will of the artist, they were incorporated into a foundation in 1994 and opened to the public in 1995. 

Here you will find the works of the artist: metal machines mostly with movable parts. They try to demonstrate, in a playful way with a satirical touch and a lot of flair, the highs and lows of human existence.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Rosenegg
properties.lead_text: Explore an interesting cultural meeting place!
properties.description:
The Museum Rosenegg is actually a former winery from the Baroque period, which was supplemented with a villa-like extension around 1785. On a round tour, you will learn about the history of the monastery and the settlement. However, you may also encounter lectures, readings and musical matinees. 

Make sure you do not miss the exhibition "Hüben und Drüben", which illustrates the specific border issue between Konstanz and Kreuzlingen. In the permanent exhibition "Measure and Weight" you can see historical measuring instruments and scales. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Waldegg Castle
properties.lead_text: Discover the most beautiful country manor of the Solothurn patriciate!
properties.description:
The Waldegg Castle is the place where ambassadors and the aristocracy once frequented. You can immerse yourself in this bygone world and learn of a time when Solothurn was the seat of the French ambassadors.  

You can look inside baroque-furnished salons and massive oil paintings that document former, everyday life. And outdoors, baroque-style premises with orange trees and a vegetable garden invite you to a leisurely stroll. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex)
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum Burghalde
properties.lead_text: Amaze yourself with an extensive collection from the Early Stone Age up to the early industrial epoche.
properties.description:
At the Museum Burghalde, you can discover partial reconstruction of huts, models and original finds that convey lively impressions of the various epochs. In the Icon Department in the enlarged vault, you will see pictures of a special kind. 

There are also Russian Icons that were created between the 16th and 19th Century. A curiosity from the Early-Industry Department is the arguably oldest preserved can of tinned food: a can of peas produced by the Hero company.

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and includes interesting guided tours for groups.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Kunst Halle Sankt Gallen
properties.lead_text: Delight yourself with site-projects and exhibitions from over 400 modern artists from all corners of the world.
properties.description:
The Kunst Halle Sankt Gallen is dedicated to contemporary art since 1985. This museum is above all a place of exhibitions, but it is also an institution dedicated to researching and presenting innovative and important works of art and concepts. 

The main focus is on current works of a younger generation of artists, and socially relevant issues. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Charmey Museum
properties.lead_text: The best place to visit around the New Year.
properties.description:
Charmey Museum prides itself on La Valsainte room, which is the permanent exhibition. The Chartreux monks have been living below Cerniat for more than 700 years and their history is inextricably linked to that of the countryside itself.  

This museum lets you look into their world, discover their spirituality and see what their day-to-day life is like. You can analyse models, reconstructions, photography and objects from the abbey itself. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Johann Jacobs Museum
properties.lead_text: Discover the evolution of human society!
properties.description:
The Johann Jacobs Museum wants to give you a realistic view of the past and present of the world. Instead of focusing on differences, the museum highlights global interdependencies. You will also discover how ambiguous human interactions are.

An interesting aspect of this museum is that it analyses the movement of things and events from all around the globe and through time. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Pro Natura Nature Reserve Centre Villa Cassel – Aletsch Forest
properties.lead_text: Discover a marvellous Villa in a magnificent mountain landscape.
properties.description:
The Pro Natura Centre Aletsch is located in the canton of Valais, right at the nature reserve Aletsch Forest and next to the Aletsch Glacier, the largest glacier of the Alps. Here, you can enjoy an annual special exhibition that reveals interactive and exciting aspects of the Aletsch. 

In the beautiful Alpine garden, you can see over 350 species of plants and an adventure trail. You can also enjoy excursions and guided tours. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Winter Sports Museum Davos
properties.lead_text: A great place for people who love winter sports!
properties.description:
The Winter Sports Museum Davos is located in a former postal building. Here, you will discover an impressive collection dedicated to winter sports. There is a multitude of sports equipments and old documents to explore.

Once you step inside the museum, you will feel like you are on the slope. You can see interesting exhibits like bobsleighs, skates, sledges, skis, curling equipment, and so on. The collection dates from the beginning of the winter sports unit present day. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass and is open every Tuesday and Thursday.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fram Museum Cultural Heritage Einsiedeln
properties.lead_text: Discover the history of Einsiedeln!
properties.description:
Fram Museum opened its doors to the public in 2010. Here, you can discover changing exhibitions that are focused on a variety of topics. There is a permanent exhibition available as well.

The permanent collection focuses on the works of the famous physician and alchemist, Paracelsus. This location can also be rented for different types of events. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Minerals
properties.lead_text: Discover over 1,500 minerals from all over the world!
properties.description:
The Museum of Minerals, located in Einsiedeln, is definitely a place worth to visit. Here, you can discover an impressive number of over 1,500 specimens that were collected from the entire planet. You will get to see interesting pieces like the quartz from the Alps to the colourful crystals from China and South America.

Make sure you do not miss the special attraction. The fluorescent cabin will help you admire these wonders of the earth in a unique way. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Asphalt Mines Travers
properties.lead_text: Learn how asphalt was laboriously mined and exported all over the world.
properties.description:
The Asphalt Mines tell the story of the asphalt deposits that were discovered at La Presta in Val-de-Travers in 1711. Until 1812 the asphalt found there was used only sparingly and mainly in the medical field. 

One kilometre of the underground mines is open to the public. Guided tours show you how the detonation experts worked, how water was pumped out of the deep tunnels and how the asphalt was transported to the surface using horses. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Earth Science Museum Martigny
properties.lead_text: Discover the mines from the Alpes and the underground world!
properties.description:
The Earth Science Museum was opened in 2000. Here, you can discover an interesting permanent collection and temporary exhibitions from institutions or private collectors. Each year, a cycle of conferences with novelties from the field of Earth Sciences is organised.

At the first floor, you can admire minerals from Valais. There are also fluorescent crystals that will amaze you with their shine. At the basement, you will "stumble" upon a reconstructed mine and see how people used to work. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Frog Museum Estavayer
properties.lead_text: Visit a museum that is truly one of a kind!
properties.description:
The Frog Museum prides itself on a collection of 108 stuffed frogs arranged in scenes portraying everyday life in the 19th-century. You will see frogs at school, at the barber's, as soldiers in the army, as well as by a game of cards.

The funny collection is the work of François Perrier who created the extraordinary frogs between the years 1848 and 1860, depicting satirical scenes of this very particular era. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Roman Museum Vallon
properties.lead_text: Discover a vast gallo-roman rural residence.
properties.description:
The Roman Museum at Vallon hosts the largest well-preserved mosaic in Switzerland. You will see it on the floor of the banqueting hall. The scenes represented here reveal games in the amphitheatre. The figures you will discover are hexagon medallions, bear, lion, dog, doe, and bull. 

Make sure you do not miss the second mosaic that represents the "Bacchus and Ariane". You will find it in a room with 15 bronze statuettes. The permanent exhibition reveals a model of a Roman villa. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: St. Gotthard National Museum
properties.lead_text: A museum located on a 2,100-meter-high mountain pass.
properties.description:
The National Museum of the San Gottardo is extremely interesting, considering the unusual location. It is in a building dating back to 1834 and used to be not only a customs house but also a rest stop where weary travellers could sleep before continuing their dangerous journey.

The museum demonstrates the history of the mountain pass as well as the evolution of transportation and its cultural, historic, political and anthropological importance. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Abegg-Foundation Riggisberg
properties.lead_text: An institute of art history which devotes its research to early textiles and applied art.
properties.description:
The exhibition of the Abegg-Foundation features early textiles as well as applied art, such as sculptures, paintings, gold work, ceramics, bronze and glass, from Europe, the Mediterranean region and the Near East, spanning the centuries from Antiquity to 1800. 

The permanent exhibition does justice to both highlights by trying to depict the mutually beneficial influences selecting artworks of various genres. Therefore, the artworks do not stand in isolation but are embedded in historical and artistic surroundings. The collection has been assembled under topographic and chronological viewpoints. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Psychiatry
properties.lead_text: Learn more about the evolution from madhouse to modern clinic.
properties.description:
The Museum of Psychiatry aims to reveal the progress made by science when it comes to diagnosing patients. Here, you will find out more about the practices specific to medieval times, the construction of the madhouse and eventually the evolution towards the modern psychiatric university clinic. 

Walter Morgenthaler was the one who came up with the idea of this museum. He noticed the importance of the objects in the clinic archive. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Strauhof Literature Museum
properties.lead_text: Embrace literature in a dedicated space.
properties.description:
The Strauhof Literature Museum hosts three major exhibitions yearly. Their main topic is the examination of the works of certain authors from different points of view. You will get to experience this approach not only in written form but also in stage space.

Your imagination will be put to test here, as you will experience classic stories displayed in a modern way. For ten days, the artists have the opportunity to create and present their ideas. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Natural History Museum St. Gallen
properties.lead_text: Discover the local flora and fauna of St. Gallen.
properties.description:
The Natural History Museum is housed in a contemporary and functional new building with a distinctive façade of corrugated concrete. The oldest exhibit in the museum will definitely give you chills: it is a crocodile from the Nile dating back to 1623. 

Here, you will discover an impressive number of exhibits: 111,000 invertebrates, 50,000 geological objects, 11,0000 plants, 13,000 vertebrates, and 25,000 fossils. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Zentrum Vögele Kultur
properties.lead_text: Embrace issues of our time with current thematic exhibitions.
properties.description:
The centre Vögele Kultur was founded by the Swiss entrepreneur Charles Vögele in 1976. The museum is dedicated to topical issues of our time like science, philosophy and politics. It offers theme exhibitions from the wide field of art and culture. 

You will see that the museum building is a world-famous architectural sculpture with a design unusual for Switzerland. The American flair goes hand-in-hand with the new exhibition concept. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Museum of Photography, Winterthur
properties.lead_text: A unique European center of excellence for photographic art.
properties.description:
The Museum of Photography is a Swiss mecca of photography located in a converted factory. There are changing exhibitions and permanent collections of contemporary and classic photographic art. You can view police photographs, industrial snapshots, dams being built, and medical photographs.

The permanent collections include a hall for photographs by contemporary artists with exhibitions of work by Lewis Baltz, William Eggleston, Nan Goldin and many other artists. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Fishing Museum Caslano
properties.lead_text: Learn all you need to know about fishing!
properties.description:
The Fishing Museum, external section of the Malcantone Museum, is situated in Caslano. The museum, inaugurated in 1993, is in a small house in Via Campagna, surrounded by a park. The permanent exhibition includes hundreds of objects distributed in six rooms on two floors. 

In the park, where the museum organises a highly appreciated fish-tasting event every year, you can see three old fishing boats, two from Ceresio and one from Verbano, with their relative equipment. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Children Science Museum (Espace des Inventions)
properties.lead_text: The place where children get to discover the sciences in a playful way.
properties.description:
The Children Science Museum is located in an enchanting place. You will discover it in the middle of the incomparable Vallée de la Jeunesse, with its serpentine-shaped alley lined with flowers and playgrounds. This building houses an interactive science museum for children. 

The elegant building seeks to enter into a dialogue with the flora of the area and, with its roof being a mere twelve centimetres thin, departs from the usual appearance of a massive concrete structure.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Ritterhaus Bubikon
properties.lead_text: Discover the best preserved former commandery of the Order of St. John in Europe.
properties.description:
The Ritterhaus has a rich history that dates back to the year 1192. The Ritterhaus has been owned by the Ritterhaus Society (“Ritterhausgesellschaft”) since 1936, the year of its foundation. The Society managed to preserve this remarkable piece of medieval art of building by turning it into a museum.

Here, you will discover the history of the Ritterhaus and the various orders of knights. Since 1959 the Ritterhaus has been designated a National Historic Monument. Today it is a well-known meeting place and has attracted nationwide interest.
properties.area_of_validity: This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Natural History Museum Lucerne
properties.lead_text: Discover insights into the secrets of the world of plants and animals.
properties.description:
The Natural History Museum never fails to surprise you. There is a permanent biological exhibition that shows flora and fauna from Central Switzerland, and you can see a variety of live animals in aquariums and terrariums.

There are rotating panels that show butterflies and insects from all over the world. Other attractions are an educational woodland trail with real tree trunks and a mushroom computer. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).
properties.area_of_validity: Admission is complimentary for holders of a valid Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Swiss Museum of Transportation
properties.lead_text: The Swiss Museum of Transportation showcases the development of transport and mobility.
properties.description:
Welcome to the most popular museum in Switzerland! The history of mobility and communication is documented in exhibitions and theme parks, with simulations and films. No matter your age, you are going to love the interactive stations, games and airplanes you can sit in.

Here, you can discover more than 3,000 objects spread over an exhibition area of 2,000 square meters. (That's 22 US football fields!) The museum showcases the development of traffic on roads, by rail, on water, in the air, and in space.

Enjoy a 50 percent discount on admissions with the Swiss Travel Pass or Swiss Travel Pass Flex.

properties.title: Saanen
properties.lead_text: Saanen is renowned for its artistically intricate silhouettes and other rural handicrafts.
properties.description:
On your way south towards the French-speaking Lake Geneva region, Saanen is the last village where residents speak German. To learn more about silhouettes and other handicrafts, have a look at the local "Museum of the Countryside."

Also, Saanen is famous among food-lovers for its finely-sliced Alpine cheese. It was here in this idyllic Alpine setting that eminent violinist Sir Yehudi Menuhin (1916-1999) founded his Menuhin Festival nearly 60 years ago.

Saanen is part of the Grand Train Tour of Switzerland.

properties.title: Lake Lucerne Cruise on the Panoramic "Saphir" Yacht
properties.lead_text: See Lake Lucerne from aboard a yacht during a one-hour round trip from Lucerne.
properties.description:
During this one-hour cruise, you can lean back on the comfortable and generous seating areas and savour the fantastic views of lake, city and mountain scape – including professional audio guide in 11 languages.

Holders of the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) enjoy a discount.

images.title: Lake Lucerne Cruise on the Panoramic "Saphir" Yacht
images.description: Lake Lucerne Cruise on the Panoramic "Saphir" Yacht

properties.title: St. George's Abbey
properties.lead_text: This historic abbey in picturesque Stein am Rhein is among Switzerland's best preserved.
properties.description:
The St. George's Abbey is quite complex. Here, you will find a chapter house, the cloister, the summer and winter refectory, a hall used for celebrations, a dormitory, the abbot's parlours and the abbot's chapel.

The late Gothic cloister as well as the celebration hall are definitely worth taking time for. They were set up by David von Winkelsheim, the last abbot. Furthermore, make sure not to miss the fresco paintings dating from around 1500. 

This attraction is included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex).

properties.title: Brissago Islands – Isola Grande
properties.lead_text: The botanical gardens on this island are a subtropical paradise.
properties.description:
The mild climate at Lago Maggiore is unique in Switzerland, enabling subtropical plants to flourish out in the open on Isola Grande, the larger one of the Brissago Islands. The botanical garden of the Canton of Ticino houses some 1,700 plant species.

From lotus blossoms, giant sequoias and bald cypresses to perennial banana plants and even eucalyptus trees: You will find plants from nearly all of the subtropical regions of Asia, South Africa, America, Australia and the islands of Oceania. In the botanical park, there is a half kilometre long nature trail dedicated to the world of plants. You will be able to learn about the various plants and their origins while the kids can follow a treasure hunt.

properties.title: Montbovon
properties.lead_text: Montbovon is a romantic village on the River Sarine and a delightful departure point for many enjoyable excursions.
properties.description:
A regional train links Les Avants with the picturesque village of Gruyères, famous for its fine cheese. Between April and November, GoldenPass trains take you from Montreux directly to Broc and the Nestlé/Callier chocolate factory.

As a popular background to many Bollywood films, Montbovon has long found fame in India. And finally, Montbovon is part of the Grand Train Tour of Switzerland.

properties.title: Matter Valley between Zermatt and Stalden
properties.lead_text: The Matter Valley between Zermatt and Stalden offers a remarkable range of scenic splendours.
properties.description:
Think eternal ice, deep ravines and rugged rock faces. Or 29 peaks at 4000 metres above sea, plus flowering Alpine meadows. You will see the highest altitude vineyards in Europe and superb ski slopes.

Running through the valley is the wild and foaming River Matter Vispa, which converges with the Saaser Vispa at Stalden before joining the Rhone at Visp.

The Matter Valley is part of the Grand Train Tour of Switzerland.

properties.title: Furka Steam Railway
properties.lead_text: The Furka mountain route by railway takes you back to the golden era of steam in Switzerland.
properties.description: The two hour journey leads from Realp to the magnificent mountain landscape of the Central Alps and on over the historic route of Glacier Express to Oberwald in Canton Valais. An intermediate stop at the Furka station takes travellers to the route's highest point of 2,160 metres a.s.l.
